review_content: Fles 33cl thuis. Bitter, hoppig, grassig, citrus, tropisch fruit, malttonen, licht droog. (14-8-2021).
Gyllengul klar vätska med fingerstjockt vitt skum. Aromer av säd och blommig rabatt. Stabil men tunn maltbas som möter en rejäl och välbalanserad beska. Lätt värmande och törstsläckande.

Can thanks to Chris. Amber with a frothy, white head. Aroma of overripe peaches, lychee, flowers. Taste is bitter with a dollop of lychee at the end. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation. Not exactly refreshing or enticing, but quite drinkable.

Bevuta alla spina.
Aroma con forte presenza di luppolo a un po' di tropicale.
Bella schiuma persistente un po'ba pezzettoni. Colore biondo miele.
Lieve amaro che cresce un po' col retrogusto. Diminuita la nota tropicale dell'aroma. Un po'bdi cereale.
FgP
Högt fluffigt skum. Klart bärstensfärgad. Svag doft med humle, malt, en hint av bränt bröd? Mellanfyllig, något söt torkad frukt, något brödig, lite sälta. Tydlig beska

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; from the fridge. Drinked @home

Old note, for counting purpose : correct English IPA
Full mouth feel, decent hop profile, frothy head, pine bite, a bit of citrus, not spectacular but worth trying from Goose Island.
Plechovka z americanbeer. Chmelova mierne horka vona. Jantarova farba. Chut horkasta mierne drsna mierne kovova az stiplava.

@ Havregatan 20210507. Bottle (355 ml ) from Systembolaget. Hoppy, fruity, grassy and citrusy with grapefruit, mid sweet, medium body with a watery to oily texture.
The finish is bitter and fruity.
Cerveza de estilo Indian Pale Ale, muy correcta, buena aroma y sabor. Compensada sin florituras.
Aroma 7. Appearance 5. Taste 7. Palate 3. Overall 14. Grapefruit and bitter hops aroma. Fruity, pine, malt, and bitter taste. Dry aftertaste.

355ml bottle from local store. Pours slighty dark orangish golden, almost perfectly clear with some soapy white foam on top and moderate lacing. Aroma is mainly piney, resinous hops and fruits, citrus. Taste is refreshing with lots of piney, earthy and resinous hops, some nice fruits hints mostly citrus, lemon grapefruit some orange and mango, and a pronounced bitter hops finish that is never too much and makes it so drinkable. Surprisingly sweet and drinkable though, even if not one of the most fruited ipas. Body is slightly thin and a bit light, a bit oily texture with average carbonation. Not the strongest at 5.9% abv. Very drinkable and could have so much more of it. Nice one.

Goose Island IPA

Yellow golden pour lots of bubbles rising to surface, 2 then 1 finger head like meringue pie - large bubbles like dish soap until diminishing. 

Lemon like floral notes, clean aromatic which seamlessly melt into the first mouthful.  Bubble continuation, upstream. 

Not overly bitter, so a good balance of hop vs malt.  Lemon zest in taste, also maybe a pine or coriander?

Finish is smooth on the tongue, not too strong. 
If ABV was higher I could see a person needing 
A designated driver with consumption of this beer. 

Thumbs up

330 ml imported can. Pours dark golden with large head. Aroma, strong and fruity. Taste- dominantly poor quality hops, with marmalade, citrus peel, weak malt, all with a muddled mouthfeel that leaves a sour coating on the tongue. This is a mass produced product made to a budget and not a carefully crafted brew. It is certainly not an English IPA, it lacks the complex malt base and earthy notes, the fruity hops in this are far too dominant. Have yet to have a decent English IPA from a non English brewer. Drain Poured the other three of the four pack bought. Sink smelled like citrus vomit for days.
Bottle, small stable bubbly head, clear quite deep orange color, aroma of orange, apricot and peach, fruity light malty flavor with a medium strong mellow herbal bitterness. Good and satisfying.
Gusto amaro deciso quasi acido, retrogusto luppolato secco e amaro, ottima carbonazione.

Bottle. Clear golden with white head. The aroma has notes of tropical fruits, mango, toffee, citrus, orange, wet hops, malt. The flavor is mild sweet and mild bitter with notes of tropical fruits, citrus, orange, toffee, malt, some alcohol. Medium-bodied. Classic and pleasant IPA.

Lockdown March 2001 - the day we ordered pizza from Bella Roma in Woolston. Small brown bottle, filtered, from a BeerHawk UK box. I always expect not to like this, and always end up being pleasantly surprised at how tasty and drinkable it is. It's hoppy, but in a tasty not aggressive way. And the malt is fat and juicy. Good marriage.  Works for me. [3.0] 

July 2019 355ml brown bottle, no residue, part of a Goose Island Flight Pack bought in Lidl. Crisply hopped, but quite pleasant. I quite like this. Toasty notes. Inclines more to British than American style of hoppy pale beer. Yeah. Quite satisfying. [3.0] 

June, 2017 355ml bottle, filtered, from Tesco. Sweet and hoppy. You can feel the malt weight, and the hops are also quite weighty. It’s all a little too sweet and weighty all round for me, but I can see why it would please others. The hops are grown on AB-InBev’s Elk Mountain Farm in Adaho - claimed to be the world’s biggest hop farm. I couldn’t quite work out what hops were used in this Goose IPA. Amarillo? [2.9]

Feb, 2003: This has a hoppy profile like the Golden Summer Ales that British brewers are currently making as fast as the British can consume them.  The fruity malt base is a beautiful counterpoint to the citric hops, and tastes rather English if just a little syrupy. The hops seem to be the main thing here, and they are very tasty. I assume the hops are American because we have no hops this sharp in Britain. Very enjoyable.  [3.1]

33 cl can (BBD 2021-01-31), bought from the Co-Op, drunk at home 2020-12-12.

Appearance is a clear deep gold with a very thick, dense slightly cream-coloured head that dissipates pretty bloody slowly. Only a small amount of visible carbonation though. Looks okay - bit uninspiring in colour and the head is bizarrely thick, but it's not unpleasant.

Aroma isn't brilliant. Soapy is the first word that comes to mind. There's some lemon and a fair hit of pine, but it's undeniably soapy. Difficult to pick up much more. Not great - poorly balanced and although I don't hate the dominant note, it's not exactly one of my favourites either...

Taste is better in that it's just uninspiring. Again, lemon and a fair whack of pine, and a slightly sweeter note - biscuit? Rounded off with a moderate strength surprisingly botanical bitter finish that really lingers. The hops dominate, which isn't a bad thing in an IPA, but it's just quite bland. At least it's not soapy.

Palate is okay. Medium-light body, faintest amount of in-mouth carbonation, a bit slick and oily with a moderate length finish (other than the lingering bitterness). I'd really like it to be a bit cleaner and maybe a touch juicier, although that would be pushing a little away from the west coast style this is clearly going for.

Overall? Meh. I don't hate this, although the soap on the nose is a bit off-putting. But pretty much everything about this is uninspiring and I'm certainly not seeking it out. Best I can say is I'd order it over macro-lagers.
Nice IPA. Well balanced. Not bitter. I have had this several times, not sure why it wasn't rated.
Bière achetée chez Saveur Bière. Nez fruité, robe dorée foncée avec un petit collet de mousse persistante. Une belle amertume en bouche, des notes d'agrumes et une belle longueur. Pas mal.

Aroma muy lupulado con ciertos matices frutales. Aspecto poco denso para ser una IPA, bastante transparente pero amarillo intenso. Medio dedo de espuma con retención medio-bajo.
Confirma lo apuntado en boca con ser muy amarga, como señala su 55 IBU, pero con una alta carbonatación, tiene mucho gas como si fuera industrial, lo que le resta suavidad. Tampoco es muy cremosa.
Curiosa, pero no repetiría.
330ml bottle. Light amber shade. Small white head. Faint biscuity malty flavours, tangerine, citrus peel, grassiness. A decent session IPA.

Dorée-bronzée limpide, mousse blanche. Arômes : floral , herbal, agrume, café, caramel, froment. Franche amertume et acidité. Recette sans originalité pour une IPA, un poil trop amère et manquant de saveur.

Sunday, March 15, 2020	6:03 PM	
12 ounce bottle poured to wine glass
Sight: light amber, very hazy, big of white foam that slowly goes away	
Smell: good, fragrant, hoppy, some grains
Taste: very good, bitter	
Feel:  very good, lively carbonation, long finish, bitter aftertaste	
Overall: very good beer, ok to repeat

I am pleasantly surprised
This is one of the nicest IPA's on the market...

I give it 4.5/5 points.

Seems like even a touch of 'oats' in it...

Highly Highly recommended!

It is on my all time ranking top beers. 
PS: i am from Belgium and have tasted more than 360 beers? probably...
Can - golden amber with large lasting frothy white head.  Strong hoppy citrus aroma. Good mouthfeel. Strong hoppy tasting  citrus tang with good finish - fine IPA.

330ml can - Pours a clear amber colour with a good sized mostly lasting off-white head. A hoppy aroma, fruity, floral, pine and some caramel malt notes. A moderately sweet to light sweet taste, sweet malts and caramel flavours with citrus and pine hop flavours in a bitter finish. Nice

Had a money off voucher for it at my local Co-op store so I bought 4 x 330ml cans. Has an interesting aroma, surprising hoppy taste and towards the end I started to like it. Wouldn't be my first choice though.
Una cerveza muy buena, con un color ambarino, presenta notas a flores, hierbas e inclusive caramelo. Con un amargor bastante placentero.

Pored from bottle into a tulip glass, nice head with great retention. Golden hazy color. Fruity and hoppy aroma, typical of average IPA, highlighting some citrus and mango. Balanced bitterness flavor. 
Overall a good well balanced IPA.
Hazy IPA, full body medium hop with notes of grapefruit aroma and piney hops balanced with hint of sweetness
Average ipa, not that it's bad but it does nothing more... I'll have it again if there are no other options

Barril Perfect Draft. Vierte Cobre, Espuma blanca muy persistente que deja aros marcados en las paredes del vaso. Grandísima cerveza que parece una lager con fuerte lúpulo pero sin nada desagradable ni astringente al final. Debo reconocer que no soy de IPA pero esta en concreto, me ha cautivado y seguro encargaré en más ocasiones.

330ml bottle. Pours gold, small white head, good retention. Fruity hop aroma of mango, grapefruit and orange marmalade. Taste is a zesty orange marmalade, slightly resinous, pine, light- biscuit malts. A nice bitterness in the finish. Moderate to full body and moderate carbonation. Lovely and tasty.
Sabor cítrico, buen cuerpo, buena retención y generación de espuma, sabores cítricos, ligera de tomar y buen balance de amargor

Clear golden color with medium white head. Subtle aroma of hops and herbs. Bittersweet taste, hints of orange and pineapple. Bitter aftertaste, light body, a bit of astringency at the end. Nice, but nothing stands out.

Bottle. Pours lightly hazed orange golden with a white head. Aroma: caramel malts, peach, grapefruit, hops. Taste: light to moderate sweet & moderate bitter, light citrus & stonefruit notes. Medium body with moderate carbonation with a bitter finish.

Bottle 0.33L
Slightly hazy golden-to-amber body with a small, frothy, white head, mostly lasting with some nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy hoppy (flowers, grapefruit) and light-to-moderate malty (caramel) aroma with notes of fruits (peach).
Moderate bitter and light-to-moderate sweet flavour; long-lasting bitter finish.
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.

Fles geprobeerd op vakantie, geprobeerd met Inoven. Het is een helder goudgeel bier met een volle witte schuimkraag. Het heeft een hoppige geur. De smaak is hoppig en harsig met een lekker hop bittertje.

A 330ml bottle, pours a amber colour with a white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of citrus & fruits. Light to medium body. Medium to strong bitter finish. A reliable classic which still is a good bet even after the sell out. Enjoyable
Meer en meer een liefhebber van de IPA bieren geworden. Over smaak valt niet te twisten. Deze IPA mijn persoonlijke favoriet. Fris en lekker hopperig met citrus afdronk. Heerlijk!!!!

Lata 44 CL en el Scottland Yard de la Virgen del Camino. 03..08..2020.
Color amarillento velado con espuma blanca persistente.
Sabores maltosos y cereales con suaves toques herbales y citricos con suave amsrgo final.
Cuerpo ligero a medio fácil de beber con algo de gas.
Normal.
Blond bier met voldoende koolzuur. Geur mout, hooi, citrus. Smaak mout, gras, citrus. Medium mondgevoel. Nasmaak mout, fris bitter. Gewoon goed te drinken.

Pours an amber colour ale with a white frothy head 
Notes of citrus fruits and berries fruits 
Cask at thurston fox and hounds
Butelka 0,33 litra, zakupiona w Jumbo. Barwa złota, klarowna. Wysoka i trwała, biała piana. W aromacie dużo żywicy. W smaku wysoka goryczka. Mocno nachmielone.

Lovely frothy head that makes your eyes long for 2020 vision. Quite bitter but easy on the pallette - like Di Vinci slashing into a cup so a sweet concubine can pour the nectar over your forehead.

Alreyt.

12 ounce bottle at The Winking Lizard in Copley, Ohio. Smells hoppy. Light golden in color with white head. Taste hoppy with some citrus. Light bodied and easy to drink. Light hop aftertaste. Easy drinking IPA. Cheers!
Pours amber, marmalade with a wisp of white foam. Smells hoppy with a touch of dried orange peel. Taste hops-malt-hops leaving bitter hop aftertaste.

Colour Amber; nose: hoppy, some distant citrus.
Taste: hop, hop and hop. Love it !

Had this on draft and cans...two different experiances...so I will rate from cans because draft has been terrible!!!!!...From the can...what a fantastic head it pours...really compact and a lovely clear beer underneath...aroma =  subtle hint of citrus / flowers  ...nice lawnmower IPA that goes down lovely in the sun
Just all around solid. Uneventful but solid. A go to when I don't know what I want.
Пить всем любителям горечи. Как и положено ipa горькое аж вяжет, но не сильно ароматное.

750ml can into a glass chalice. A steady pour yielded an abundant, frothy, 2-finger white head riding on a clear, bubbly, old gold body. Exhibited good retention and left gobs of sticky foam clinging to the glass walls. Big citrusy bouquet of grapefruit, lemon and candied orange up front, followed by hints of earthy grass and spice with a finishing note of caramel as it warmed. The taste also evolved as the beer mellowed. Grapefruit, orange and bitter pine faded to grainy malts and a dank earthiness that lingered. Nicely carbonated with a creamy mouthfeel and a dry, astringent finish.

Lovely my golden ale good head. Clings to the glass which I like. Aroma is pleasant without being distinct.  Taste is hops and fruit. Wouldn't realise it was 5.9% without looking. Superb o  a superb by spring g day in the garden.
sicuramente di bell'aspetto, al naso è sicuramente trascurabile, in bocca la nostra è potabile, ma dire buona è un parolone.
大名鼎鼎的鹅岛啤酒。5.9度。金黄色，酒体透明。泡沫不多，消失速度很快。热带水果的风味，入鼻有松针，青草，柑橘，芒果，西瓜的气味。碳酸感较高。甜味和苦味比较平衡。松针，青草，热带水果的口味。回味较苦且停留较长时间。

Cerveza de color amarillo dorado con una pequeña cabeza espumosa blanca.
Aromas ligeros a moderados de lúpulo de cítricos, pinácea y herbales, a ralladura de naranja y suave mango en la nariz junto con algunas notas de maltas de caramelo.
El sabor es muy similar al olor, incluido que los sabores de las maltas de caramelo son un poco más fuertes en el sabor inicial. Los lúpulos están bien equilibrados por las maltas recónditos y solo ayudan con una ligera cantidad de amargor, pero esto persiste en el final.
Esta cerveza es muy fácil de beber porque el sabor es muy equilibrado. Muy agradable.

Overall I would say Goose Island IPA is solid to average IPA.  Nothing offensive about this beer but nothing really stands out either.   I have had it several times and will have to say it is very consistent so you always know what you are getting.
Aroma : Light sweet caramel malt, subtle citrus & piney hoppiness with a grassy/straw note.  Taste : As aroma. Moderatly bitter with semi-dry finish. O.K. but all a tad understated for an IPA

White foamy weak head. Light amber colour. Aroma is moderately malty with fruity (orange, tangerine and peach) with light hoppy notes. Flavor is moderately hoppy with fruity (citrus and plum) with light grass tones, ending in a moderately hoppy finish. Light bodied.
Good session beer. Relatively light (in colour & taste anyway), with some citrus fruitiness that delivers a refreshing finish.

Bottle on the night bus en route home post-FFB. Metallic notes, some herbal, earthy bitterness with a touch of citruses and some sweet malts. Thin in body and got that industrial beer-vibe to it all over. Nah.

Apprezzo molto l' amaro del luppolo che sparisce lentamente ed e questo "il sapore della birra " coraggio poi scalda il cuore...
Grazie Goode Island.

Gylden/meget lys rav, fint hvid skum ved ophældning som svinder helt. Frisk, let sød humlet aroma, ikke voldsom kompleks men ganske fin. Smagen er en lille snært sød, efterfulgt af ganske fin rund humle med en snært af meget bitter som dog holdes nede af de runde/søde. Super fin tørst slukker og ganske fin IPA.
Bottle without a glass in Five Guys Granada. Flavor of citrus, pine, malts. Medium body and bitterness.
De color dorado con una pequeña cabeza espumosa de buena retención. De cuerpo y carbonatación ligera. Aroma herbáceo, lúpulo y malta en menor medida. En boca es refrescante.

Flaska.Pena husta jarova,dlho drzala.Farba zlata az do hneda a cira.Vona svieza citrusova,nachmelena.Chut je svieza citron pomelo miestami pomaranc,prijemne chmelovo-sladova.Telo je stredne plne.Dochut je jemne horkasta,opat citrusova s dotykom sladu.

Christmas dinner fridge leavings from my brother in law. Pours deep golden, with mildly gold thick head that laces. Sweet hay malt, resin hops on those nose. Taste similar hay malt with notable sweetness, mild resin, with some bitterness, and a slight chalkiness. The bitterness and sweetness linger without ever getting along. The beer isn't bad, it just doesn't mesh well.

Servida en botella en el bar 50’s de Piedras Blancas, Asturias. Color dorado, buena retención de espuma. Aroma cítrico y resinoso. Sabor con fondo maltoso y lúpulo muy presente. Cítricos,    Mango. Final amargo. Buena cerveza

Notes: $5 573mL on tap at Fratelli Fresh happy hour, drank 9/Jul/19 and many times since. 5.9%. Possibly brewed in Australia. 
Overall: Cannot see why people rate it so highly. 13
A: Amber body, white head. 3
A: Herbal hops. 6
T: Caramel malt, pine, overripe orange hops. Unbalanced high bitterness with a metallic note. Lasting malt and bitterness. 7
P: Moderate carbonation, above average body. 3
Nice ipa, filtered, little bit heavy, i drunked it at the royal opera with nuts. Hoppy, refreshing, decent.
2nd time trying this. Much better experience. Tropical fruits. Grapefruit. Smooth. Creamy mouthfeel.

Nice slightly amber  coloured IPA. Head thin with medium dissipation. Piney, citrusy nose. Good mouthfeel, pine balanced with citrus and a lingering piney hoppiness. Nice and drinkable. Not as in-your-face as a lot of IPAs: a good modern take on an English IPA.

A mi parecer, una cerveza con mucha espuma y buena retención, bastante carbonatada. Bastante lupulada, con aromas frutales. Bastante ligera para tomar, pero con un amargor al final algo fuerte, pero no desagradable. Se siente mucho el alcohol de la malta, pero no es exagerado. Un olor ligero a piña.

Un amargor poco acompañado de frutalidad, con cierta astringencia que no me convence.
Me esperaba más
Drinkable, but pretty basic.  A good “intro to IPA” beer, but not outstanding.
Drink in New York . Nice package. Not have a strong aroma as the other ipa.

Color dorado claro, poco turbia y burbujeante. Espuma blanca de buena retención, no muy abundante.
Aromas frescos a hierba y lúpulo, con recuerdos a pino. De textura acuosa y cuerpo ligero. Muy refrescante. En el sabor destaca las notas herbales y amargas del lúpulo, con presencia de la malta. Sabores a fruta tropical como el pomelo o la piña bien integrados, con un punto cítrico. Final amargo.
12oz Flasche. Gelb sanft trüb, wenig Schaum.  Citrus, Pinien Duft. Antrunk Pinie, Citrus. Herber Abgang. Passt.
Absolutely godlike IPA. Very pleasant mouthfeel and taste. I just want to have more
Tasteful beer with good bite. Lower end pricing for good flavor. No aftertaste and good pour.
355ml can. Unclear golden, creamy head. Herbal hops, pine, grapefruit, orange peel, tangerine, lychee. Hoppy bitterness. Full bodied, oily texture, lively carbonated, dry hoppy finish. Very good!
Clear golden pour from the can. Flowery and hoppy aroma. Taste starts medium bitter with a hint of grass. Light sweet aftertaste. Easy to drink.

Bought Nov 2019, Gastronom, Izhevsk, Russia. EXP 23JUL20.

Reddish amber with beige head. Pronounced bitter taste with sweet, long and heavy fruity aftertaste, then bitter again. Has a very pleasing aroma of tropical fruits. Very refreshing.

A quite decent IPA overall.
355ml Dose. Dunkelgolden mit leichter Trübung und mittelgroßer Schaumkrone. Aroma von Citrathopfen. Erfrischend. Runder Abgang. Moderat herb.

It's ok. Probably not what it used to be as there is no haze at all anymore. Hmmm heavy tropical fruits but it all becomes a little bit sickly. However.... It's fresh to begin with and you get a good amount of flavour and body. It's not bad..
Bottle. Dark golden color, clear, almost white foam. Aroma: malt, fruit esters, sweetish, citrus. Taste: malt, caramel, biscuit, citrus, grapefruit zest, medium bitterness, not bad.

Vierte en un bonito dorado algo ambarino, bastante transparente y luminoso para ser una Halo. Algo escasa de espuma, aunque muy persistente. En nariz da notas de limón y hierba recién cortada, con su característico picor en nariz.￼ En boca manda el amargo, firme pero no agresivo, y ligeramente astringente. Al evolucionar en boca va apareciendo un dulce que equilibra el conjunto divinamente. Final equilibrado. Cuerpo medio y textura aterciopelada. Muy interesante y recomendable. Para repetir.￼
Pour from bottle is clear yellow with little head. Dry and hoppy with a bit of grassy pine.  Thin bodied with a spicy finish.
Really hoppy, soft-flavoured IPA. Sweet and balanced, citrus dominates and leaves a floral aftertaste. Very good.

Poured from bottle into a tulip glass.  Dark amber colour, with good head that dissipates quickly to form good lacing and a decent collar.  Full flavour, but not full body.  Good balance with some malt flavour and a lingering bitter aftertaste with hints of citrus.  Very drinkable, but not a session beer at 5.9% ABV.

Aroma:  fruity and and hints of citrus forward. Medium malt note .

Flavor: “Sweet malty taste at first ,hints of pineapple,orange .The beer finishes with a lots of hoppy bittterness.

Overall: “Fruity and hoppy , really nice tasting beer and good value

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21A). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch BF2052 (BBF 01APR20). AROMA: medium malt aroma with a slight caramel and sweet character. medium-low hop aroma with a pine/resin profile. low metallic background and slight alcoholic note. APPEARANCE: deep gold color and cristal clear. medium off-white head, creamy, with good retention. slight leg formation. TASTE: medium malt flavor with a slight caramel profile, followed by low hop notes (pine) and low background fruity esters (orange-like). faint metallic note. high bitterness with a semi-dry and very bitter finish. PALATE: medium-low body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: an american ipa bottled in april were the hop presence started to fade. demands retasting.
Fruity scent. Fruity and bitter taste. Okay bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Good beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Amber color with good foam.
Nose. Bright, fruity, sweet Pineapple as a keynote. A little flower.
Taste. The body of the beer is light. On the palate, the fruit hop theme is a bit of malt, as a base. All this turns into a pleasant hop very high-quality hop bitterness.

Amertume, fine, nette, saillante, Goose Island nous propose une belle IPA qui ne présente pourtant que 5,9 % et 55 d'IBU. Et même si les arômes ne sont pas spécifiquement riches, elle sait être agréable d'autant plus que corps et longueurs sont au rendez-vous. Le visuel sur un blond doré limpide est également appréciable. Le nez reste discret, porté principalement sur les agrumes et les fruits jaunes. Belle amertume à l'attaque qui se veut saillante sans être d'une intensité tonitruante. Les arômes sont simples avec pamplemousse et une pointe poivrée. Bonne intensité en seconde bouche avec l'amertume qui devient un peu plus racée. Celle-ci est bien mise en valeur par un sucre peu présent. Pas d'évolution notable sur les arômes. L’arrière-bouche est toutefois plus nuancée sur les agrumes. On poursuit sur un final d'une bonne longueur avec une amertume précise et sèche mais sans davantage de complexité. C'est bien équilibré, frais avec un petit tempérament bien dosé. Sympa.
Clear golden colour, heavy withe head with good retention, floral aroma, light body, citrus flavour
Very clear, gold color, medium sized, white head. Strong spicy hop aroma with a little caramel maltiness. The flavor is the same and has a strong bitterness at the end. Classic, well-built IPA.

Citrusy and spicy flavor, strong bitterness which lingers in mouth, full body and rich taste.
Typical strong IPA!

12 oz can. Subtle grapefruit smell. Yellow and clear. Nice balance. Sweet malts balanced with citrus hops, tastes lightly of caramel, sweet, and a bit of grapefruit hoppy character, touch of pine. Finish has a nice mellow bitterness. Nice and smooth.
Exactly like a good IPA should be. Fruit and bitternes and a long aftertaste. Too low foam though and the body lacks a bit.
Puszka. Lekko zmetnione ze słabą pianą. W aromacie lekko orzeźwiająco, owocowo. W smaku słodowo ale wraz z przełykaniem pojawia się goryczka. Dobre

amber with a good white head. aroma is leather, "hops" in wort, wood. pine. taste has a good maltiness, some caramel and a certain hops taste like EKG, almost noble herbal bitterness. good body. well, id love to hate it because its both an IPA and an inbev. but it's so nice having a non-C hop IPA.  professional tasting.
355 ml bottle. Pours an orange color with white head. The aroma is noticeable malt with hop hues. On the palate is citrus acidity with malt. Bitterness is above average, woody-hop, harsh and plain.

En copa, cerveza ámbar cristalina con una generosa capa de espuma cremosa color blanco hueso de buena retención. Aroma muy lupulado, encontrando caramelo, cereales, pino, mucha resina, flores, hierbas y alguna especia. En boca, textura ligera y acuosa, de carbonatación media y amargor intensa en garganta. Sabor intenso a cereales caramelizados, junto con resina, pino, hierba, especias, un fondo muy lupulado y un final seco. Una IPA de libro, con todo lo que este estilo necesita. Fresca, amarga, resinosa y con unos 5.9% perfectamente integrados. Sin duda, para repetir más de una vez.

01.09.2019
AR: hopfig, fruchtig, Litschi, (grüner) Tee
AP: fast klares goldgelb
TA: hopfig, fruchtig, Litschi, (grüner) Tee
Very flavoursome and an interesting orange hue. Like this one a lot and might have to sample another bottle.

Bouteille de 35,5 CL achetée chez Auchan. Robe dorée limpide avec une légère mousse blanche. Arômes d'agrumes, pamplemousse, zestes d'orange. Texture crémeuse, carbonatation moyenne, faible amertume, légère. Notes résineuses, pamplemousse, agrumes. Finale sèche portée sur les agrumes.
2019.08.10. Приятный, освежающий, английский IPA. С хорошим балансом горечи и сладости, и травой на финише. Good.

A go to example of American IPA. Slightly cloudy beer with minimal head and medium
carbonation. Packed with tons of citrus flavours and a pleasing rounded finish where the malt makes an appearance. Of course your would have another.
darker than I expected, fruity aroma and has a nice punch. I’d definitely drink again.
Pours an orange color with a thick, white head. Has some pine and citrus flavor. Kind of hoppy with a semi dry finish. I would drink this beer again.

W zapachu dość wyraźne aromaty cytrusowe, ziołowe, trochę siarki. W smaku średnia pełnia, trochę nut słodowych, lekko karmelowych, trochę nut cytrusowych, ziołowych, goryczka średnia, niezbyt przyjemna.
Dobrze pijane, goryczkowe, aromat owocowy - pomarańcza, melon, liczi, na drugim planie słód. Finish delikatnie gorzkowy, krótki. Nie ma żadnego "wow", dobra IPA - chmielowa i orzeźwiająca.
Bottle @ badkrukan, Båstad. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and hoppy with notes of caramel and pine. Dry finish.

Espuma blanca bastante permanente, color anaranjado bastante transparente con muchas burbujas brotando constantemente, aroma floral en nariz, sabor que no tiene mucho amargor de inicio pero finaliza con regusto amargo y seco

IPA치고는 호피함이 덜함. 쓴 뒷맛은있으나. IPA라고하기에 어딘가 모자름.. 개인취향으로는 별로임..
홈PLUS에서 3800원에 샀으나. 이가격이면 더블트위스티드 탄자니아를 마시겠음..
A decent beer. Just the right amount of bitterness balanced by refreshing citrus notes. Quite carbonated like a lager, not as smooth as other IPAs. On tap at abbey hotel.
Gylden krop og et stort holdbart Hvidt skum. Aroma af citrus og lidt grannåle. Smagen er medium bitter og sød. God balance.
Złote, zamglone, z obfitą pianą. Karmel i ice tea w zapachu. Półwytrawne, karmelowe, melonowe w smaku. Goryczka średnia, długa, łodygowa, nieco piekące na dłuższą metę.
Dorada con espuma blanca, buena retención. Aroma con notas cítricas, algo de resinosas. Sabor con decente amargor, frutal con predominio de lo cítrico, ligeramente maltosa. Final amargo; muy bebible.

Good value beer for me. I really enjoy IPAs but don't want to spend $10-12 for a six pack every time.  Not as good as the offerings from the likes of Founder's/Bell's, etc obviously, but overall still pretty decent.

ambrata, schiuma generosa dalla lunga tenuta. Al naso biscotto, lieve ossidazione, toni erbacei e resinosi. In bocca ancora biscotto, qualche nota agrumata, erbacea e resinosa sul finale. Amaro deciso e tagliente. Corpo medio, buona carbonazione. Molto west coast vecchio stampo

Not world class by any means but it's a regular one for me if I want one beer that is refreshing and drinkable in a sessionable ipa. Has a decent hop bite and average malt presence, the hops will stay with you a little bit after imbibing. Would be a great beer for camping or after fishing or doing some yard work. A good introduction to IPAs for newbies. Much better than settling for a yucky lager. Save the good stuff for the weekend but this one has it's place and has become a regular for me.
Goose island IPA is one of my go to IPA's. Good contrast of bittermess and hoppiness. Easy to drink and average ABV. Makes for a good day drinking beer too.

Tight white bubbly head stayed on a translucent light amber coloured body.
Malt, hops, spices & pine aroma.
Medium bodied, sharp on palate with a dry clean back.
Pithy tasting with pine, citrus, grapefruit & resin.
Clear orange appearance with a frothy head. Smell of peaches and grapefruits, taste of lychees with an agreeable bitterness. A very drinkable IPA. Got it served ice cold here at the Black Stuff.
Bottle 33cl. Drink directly from the bottle so can't tell about colour and head. Grass, floral. Medium bitterness. Good but nothing more...
Backlog, at the airport in Chicago. Copper golden with larger head. Notes are pine, ash, lemon, toast, and biscuit malt. Finished pretty sweet and overly astringent. Not sure why this rated so high?

bottiglia 355 ml, schiuma beige fine persistente, colore arancio limpido, al naso frutta tropicale ananas note erbacee, in bocca caramello pompelmo e uva, corpo rotondo, carbonatazione moderata, dolce con amaro moderato. Bella corposa. Diversa dalle super luppolate in stile USA, English Style! c. Carrefour Germignaga 16.06.19
Harbord Diggers Beer Festival Broughton this particular IPA to my attention. Refreshing and very drinkable.
Donker geel bier met een milde hoeveelheid schuim. Het bier is goed bitter en bloemig, dit van het begin tot en met de afdronk. daarnaast licht citrus en grassig.

Just OK. Nothing wrong about: nothing stands out. Best feature is a clean IPA palate. A wise friend once said "I'm not looking for an experience. I'm thirsty and I want a beer." This works. For grapefruit, try NG Moon Man.

12 oz. Can. Golden appearance with off-white head. Notes of mango, grapefruit, mild pine and citrus. Mouthfeel is on the lighter side, malt sweetness does a good job, perhaps too good, at masking the 55 IBU count. Was expecting something a bit hoppier with a bigger bite. For what it is, this one's sessionable and refreshing... but far from my first choice for an IPA.

Came in a box from Beer Hawk. I've heard about this beer before but never bought it as it's owned by AB Inbev. I was shocked from the first sip how great it is. Grapefruit citrus kick to this, very crisp and very refreshing I'm in disbelief that it's so good because I've heard negative things about this beer (mostly because of the company that owns it) 
I would definitely be buying again
Nice hoppy aroma, with a little malt sweetness. This feels like a good reference IPA. Solid and well rounded.
Evergreen and grapefruit aroma and bitter hop flavor that overpowers any malt taste.  Old school west coast IPA type flavor.

On tap at Beerstro, Lille, France. Clear dark golden to amber, diminishing off-white head. Fresh hops, moderately hoppy. Resiny, pine. Some spice. Malts, leaves. Flavour is leaves, herbs, spice and resin. Moderate bitterness. Fresh but not spectacular. Easy going, slightly dull. Light bitter but lingering finish. Moderate body and carbonation.

Dark amber in the glass, consistent light bubbles sustaining a thin creamy head. Strong hoppy flavour hits the top of the palate straight away, nice level of power, refreshing without being too sharp. Could go through a lot of this quite quickly.
Strong, bold IPA that looks and smells as good as it tastes. Pretty delicious.

Збалансований смак хмелю з гіркотою, цитрус дуже слабенько.
В кінці хміль трошки розмазаний і перекривається ноткою алкоголю.

pours golden with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, some caramel, tropical fruits, pine, mild hops. Flavour is light to moderate sweet with a moderate to medium bitter finish. A nice mild IPA but not really special.

the aroma is hoppy and fruity with hints of bitter orange, grapefruit, pine, key lime, resin and spicy herbs... the taste is hoppy and fruity with notes of bitter orange, lemon, pine needles, key lime and spicy grasses... the aftertaste is bitter and dry...

Bottle. Clear yellow color, with thick medium sized head. Aroma is citrus hops, fruity but not as intense as other IPA. Taste is fruity, but there is a cereal note which is too intense for a correct IPA. Medium carbonation. But it's quite good.

En tribute til historien om IPA's

Hælder helt klar gylden med et bredt hvid hoved.

Aromaen er klassisk frugtrig, med en klassisk ale og en tør maltmidte. 

Bitter og syrlig

Den er mediumbody, letdrikkelig, average carbonation, og med en finish der følger  aromaen ud.

500ml can consumed@Beijing China 2019.04.28 canned@2019.02.27 free from ABInBev survey 外观 略深琥珀色半雾状酒身 两指乳白色大颗粒泡沫 表面绵密 持续时间久 香气 极其微弱的橙类香气 味道 奇怪的甜 泡泡糖 香草冰淇淋 回味 持续的橙皮白肉的苦 持续时间较长 口感 酒体中等 轻微滑腻感 沙口感弱 涩感略强 酒精感无 43228 1.9

Cerveja dourada, boa espuma, aroma mistura de terroso com frutado, no paladar o amargor é marcante mas não absurdo, cerveja de final seco logo pedindo outro gole. Em tese uma boa cerveja pra vc tomar com porções de calabresa, torresmo.
Wow. Virkelig en god og velsmagende IPA. masser af fylde og bitterhed. Indbydende aroma.

Piwo ma srednia piane, ale trwala, jasno bursztynowa barwa. Pachnie typowymi chmielami amerykanskimi. w smaku jak i posmaku cytrusy z zywica. Dobre dosc fajna ta zywicznosc, lubie ten klimat, choc posmak nie jest zbyt trwaly to i tak w miare udane piwo
Very nice, satisfying, good and strong tasting IPA. From a UK based lover of IPA

Bottle 33 cl. Yellow, gold, nearly orange with a tiny white head. Aroma of hops and orange peels. The taste is as expected bitter, but has a mild soft undertone. The beer is somewhat watery. The aftertaste has little development and is just bitter.
Bonne IPA l amertume en voici en voilà, pas trop de surprise sur les arômes.

Bottled in May 2011, drunk and reviewed on April 10, 2019. Pours a murky honey golden color with a beige head. Malty nose with sweet hoppy esters. Pleasant mouthfeel. Malt flavor certainly dominates, but the hop esters blend nicely.

Color amarillo anaranjado, con una ligera neblina. Dos dedos de espuma con buena retención. Aroma a pomelo y malta caramelo. Gusto en la misma línea del aroma, añadiría piel de naranja, naranja amarga y ligera resina, amargor intenso y un punto metalico. Cuerpo acuoso. IPA cítrica de manual, no se sale pero tampoco defrauda.

Bought few bottles at local supermarket. Pours with lot of head. Disappears quite fast and leaves Nice lacing.
Nice IPA taste. Little low on carbon.

No defrauda. Es tal y como me la imaginaba. En apariencia es de corte industrial, color dorado transparente con buena espuma blanca, compacta y duradera. Carbonatación adecuada, no demasiada pero con presencia. En aroma es una IPA americana, con su aroma frutal, un tanto tropical y herbácea. En gusto la cosa cambia, y se transforma en estilo inglés. De entrada dulce y maltosa con un final resinoso, seco y marcadamente amargo. Ese amargor te dura en postgusto un rato largo. No es una cerveza sorprendente, pero es más que correcta, que para mí hoy por hoy en bastante.

Wygląd: bursztynowy, błyskawicznie znikająca piana
 
Aromat: bardzo słaby, słodowy, co jest bardzo dziwne jak na IPA

Smak: średnio-gorzkie, goryczka szlachetna, a poza tym dość nijakie w smaku. wysycenie średnie do wysokiego

Ocena: wiele się w tym piwie nie dzieje. przeciętne, można iść dalej.

12 oz bottle with no detectable date stamp.
Pours with an amber body and a semi-durable white head.
Aroma: Herbal and pine notes from the hops.
Flavor: moderate strength and bitterness for style. Pine, herbal, grassy and dank hops with a little citrus.
Robe blonde, mousse blanche. Une IPA à l'amertume prononcée, plus sur les agrumes et les fleurs que sur les fruits exotiques. Manque un peu d'ampleur.

This is no longer a "craft" brew per se, as the brewery was purchased by Budweiser.  However, the story i heard is that Budweiser has given the brewmaster of Goose Island "free reign" and total control of its beer-making process... if so, it still really IS a craft brew.  To me, it stil tastes like a craft beer.  It's a good IPA, not as hoppy as some others i like, but still good.  It's definitely on my list of IPA staples.

Muy buena cerveza de amargor preciso.
Suave en su nivel de alcohol y con buen cuerpo
Acompañada con Papas cheddar

Bière pression bue au Sir Winston a Lille. Robe dorée, mousse abondante et dense. Nez fruité sur la pêche, l'abricot. En bouche, plutôt agréable, sèche mais un peu aqueuse. Bonne amertume. Sympa sans plus.

flesje van 355 ml
heerlijke IPA, perfecte bitterheid
weinig schuim
alles bij elkaar: een aanrader

The best of the 3 Goose's that I sampled.  As I said for the other 2, this is still on the thin side for the style.  Flavor is ok...balance is ok....mouthfeel is ok.  Nothing really stands out here though, and forgettable like the others.  Heard a lot about this brewery, but not yet believing the hype.

Bière portée sur une amertume assez brute, avec un houblon très peu fruitée. Un peu austère à mon goût, mais rien de rédhibitoire et devrait trouver ses aficionados car ne manque pas de caractère et d'un certain équilibre.

This American IPA will provide a pleasant change for casual drinkers, while also being flavourful enough to please drinkers of the style. Ultimately however, Goose IPA is a refreshing beverage as opposed to a connoisseurs beverage.

Read the full review here:

www.beerwithus1.wordpress.com/2019/03/09/goose-ipa

Bottle at home.
Colour - clear, dark yellow/amber, simple (2/5)
Froth - gentle and fluffy
Aroma - citrusy and fruity but also gentle, simple (4/10)
Taste - light and tangy, not bad at all (6/10)
Aftertaste - horrible extremely bitter taste, very surprising compared to taste and very long lasting. Definitely not for me, others might enjoy. Ruined it for me (1/5)

Expecting to hate this however it's light pours well nice head well carbonated and drinks well aroma is balanced and a bit unremarkable but the overall fruit taste isn't well defined with just grapefruit being the one you can pick out and a nice bitter back end of hops malt and general bitterness solid if unremarkable had a lot worse but had better but it's not as bad as I thought . I think me seeing it on draft in Green King pubs may of put me off

Pours a clear golden with a small white head.  Grapefruit stands out with other citrus flavors in the background. Ok bitterness which is a little astringent and almost metalic. This is a decent IPA for the price, but not quite up to craft standards.

Kolor bursztynowy , klarowny. Piana średnia, szybko opadła. 
Aromaty: białe owoce, mango, trochę słody.
Smak i odczucia: sporo goryczki, lekka słodycz, lekka kwaśność, na końcu długo utrzymująca się goryczka. Nasycenie średnie w stronę niskiego.
0.33 l bottle. Pours clear deep golden with small head. A: fruity, T: medium saturation, light/medium body, tart, grapefruity, Bitter,

Poured into chilled pint glass
Smell was a typical nice IPA scent, nothing overly bad or great about it. Plenty of head.
Taste is where this beer fails, the fruitiness does not pair well with the hops and the bitterness of the IPA.
Not one to waste a beer but this went down the sink
Had this beer on tap very thin head yellow hazy aroma lots of hops citrus can strong taste on the hops good beer
Ipa dal classico color dorato e dalla schiuma bianca non troppo persistente. Al fruttato e tropicale classico del genere, predomina il sapore erbaceo e l'amaro si fa sentire chiaramente.

Аромат весьма неплох, легкая цитрусовая, хорошие еловые нотки. Цвет чуть светлее обычного, пенка маленькая но стойкая. Вкус сразу удивляет своей солодовостью. По началу идут совсем легкие нотки цитруса. После глотка идет весьма резкая и продолжительная хмелевая-еловая составляющая.
On tap at Aquitaine, Southbank. Pours amber w/thin white head, faint fruity hop aroma. Decent malt body, restrained bitter finish. This is probably a bit far from fresh.
Flesje 33 cl, helder blond/oranje bier met een witte schumkraag. Hoppig aroma. Zachte, bittere smaak. Toch een beetje waterachtig.
Bottle. Clear golden appearance with small head. Sweet aroma. Hoppy and sweet flavour. Nice beer
Bottle 355 ml. Light golden with a white fluffy head. A rather ”normal” British-style IPA. A bit careful on the hops, but some resinous notes with hints of grass.
Una cerveza IPA con un sabor lupulado y con notas frutales que hacen que la sensación final sea agradable y diferente, color ámbar y una espuma precisa.
Novick Stadium Rouen. IPA qui ne révolutionne pas le genre mais qui fait le travail, bonne amertume , pas trop axée sur les fruits exotiques. Bon cru.

7 mois avant DLC.  Blonde/ambrée mousse moyenne à tenue exceptionnelle et carbo énorme !  Arôme pamplemousse et orange amère. Douce en 1ere bouche, malt toasté présent en force puis une légère amertume très agréable et un final houblonné sur l'orange amère. Une très belle balade et une longueur énorme.  Superbe bière ! Lui manque juste un peu plus de rondeur pour en faire une bière d'exception !

355ml can. A clear golden with a small white head. Predominately grapefruit and citrus. It has a fairly high bitterness which is a little bit astringent and metallic. This is a decent IPA for the price, but it is a bit rough around the edges
Color is clear orange. Foam is middle size. Aroma is weak, notes of citrus. Taste is fresh, bitter in aftertaste. Very common ipa, but drinkable.

As the flagship IPA of GI, this IPA is up to the standard. As GI was acquired by AB, I think GI as a new worldwide craft beer IP is highly successful. Enough on the BS, this beer is a overpar IPA with its clear body, rocky head and beautiful scent. I give the aroma an 8 since it is full of pleasant citrus and limon scent, very perky. The appearance is also quite pleasant with its clear golden body. My biggest regret is the taste - slightly bland, did not match the great scent on the nose. The palate is a bit weak, and the after taste is quite light. Overall, it is an IPA that you can chug and still feel quite some flavor, but not the top of my list....at all.
Lekker hoppige I.P.A. met een gouden amberkleur en citrussmaak. Goede afdronk.

Aroma of hops, citrus and malt. 
Taste of malt and caramel is dominant. Citrus and earthy hops on the background
Doorsnee IPA, weinig verrassend, meer bitterheid dan finesse. Niet mijn favoriet.
Some caramel with a strong catpiss skunk aroma. Light fizzy and astringent. Did not even finish this.
Light ber color with light fine bubble schaum. Mild bitterness with flavour of grspefruit. Bitterness is stronger in the bottle than in a glass.

Le 27/11/2018 bouteille 33cl. Verre Saveur Bière 15cl. DDM : 25/07/2019.

Mousse : Mousse blanche, grosses bulles, bonne tenue.
Liquide : Robe dorée, limpide, bulles vivent au centre du verre.
Nez : Houblon, résine, fruité, agrumes, mandarine, fleurs.
Bouche : Agrumes, mandarine, orange, pamplemousse, mangue, résine, fin de bouche sur l’amertume et le côté florale.
Palais : Carbonatation moyenne, collante, fin de bouche un peu aqueuse.
Fles. IPA maar met een ietwat waterig effect. Minder overtuigend dan ik had verwacht helaas

Normal bottle with normal labels, not special. Clear amber beer with short white head, nearly no smell, taste is light bitter, light grapefruit, mandarine, herbs, light body, light oily texture, soft carbonation, long finish with soft bitterness,
(I have 0.355l bottle with best-before 23.02.2019 and batch BJ2333)
Pours clear bronze with thin head that dissipates quickly; bitter crisp palate; solid.

Bière très aromatique au houblon. Corps malté-sucré, frais, mais toujours assez épicé-épicé, que le nez floral de houblon met quelque chose à l'arrière-plan. Sweetish-hop aromatique et arrière-goût pas trop amer
Hyfsat god smak men för lite karaktär. Trodde först att det var en session ipa.. Ändå helt ok.

De lata de 355ml de un supermercado de Londres. 

Cabeza de medio dedo con algo de retención. Color dorado claro sin turbidez. 

En nariz un poco cítrica. 

En boca se aprecia el fondo maltoso pero el lúpulo cítrico del aroma pasa casi desapercibido. Carbonatacion media. Amargor muy bajo para una IPA. Final algo dulce.

No le veo la gracia por ningún sitio.

Had a can of this back in November, no proper tasting notes taken but I remember that there was a sweetness that i wasn't too fond of. It also had a slight metallic taste at the back end. Wasn't too bad overall however. Have also had it on keg a few times, definitely better than the can, though i remember the carbonation being too high on occasion.

American. Pours honey gold and clear with a thin white head. Aroma is pine, citrus fruits and caramel. Taste is citrus peels, grass and hint of sweet sugary honey. Starts sweet and dry with a satisfying bitterness. One of my new favorites!  Well done brew!

Can, 0.355l, courtesy of Marko, shared with colleagues. Aroma of caramel, resin and mild tropical fruit. Pours clear dark golden color with thin creamy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Taste starts medium sweet resinous, following is grassy, slightly medicinal and metallic, mouthfeel is dry, while finish is heavy bitter. Medium body, oily texture and lively carbonation in palate. Certainly not for geese...

Draught at TD Garden, 11/6/18.
Soft, bronze-peach-golden with a chill haze and fairly large, white head atop showing moderate retention.
Fruity and with a strong grapefruit and pine element to it with seemingly well-attenuated malts that show biscuit, dough and light honey. Clean with strong pepper-like C-hop character lingering alongside pine, lemon and marmalade. No alcohol noted.
In the mouth it's properly dry and with a fairly substantial malt character showing white bread, honey and biscuit. Black pepper, cantaloupe, nectarine and grapefruit definitely are the main force of the beer with a firm bitterness that seems to get more dominant the more I drink. Malts are a little "mushy"; while it never gets too sweet really, the malt is just sort of doughy/bready/lightly sugary and really not particularly enjoyable. The heavy pepper, grapefruit and pines definitely wears on me by the end of the glass. But for a macro, you could do A LOT worse.
Pours an amber colour. There is little aroma with the taste being slightly hoppy, but nothing like an IPA should be. Overall and OK beer, but nothing spectacular.

355 ml bottle, served in snifter. Poured clear golden blond with one finger white head. Aroma: Pine, grassy hops, grapefruit, citrus, peach, orange peel, bready malts. Taste: grass, Pine, Orange, citrus, sweet malts, grapefruit, peaches, figs, mango, pineapple, bread with jam, apricot, cereals. Medium body with hoppy bittersweet finish. Tasty IPA.
Decent IPA which delivers a bit of a hop bomb at a lower alcohol content that most. Good mouth feel and carbonation. Very hop forward, not much malt backbone.

33cl bottle.
Clear golden colour, small white head.
Malts, hops, bread, syrup(?), a hint of citrus and grapefruit.
Medium bitterness, medium to high carbonation.

Belle robe d'or sombre aux nuances orangées, limpide, carbo faible, 1cm de mousse légèrement orangée. Un nez puissant sur les agrumes (mandarine et une pointe d'abricot sec, avec une légère touche de sève). En bouche, l'amertume se révèle en une ou deux secondes, avec un côté peau d'orange, et un corps bien travaillé en fond. La sécheresse prend le pas en fin de bouche. Produit bien fait et fort agréable.
Bottle from Holiday Inn Express, Stevenage. Surprisingly nice IPA with hoppy and fruity flavours
Can bought in Spar. Mid gold colour with slightly yellow head. The scent is slightly sweet. The taste is also quite sweet, not so typical IPA. Not my favourite.
Gyllengul med tunt vitt skum. Doftar fruktigt, lite kåda. Smaken fyllig, besk och humlig. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång med markant beska.
Color naranja, turbia. Espuma blanca abundante y duradera. Aroma frutal aunque escaso. Sabor cítrico, naranja, piña y resina, escaso también. Una IPA sencillisima.

Cxxxxccxxccxccxxccccxcccccccxxxxxxxxcccccccccxxxdccdfccccccccfdddfffeddfffffwwsdggddfffddffgukjjdeddddffgghgrddccf

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Malty aroma. Again malt in the taste with some very subtle stone fruit. Some gentle bitterness running through. Quite one dimensional.
Consumed this many times but only now rating. Used to be borderline interesting but now tedious. Generic.
Flaska. Ljus bärnstensfärgad vätska med litet vitt skum. Ganska dank humledoft. Mycket grape och tallbarr i smaken. God!
This "IPA" is more yeast than anything. Tastes like rolling rock just stronger

Low formation foam, low density. Honey translucid liquid. Aroma is dry and ligtly hoppy.
On mouth, a light beer but powerful on bitterness and lightly malted. The aftertaste is bitter too and with long duration.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Low formation foam, low density. Honey translucid liquid. Aroma is dry and ligtly hoppy.
On mouth, a light beer but powerful on bitterness and lightly malted. The aftertaste is bitter too and with long duration.
Helles Bernstein, filtriert, nur leichte Krone. Grapefruit und Pfirsich im Antrunk, etwas harzig, gut eingebundene Bitterkeit.
AB have mainufactured this goose IPA in china,355ml glass bottled.is shamed to a IPA name,is hardto call a IPA.very hardly to chase hop's Flavour and end with a boring bitter

Had a pint of this on tap at the Mill of the Black Monks, near Bretton Priory, Barnsley. At least one good thing about big breweries taking over or investing in smaller, crafty ones, is that these days you can walk into pubs that don't sell cask ales and still maybe get a decent pint such as Brewdog Punk IPA or this. Goose IPA has some similarities with the former, being crisp and citrusy, just right as a thirst quencher on a summer's day. It's delivered gassy and chilled from the keg, which is not usually my thing, but the fact I can buy it in pubs such as this is a welcome development. Went down a treat.
Very distinct flavour and may be a bit of an acquired taste but very drinkable and one of the better IPAs around

Au nez, le zeste d’orange vous saute au visage, avec des notes de fruits exotiques en seconde bouche. Amertume parfaite qui donne une longueur interminable, le zeste d’orange, ou plus généralement d’agrumes, ressort invariablement en second temps, avec un biais très légèrement épicé. La couleur, par contre, est un peu décevante, orange translucide. La mousse est inexistante, elle n’a tenu que le temps de se servir. La tenue, quant à elle, est très acqueuse. Grosse différence entre l’apparence et le goût

Recommended. I am not very much into IPA but still recommand this beer. The liquid has a golden color, clear under the light and with a smooth foam on the top which could last around 20 second. It has a fuity aroma which is mixed with a heavy lemon juice smell and a light smell of malt and hops. There ia almost no smell of alcohol. It tasted a little bit sweet at the begining but after that was bitter which is for me somewhere between medium and heavy. The bitter taste lasted within minutes and vanished gradually and finally the lemon taste came back which was too slight to recognize it.

From a beer hawk mystery case. Pours golden orange with thin head. Nice mild hop aroma.  
Taste of toffee , malt , grapefruit, sweetness. Slightly too sweet for my palate but not bad. Very hoppy taste.

This IPA is all about the long bitter finish. Very slight fruity flavors a little watery. The bright citrus aromas advertised on the beer label are not there. They are very subdued and completely overwhelmed by the long bitter finish. I agree that the beer has a bold hop finish but it does not let the fruity flavors come through.
Zero issues with this "mass-produced" IPA. Solid 4 for me. 15 packs at Jewel make this a perfect beer to kick off the weekend at a great price.

Can from Tesco
First brewery from Illinois
Pours clear gold, headless. 
Bit watery as of taste, but medium bitter, nice hops. Good I would say.
Restrained aroma in an amber pour. Hop forward balance with malty body and finish. Tend to the UK rather than US take on the style (surprisingly).

Pours golden with a white head. Not much of an aroma but what there is is malty. Not an unpleasant flavour but just not enough flavour for me. Doesn’t cause offence but wouldn’t be rushing out to buy some more.

Botella de 330ml servida en un vaso picardi. Apariencia color dorado intenso, con una corona de espuma blanca densa y de buena estabilidad. Aroma intenso a frutos cítricos y pan. Sabor intenso a malta con un retrogusto cítrico amargo que persiste en la boca dejando un final seco. Cuerpo medio con carbonatación moderada.

Vancouver 27/7 2018. 47,3 cl on tap on The Hastings Warehouse. A very indie place with gothy waitresses and fairly loud Music a 1 pm. What’s not to like?!

Pours hazy golden yellow with small white head. Settles as thin, almost transparent layer of foam. Clinging to the side of the glass. Moderate lacing. 

Aroma is intense and Classic IPA. Sweet exotic fruits, mango and papaya. Strong odor of citric Grape fruit. 

Light carbonation. Slightly thick texture.

Flavor is lightly sweet. Followed by a prominent and strong bitterness. Citric. Aftertaste is bitter and citric. 

Quite bitter IPA with good intensity.
Prima IPA, lekker bitter met sterk hoppige afdronk. En af en toe gewoon beschikbaar in de plaatselijke supermarkt. 5,9% alcohol.

Botella de 355 ml adquirida en Gastrópolis, Zaragoza.
Bonito color ámbar, cristalina. Espuma abundante, color hueso, buena retención.
Aromas resinosos y frutales, con cierto dulzor. En boca, no es una IPA muy lupulizada, tiene notas frutales a naranja y a cítricos. Cierta semejanza con las IPA británicas.
En mi opinión, buena cerveza.
This is a pleasant middle of the road IPA which you would think was satisfactory if you found it at an airport bar. Which is, funnily, enough where I am drinking it!

300ml on tap at Broer, Amsterdam. Aroma is light oats and very light exotic fruits. Appearance is clear golden with a small white foam. Taste is light bitter and very light sweet. Slightly watery and light bitter. Ok

0.355l bottle from carrefour city in strasbourg, 2.50€, 17.11.2017-17.11.2018. pours a clear deep golden with a steady head. aroma of fruity hops, mango, peaches, flowers. flavour of grapefruit zest, plums. quite light and sessionable. nice.
Gyllene och klar. Ser ut som en lager. Doften svag för en ipa. Smaken har grapefrukt, ljust bröd o tall. Rätt torr, fin beska på slutet.

Barwa złota, piwo klarowne, piana, biała trwała.
Aromat średnio intensywny, slodkie chmiele, kwiaty, cytrusy.
W smaku wytrawne, lekko słodowe, że średnia goryczka. Bardzo dobrze zbalansowane.

God og smaksfull IPA. Ble nytet på en festival i Utrecht. Må testes igjen senere!
5,8/10

Draft from a pitcher at a bowling alley. Pours clear, yellow, with a big, frothy, white head. The nose is pine sap, caramel, cloves, and white bread. Sweet and syrupy, with a light bitterness. Light to medium body, with a syrupy, slick palate. This is a weak, neutered IPA. Nothing terrible, just fair.

Pours clear gold with a layer of white head. Aroma is faint citrus. Flavor is bitter citrus with a crisp finish.

Bouteille de 341 ml. Couleur cuivrée avec un joli col blanc. Arôme d'agrumes et de fruits tropicaux. Goût de pamplemousse, d'ananas, d'herbes fraîches et de houblon. Bonne IPA à très bon prix.
une bonne ipa dommage que ca ete racheté par abinbev..... sorti de ca l amertume reste presente et elle desaltere bien
Fat. Klar gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Doft och smaker av frukt, citrus och malt. En tämligen tam IPA.
This beer is really crisp and wonderful. The aroma is light and not overwhelming. Perfect for pairing with Indian food or other spicy or flavourful foods.
Tall boy can. Typical IPA aroma, and taste. Palate was not too complex but had a decent hop aftertaste. Good drinking beer.

From a 330ml bottle on 6/6/2018. This is an Australian 'brewed under the supervision of Goose Island' product, soI  can't attest to whether it replicates the real thing. The aroma is slightly fruity and a touch minerally. The flavour presents with some biscuit malt, and a fairly indistinct fruit sweetness, which is followed by a reasonably firm, slightly herbal, slightly chemical bitterness. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A slightly rough and uninspiring IPA.
Draft at Heathrow. Clear golden color. Aroma of fruity hops and a bit of malt. Sweetish, moderately bitter, fruity, citrus, toasted malt, semi-dry. A bit mild but quite easy going.

Soft aroma of earthy sweet spruce and nuts. Extremely harmonious blend of flavors. Clean finish. I am a bit underwhelmed though.
This version is made in Australia under license by Carlton United; So I'm wondering of the vagaries between the US model and this insipid IPA. Good for the kids. Introductory Pale Ale maybe.
A blueprint for the oldfashioned type of IPA, very sturdy and strong taste with a crisp clear bitter finish, but a nice classic ale.
Clean golden color, white head. Aroma of grassy and citrusy hops, malt, biscuit, some floral notes. Dry sweet taste with medium bitter finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Fine IPA.

Bottle from local AH supermarket. Color: Clear golden, off-white head. Taste: Straw, bit grainy. Moderate to medium sweet malt, moderate bitter grassy and lightly flowery hop. Nothing more, nothing less. Medium body, average carbonation. I have had far better IPA's.
Draft beer tasted at the Fusion bar in Gaylord Nashville. Poured perfectly with a small white head. First taste was a burst in the mouth of fruit and hops. Liked it lots. ps tad bitter on the finish

Clear golden appearance with medium white head. Aroma is citrus and floral. Taste is the best part, herbs, grass, flowers, a bit citric and very resinous. Basically, it tastes like a whole forest. A very solid IPA, fresh and easy to surprisingly easy to drink.
Good IPA. Very hoppy, reasonably refreshing, maybe a tad over bitter on the finish. Nice overall.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, pale, golden, amber, orange, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium sourness, light body, medium body,
Nice aroma of fruits and herbs but also a bit of metal. A bit sweet in taste but with no carmel tones. Strong bitterness, lasting a bit too long.

Pour a hazy deep amber colour. Barely any aroma...whiff of citrus and pine. Taste just as mild as it smells...matches the aroma with some notes of roasted malts and hoppy finish. Nothing special

Very refreashing aromatic ipa. Very reasonable for the price. Good beer this

Good beer, lighter in taste but still fulfilling. Would buy a case and drink throughout the day.

I think it's just an amazing IPA. Really easy to drink and not heavy. USA beers are the best!

(dorée, nez agrume soft, rose, violette, bouche fruitée & florale (rose, violette), orange sucrée, pin, litchi, finale houblon)

355 ml. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: not very intense aromas of citrus, tangerine, fruits, maybe orange. Hints of toasted malts, caramel.
Appearance: golden color, crystal clear, slightly off-white foam. Quite creamy head with medium to high thickness. Medium to high retention. Medium to high Brussels' lacing. 
Taste: low sweetness, medium bitterness, low sourness. Flavors of citrus, tangerine, fruits and hints of toasted malts, caramel, bread crust, orange, grapefruit. Balance is toward the bitter side.
Palate: low to medium body, oily-silky texture, high carbonation, very long dry finish with medium bitterness and the aforementioned flavors. Alcohol is not noticeable. No astringency.
Overall: very good appearance, but the aromas are not very intense. Flavors are intense but not the most pleasant ones i've found in an IPA. Maybe too little aroma and too malty flavors for an IPA. Quite bitter but too weak hops' aromas and flavors.

355ml can. Aroma is strangely sweet, like orangeade. Grassy hops. Appearance is this and golden, thin on the palate too with quite a bitt of carbonation. Taste is dry and malty, very bitter with earthy hops in the finish. Not a great beer.

Van 't vat bij De Loco Bergen op Zoom. Uitzicht: helder oranje met fijne witte schuimkraag die lang blijft. Neus: flauwe neus, frisheid, citrus, in de verte zure appel. Mond: mouten, weinig aromahoppen, honing, biscuit. Weinig boeiend, weinig carbonatie. Nasmaak: zacht romig, bitterhoppen. 
Besluit: een beetje een eentonige en eenvoudige IePA met weinig aroma en de nadruk op mouten en bitters. Geeft weinig opwinding. Valt volgens mij te klasseren onder de Engelse stijl IePA's.  Verschrikkelijk lelijk glas trouwens dat afbreuk doet aan het genot.
0,473ml bottle. Pours clear golden with medium sized head. Some citrus and pine going on . Bitter finish. Not too complex.
Une belle surprise que cette IPA dégustée dans une bouteille en verre. Les arômes sont très agréables et restent bien au palet. J'en reprendrai.

Fat. Klar guldfärgad med ett vitt skum. Dofter och smaker av malt, frukt och tall. Väldigt försiktig IPA.
Can. Clear golden colour. Strong citrus flavour but quite bitter. More fizzy than your average ale.

Bottle, 355ml. Pours pale golden with a small off-white head. Very floral aroma, nice hop tinge to it, a little grassy, complex. As for the flavours, they are just sweet enough without being anywhere near overpowering, fruity, with brilliantly well-balanced hops, some presence of toasted malt in the finish. The texture is oily, body is medium to full and finish is of average duration. Carbonation is soft. Very nice brew, better than quite a few session IPAs...

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso viene catturato dal luppolo. L'intensità olfattiva è normale e la continuità olfattiva è sufficiente. Il manto superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma destinata a vita breve. La grandezza delle bollicine è a grana medio-fine. La carbonazione è bassa. Il liquido appare cristallino. La frizzantezza si presenta sotto forma di poche bollicine fini. Il colore è giallo ambrato. Il corpo è pieno. L'amaro è deciso. L'intensità gustativa è elevata. La costanza gustativa è sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali che permangono sono luppolate. Il finale è amarognolo. Il retrogusto è intenso. L'aroma in bocca porta note di miele, frutta secca, luppolo, resina, pino, agrumi e pompelmo.

Bottle at Frankie and Bennies, Camberley. I was going to go for Byron or 7Bone in terms of beer options but was outvoted. Grass and citrus aroma. Pretty hoppy. Copper gold. Bubbly white head soon fades away. Medium bitter. Citrus but not overly refreshing or juicy. A quinine edge. Light bodied. Slick. Fizzy carbonation. Relatively abrupt finish. Not the most mind blowing IPA but for one that's available in most supermarkets it's not too bad and is hoppy enough.
Draft at Macs. Clear orangish gold pour. Lots of carbonation. Fizzy/foamy white head. Medium caramel malts. Moderate hops. Tangerines. Cereal. Honey. Easy going. Nothing complex or interesting.
People seem to love this beer which comes at a shock to me. They sell these at the Blue Jays game and no one ever buys it. I think it’s truly one of the worst tasting beers I’ve ever had.
Pours yellow with average head. Has medium body with average carbonation. Lots of floral notes on the palate. Taste is not very hoppy but subtle. Not a very dry beer or bitter.

On tap at Park Royal Sydney.
Hazy pale amber with OK head.
Citrus hop aroma.
Medium bitterness with citrus hop palate.
Slight dryness to finish.
Not bad.
On tap (at the Ft. Lauderdale Airport, possibly.) Pours pale godl with a white head. Aroma and flavor of citrus, grapefruit, pine, caramel notes, cardboard. Decent.

On draught at Old Chicago. 

Pours a brilliantly clear light gold, nice head of foam, lacing. 

Smells of mild pine, orange, toasted malt, some fruity sweet notes. 

Tastes kinda sweet, mild hoppy bitterness from pine and grapefruit, fruity, mellow.

Good but not something I would put on my regular rotation.
Honestly pretty decent and utterly drinkable. A good IPA to drink along with a meal.

Pours a clear golden colour with average carbonation. New World hop aromas of citrus and pine dominate. Taste is very much geared towards the hops with grapefruit and pine flavours dominant, with a lingering hoppy finish, but does have some nice caramel and sweet malt fruit flavours in there for balance. Light amber pour with a small head. Aromas of hops, light citrus and pine. Nothing complex going on. Sweet bready malts provide a nice mouthfeel with little carbonation. Long dtime y finish. Not the best IPA, but in a pinch, like at an Eagles game, this can serve as a beer as a decent choice.
Tap - pours honey orange with a white head. Aroma is grapefruit, doughy and wheat. Taste is mild fruity w8th a malty fruit finish.
It has a very strong flowery scent, if people like 1664 should like this as well, except this is a bit more bitter than 1664

I really like this. It's an English style IPA so with only 55 ibus it's IPA-lite. I'm fond of more malty beers Irish and especially Scottish ales. I do like ipas and this one is just right. Not too hoppy so you got some bready malt character coming through. The nose is very citrusy with maybe a hint of pineapple. The taste is similar a little more grapefruity which I would expect from a more hoppy beer. Reminds me a little of bass but with a more hoppy punch. If I saw this on draft I would get it for sure and could make this my go to IPA even though it is owned by ab- InBev. It's really good and for people who like hoppy mild English ipas. Some ipas are just too overpowering on the hop side and unbalanced this is surprisingly balanced.

Clear, golden pour with a white head. The aroma has citrus and grassy hops. It has a medium body with oily texture and lively carbonation. The taste is bitter with a more neutral, somewhat dry finish. A nice anytime IPA.

There are heaps of hops that give off a strong flavor of  spearmint with grapefruit, but also a slightly unpleasant dust flavor.  The palate is a little watery but the aftertaste is the best of the flavours so I'm happy.

355ml bottle. Pours a pale biscuity gold with a white head. Aroma: Pine, citrus, grapefruit, mild caramel malt notes. Pleasant aroma. Taste: Pine, citrus, grapefruit, mild mango, peach, caramel malt flavours. Medium bodied. Moderate carbonation. Moderate to high bitterness that lingers on the palate. 33cl from bottle bought at Waitrose. Well-balanced IPA, slightly citrusy, hoppy and strong flavour

So, now brewed under contract in Australia by the macro monster CUB. This shows in many ways from label, to aroma........, to flavour. Sudsy, messy white crown off the pour is quickly diminished to a mere island of white. Radiant, orange amber body, bright as bright. Slightly vegetal, boiled cabbage, oxidised metal and rubbery tinge to the otherwise spicy and earthy hop and biscuity malt nose. There is a hint of bay leaf and rosemary in there too. Malt forward, chewy, barnyard grain and cereal-like right through to the assertively bitter and slightly acrid finish. Light honey sweetness upfront. Chalky and mineral-like mouthfeel. Weedy, acrid hops (tetra?) last well passed their welcome. Body is light to medium with spritzy carbonation flattening to still as it head south. Really disappointing. I don't for one minute think this represents the original ale produced before s#!t hi the fan with Goose Island. Unbalanced mess!!! (33cL, BB 07/02/18, 1st Choice Liquor, Riverton)
