I'm am overall very happy with this Beer. The citrus Orange taste is very light and delicate . Hopes is complete for a iBU 55 . The taste is out of this world . Thanks for destroying my taste in Heineken and Stella Artois !
Sample from a bottle at Wegman's. Aroma of citrus and bread. A little thin.

Decent IPA that was bought for guests who like hops. It is distinctly hoppy. After Irma raged through this was one of the few bottles that were left in the refrigerator when the power came back on. It served a purpose but I am not a fan. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Robe cuivrée, mousse blanche. Caramel, orange, amertume légère. Pas très floral pour le style.
Not my cup of tea. Had the aftertaste 2 hours after finishing the one and only I had.

(Bottle) Pours clear amber with big white head. Nice fruity aroma with floral notes - fruit salad, maybe paw paw. Light body, medium carbonation. Taste has nice backbone of caramel malt with big hop flavours - fruity at first and thennice bitterness. Nice IPA.
Gylden brun klar med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter epler, sitrus og noe karamell. Maltig noe brent karamellbitter smak. Middels lang
nice 'n malty IPA with a fantastic hop kick. great on draught (if not a little bit expensive, i've found - locally at least) but also rocks hard in a bottle too. great stuff, fairplay.

16floz can, COD: 07.07.2017, $1.75 price as a single, poured contents into a pint glass - A: Dark gold with two fingers of head, S:pine cone, T: evergreen forest, M: Medium boby, bitterness, and carbonation, O:Utterly basic.

P - 355ml bottle with hop graphics and bold label.

A - Golden amber with quickly disappearing white head

S - Starts off with a combination of fresh orange and caramel. 

T - An orangey hit  leads into a resiny marmalade bitterness that lingers after the beer is swallowed.

35,5cl bottle at home. Appearance: clear pale straw with medium white head. Aroma: orange, orange zest, lime, hop resin, caramel. Taste: medium sweetness and high bitterness. Notes of hop resin, grapefruit and orange zest. Palate: medium bodied, watery texture and soft carbonation.
Bevuta in bottiglia colore dorato non torbida. Carbonazione media. Al naso note agrumate e leggero caramello che si ripete anche in bocca.
Good IPA overall. Citrus hops are outstanding at the end of the mouthful, and leave a pleasant aftertaste. Very easy to drink beer.
Light and crisp, a touch too citrusy for me with a bit of a malty bite. Love the logo more than the IPA.

Draught at Charlotte International Airport. Clear deep golden liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, caramel, grain and earth. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of citrus, caramel and grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Decent but old school.

Average frothy offwhite head. Fair lacing. Mostly diminishing. Clear average-density dark-yellow body. Aroma: moderate malty, caramel, moderate hoppy, herbs, pine, citrus orange. Flavor: moderate sweet light bitter; long duration. Palate: medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. lúpulo com presença de pinho. Dulçor maltado, com presença de caramelo. Boa drinkability, suave, mas com personalidade. 85 s
As a man from South Africa, visiting NYC, this guy kept me level - top quality IPA.

I had this beer in a bar, only cause it was NOT a light beer, light beer is for women!! If you want light beer ? Bring 
Back 3.2 beer! So all said! Goose IPA!
Really shocked my mouth!!!
Such !! Strong bitter taste!! And after I swallow it? I get this sweet after taste!!
Just a little !!! WOW!!! I fell in love with
Goose IPA!!! What a silly name!!! But miller MGD, in glass bottles, had always 
Been my choice, now I have a 2nd beer!!! And I will buy both!! Thank you for bringing a silly name beer to my mouth!!! LOVE IT!!!!!!!
Klares Gold mit wenig Schaum. Malzig, leicht fruchtig, etwas Grapefruit, Pfirsich, leicht harzig, bitter.
Tap (as goose island ipa, 5.8%). Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is hoppy fruity, citrus. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, grapefruit, some pine. Nice balance. Overall: very good.
From a bottle bought at the Co Op in Inveraray. Just a yellow golden color, like a "pils". Disappearing white head. Good taste, could be more "hoppier".
33 cl bottle at outback steak house the place shanghai. pours hazy golden with big head. fruity aroma with sweet citrus and bitter hoppy taste. piney juicey with some tropical notes.

0.33l bottle. Golden color with high creamy white head. Aroma: exotic and juicy, mango, tangerine, pine, caramel malts. Taste: grapefruit, candy, caramel malt, light herbal notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Quite high bitterness. Nice example of US IPA.
330ml can from Sainsbury’s. Amber colour with large white head. Very standard IPA but enjoyable and well made nevertheless, bitter hops, citrus, pine.

At Delaney’s, Bruges. On International Beer Day (August 4). Pours clear dark golden with a small, frothy, white head; containing particles. Smells a bit off. The aroma contains hops, citrus, grapefruit, malt, mango and apple. It tastes light fruity sweet and light to medium bitter, with a light hoppy finish and fruity hints. Medium body, slick/watery texture, soft/flat carbonation. Very drinkable IPA with good fruity complexity, yet a wanting palate. Almost guessing it was a bad bottle. Perhaps we’ll meet again sometime...

This is your stereotypical IPA and that's what I want when I drink one. Clean crisp and flavorful 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ De Sluyswacht, Amsterdam VIII 2017. Eerste reactie ziet er verdacht uit als een normaal pilsje. Iets geler kleur smaakt zachte tot gemiddelde bitter en licht hoppig. Dat maakt deze IPA ook weer redelijk doordrinkbaar. Overall redelijk maar maar vooral die ganzenhoofd als tapkraan springt er uit. Maar daar kan ik dus geen extra punten geven. Licht hoppig geurend. Origineel glas.

For me this is what an English style IPA ought to taste like. 
No surprise pine needle  attack when you take that first sip. Here you're welcomed by  Malty McMalt's sweet  "Top o' the morning" whom will then grab mr Hops hand to create some nice umami notes.
Hops then beats Malty McMalt up and you'll have a nice bitter finish
Bottle from Saveur Bière.com Amber color, white head. hops bitterness, not much more. Not my thing

355 ml bottle @home,bb 24/08/2017.
Golden,clear. Aroma of citrus,traces of pine and lots of cooked vegetables.
Taste is malt and some bitters.
How it is possible that beer smells so Great but tastes like heineken ... carbonated, flat and boring

33ml Bottle at Brussels les Bains. 
Pours golden orange and clear, white gentle head. 
Aromas and taste of pilsner malt, Caramel and esters. Dry bitter finish.
Bottle from Carre four Brugge. Fruity even some nutty, some sweetness. Quite fresh bitterness. Some fizzy.

Not a huge fan. I realize these ratings are “subjective”, and I’ll admit I’m not an expert, but I do know what I like. It seemed to have more of a sour finish than a bitter hoppy one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 12oz. Golden with a white head. Interesting malty flavour with lots of hops. Taste is bitter and bitter. I like it ! Not a beer for beginners but a truly tribute to what IPA is meant to be. Great one. Long lasting bitter finish.

The aroma is bursting with citrus hops that make for a pleasant odor. The color is golden with a clear body. Much clearer than the other IPAs I tried this day. The flavor is citrusy but not overwhelming. It would be a great IPA to introduce to those unfamiliar with the style.

Octobre 2017 : 4.0
Peu de mousse, une couleur claire. Une bière bien houblonnée avec du parfum donc et de l’amertume. L’ipa est dite de style anglais mais on retrouve aussi du fruité exotique.
Aout 2020 : 3.9
Assez maltée, un peu fruitée, bon équilibre.

Bottle from Total Wine, South Richmond. Pours clear gold, lots of carbonation, small off-white head. Aroma is unappealing... and I don’t say that often. It smells like opening a can of Chef Boyardee ravioli along with some vegetation. Yes, that cheap tomato sauce/paste aroma. Flavor has some of that cheap tomato sauce/paste flavor along with glue, grass, pine, and random citrus rind. I’ll drink it, not a drain pour, but blah.
Light amber color, white head. Hops and malts aroma, citrus. Nice balanced taste, medium bitterness, caramel. Light bitter finish.

On tap into a plastic cup at a Blue Jays game in Toronto. Pours light amber with trace white head and lacing. Aroma: sweet malt. Flavor: malt-forward, some bitter balance. Mouthfeel: light- to medium-bodied, a little thin and watery. Years ago I had this at the brewpub in Chicago after it first opened in its original location, and the beer was fantastic. Years later, now sold off to AB/InBev to be mass produced and sold everywhere, it’s very disappointing.
Limpid light amber. Nutty barley nose. Fresh citrus mouth that balances the bitterness from the hops.
Got this one at my farewell lunch party at Tosca with a nice calabrese pizza. I thought it was a bit on the brettish side, very hoppy.
IPA de carácter resinoso, más dulce en boca y con final amargo y duradero un poco áspero. Americana de perfil británico. Buena. En botella. BB 07/03/2018

A pretty standard IPA. Aroma is somewhat malty, toffee and floral/citrus. Moderate head with no lacing, paleish amber colour. Taste is well-balanced but unremarkable. Some malty toffee notes, moderate hop flavour. Palate is clean, thin. Overall, a drinkable beer, but not much else. Poured from a can into a tumbler.
This has earned it’s seat with Steelhead, Eye of the Hawk, Newcastle, & Guinness...Top Hat of the Round Table of excellent taste

A great everyday IPA, Goose IPA has a nice citrus happiness but backs it up with a lightly nutty lightly caramel malt backbone. Balanced for an IPA. Ends with a long bitter, but not sharp, fade. Pours crystal clear light amber with a big creamy white head. Sampled through a Fizzics.

12oz bottle. Clear yellow-orange, thin off-white head. Fruity, lightly piney nose. Flavors are grapefruit, sweet orange, caramel. Smooth and light-bodied with a medium finish. Enjoyable, but seems more like a pale ale.
33cl bottle purchased @ Rock Out Shop. Belle robe dorée. Parfum assez léger. Attaque sur les fruits tropicaux avec beaucoup de douceur. Final résineux et houblonné assez sec.
Just average. I found it a bit too sweet and malty actually. Good tropical aromas but not as nice to drink.

Not bad, not too bitter, smell not so great, on tap at del frisco grill Little Rock Arkansas 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Optisch golden, gefiltert, stabiler Schaum. In der Nase schöne Frucht, im Trunk Grapefruit, mittig bitter, hinten langer Nachhall, leichte Süße. Feines Ding, die fette Gans.

Here’s one I couldn’t believe I haven’t rated yet, it’s an oldie but now just goodie-not-greatie (?). It pours a foamy clear yellow gold pale aleish hue with a medium head and it smells pretty good, tropical notes with some light pine. The taste is a tad harsh and bitter for 2017; you can tell this is a old one, but it stills holds up for being pretty cheap these days and often being the best beer in terrible bars due to the AB-InBev distro. It is pretty easy to drink a few after you acclimate to it. Good for halting and catching fire while waiting for the doo doo medicine to take effect thus making the toilet bowl catch the poop.
Pours golden amber with a high white head. Aroma; Biscuits, pineapple, oranges, peach and citrus. Taste; Citrus, liime, pineapple, grass and some pine.
355ml bottle. As a new reviewer, I had high hopps for this highly rated IPA and it delivers. Pleasant piney aroma, easy to drink and with a slightly dry and bitter aftertaste.

Can 355 ml from Waitrose. Hoppy aromas of tropical fruit and hints of caramel. Big and solid white head and dark golden body. Taste is bitter and strong with fruity notes. Has a long and bitter aftertaste. Great beer overall but a little too strong for my taste.
Quite a strong beer, but no signs of alcohol in taste. Full body, balanced taste, not too sweet and not too bitter. Very strong white head. Overall very solid balanced beer, very good.

355 ml bottle imported by Cerveceria Chile. Found on an Easter Island supermarket. Currently the only IPA available here. Pours a clear orange/amber color with a small fizzy white head that diminishes quickly and leaves a small lacing. Aroma is hoppy with mainly herbal, piney and citrusy notes. Lemongrass, cedar, pine cones, resin, lime and lemon peel are really clear. Taste is quite bitter, dry with flavors of ginger, quinine, acid citrus, lemon verbena and lemon. At times you get small orange-ish hints that come from the interaction of bitterness hops and the malts. Some sweetness gets through with slight warming. Light to medium bodied (for an IPA of this gravity at least), high lively carbonation. Leaves a dry feeling in the mouth after finishing it. Well crafted. Glad we have this on Easter Island.
Beautifuly balanced and very easy to drink for a "strong hop" beer. Perhaps the most unique tasting IPA I have ever encountered. I absolutly love this beer.Easliey in my top 3 IPA’s of all time.

On tap: Nice citrusy aroma and taste but not very hoppy for an IPA. Orange zest and pine are the dominate flavors, but there is a very slight sulfur aftertaste. I’m sure this was much better before InBev took over.
2016 catch up - Bottle at home - A typical, and nice, American IPA. Lots of hops, flavour and a great mouthfeel.

BOD 12/26/16. Pours clear with a golden hue coupled with a touch of amber. Outstanding head volume, very good lacing and normal retention.

Vey good nose that is a bit subdued. Notes of fruit permeate over a slightly sweet base of malt - both biscuit and cracker. Light rind rolls underneath an orange note with hints of pineapple.

Medium body with a nice slick oily texture that imparts a pseudo-creaminess on the palate. World class carbonation / body balance. The middle is almost rollicking with effervescence that open the flavors up. The finish is a nice finely bubbled tingle that tickles the tongue.

The flavor is very good but lacks complexity versus an American IPA. Versus an English IPA standard, it is outstanding. Like the nose, the base has a subtle contrasting sweetness. Unlike the nose, the malt is solely biscuit oriented and provides a nice nutty flavor from three quarters in through the finish. Bitterness is mild for an English variant, light for an American one. This is a hop flavor oriented IPA versus a bitter bomb. Hop flavors presented are a combination of herbal and very light fruit. The sweet background yields a mango impression not detected in the nose. The finish is slightly dry as the sweetness fades coupled with a subtle clove note.
big hoppy US-craft beer aroma, quickly gets bitter and malty in the palate. Slightly old fashioned and overly bitter, I often think. A grower, though...it settles in after a few mouthfuls.

0,355 l bottle from Just in Beer, Groningen for 3,20 €. Pours out red golden, little bit unclear with a small white head. Malty, hop and some tropical fruit on the nose. Taste starts hopy, crisp and fresh. Increasing bitterness. Mid fruity, malt and some almonds or nuts. Mid hopy bitterness with citrus in the aftertaste. Nice one.
Bottle at restaurant in Groningen. A hugely hoppy beer, the hops kinda take over very dramatically. A very classic American craft beer taste, tasty, nothing extraordinary however.
From a 473ml can. No big suprises here, classic english IPA taste and aroma. It does the job and its not bad but it misses a bit of balance IMO.
Pint can; clear golden brown puffy white head; wheat orange, lots of hops, good balance, not quite a gold standard IPA, but close.

Keg (Trinity College Beer Cellar, Oxford)

Pale, keggy pour. Simple fruity hoppy aroma, very generic. Fizzy palate, erk. Taste is generic watery hop juice. Drinkable at a push, but not very tasty.
355 ml bottle from Tesco, London (UK). Nice golden colour. Medium white head. Aroma is fruity, grapefruit at most. Taste is fruity, grapefruit, mango, citrus. Light body. Finish is very nice.
355ml bottle. Pours clear gold with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is floral, pine, malt. Taste is hoppy, citrus, pale malt. Not bad.
Pours a nice golden colour with excellent head and lacing. The taste is citrus, pine and earthiness. Smooth in the middle but bitter at the end. Too much pine and not enough citrus.

Pours amber with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is hoppy with hints of citrus and honey. Taste is rather bitter with notes of grassy hops, lemon and a hint of honey. This one has a very clean flavour but there isn’t a lot of depth to It.
Bottle pour that retained it’s head for quite a while. Active carbonation. Lemon aroma that transitions to grapefruit flavors. Not much nuance.

De Goose Island(E.U.A) esta American IPA de nombre “Goose IPA", en su pagina de internet esta cervecería presume ser de corte artesanal estatus del cual actualmente no goza ya que fue adquirida por Grupo AB In Bev uno de los mas grandes productores a nivel mundial de cerveza, uno de los requisitos para poder ser considerada cervecería artesanal es que los insumos sean independientes, lejos de de esto Goose Island goza de un muy buen estatus en el mundo cervecero, solo hay que recordar la euforia con la que se trata de conseguir su popular “Bourbon County” todos los años, por ahora probemos su IPA.
En apariencia tiene una corona de espuma media, que es compuesta por perlas blanquecinas compactas a amplias, mediana retención, actividad de carbonatación ligera, color dorado claro con poca turbiedad, cuerpo ligeramente mediano.
En aroma es básica debido a que no desarrolla tantos aromas, tiene una intensidad de media a baja, los lupulos son el perfil sobresaliente desarrollando notas a naranja, toronja y lima, hay ligero dulzor, muy genérica.
En el paladar es bastante agradable con un amargor medio, los lupulos le dan buena cantidad de frescura, las maltas están de apoyo equilibrando bien el amargor, los sabores desarrollados son toronja, lima, naranja y piña, tambien un ligero carácter a grano, como ya había dicho es bastante sencilla pero muy dentro del estilo, permanencia media en el paladar y un retrogusto a naranja y piña, una cerveza nada despreciable y a un buen costo.

A pale ale that for once is actually pale. Frothy head with little to no lacing. Slight herbal resin aroma. Taste more pine than citrus. Mild astringency works well with medium body malts. Well designed and highly polished IPA it just needs a little more everything. Definitely worth a try.
Pours clear golden. Tastes mild, slightly sweet & of hops & yeast. Light bodied, refreshing & drinkable.
Not a bad beer, but it does leave a significant aftertaste when consumed by itself. Pours very nicely with a nice head and great color.

Aroma: floral, sweet, fruity
Appearance: golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, 
Taste: medium bitterness, citrus, hoppy
Palate: medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter finish,

A 12 fl oz bottle, bottled on 18th November 2016 and best before 18th November 2017. Poured into a Spiegelau IPA glass. It was a clear golden copper colour with a close to three finger white head that had good retention and left great lacing. Aromas were piney with citrus lemon and lime followed by a light sweet malt background. I’m not getting much in the taste. Some sweet and grassy malt and something along the lines of a bitter lemon tea. Light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall it looks great and its aromas were quite nice. Taste was a little too light and one dimensional with just a combination of sweet and long lasting bitterness.

300 ml bottle from local shop. Pours clear golden with a firm, fine, lasting white head, lacing present. Hoppy aroma, fruity, mostly tangerines and peach. Taste is fruity, gooseberry and citrus with a bitter hoppy finish. Medium-bodied, very smooth and pleasant. Great beer, but could be a bit more bitter for my taste.

Couleur blonde über limpide, nez un poil caramel, un poil florale, mousse correcte mais qui ne dure pas des masses sur la longueur. Bonne rondeur en bouche avec du cara qui domine assez. Plutôt léger en ce qui concerne les arômes des houblons. Légères notes métalliques pas terribles. Amertume assez prononcée en fin de bouche et qui dure, dure dure, avec une petite pointe d’astringence. Mouais... l’ensemble s’améliore en se réchauffant, il faut l’avouer (donc à ne pas boire trop fraiche), mais globalement je suis plutôt déception...
Copper, clear nice head. Mild aroma caramel. Tofee, caramel, dry, fruit with caramel aftertaste. Growing bitterness.

Clear gold with lots of carbonation and a lasting head. Nice lacing with aroma of sweet citrus. Medium body with enough hop bitterness to call this an American style IPA although the English makes a better one with the right amount of hops without going over board like American Brewers seem to do these days. Finishes a little dry with a lingering hop taste.
on tap pours golden with medium white head. Aroma is floral, tropical fruits and pine. taste is citrus with some floral notes.

Tap, at the Green Room Ormskirk. I’d had 7 pints before I tried this, which is usally the knell for any impartial review, but despite my inebriation it had shining lights around it. Creamy, hoppy, fresh, refreshing.

0.355l bottle. Hopy aroma, pine and resun notes. Clear golden color, white head. Hopy taste, floral notes, light sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and hopy bitter finish. Good.

Cerveja dourada, com leves luzes acobreadas, boa formação de espuma. Aroma de malte e lúpulo muito equilibrado: dulçor ao fundo, frutas cítricas, manga. Sabor igualmente balanceado, pinho, mel, frutado e amargor no ponto. Final seco, de média duração, retrogosto amargo, corpo médio e ótima carbonatação. Super refrescante, dá pra tomar várias. Um clássico do estilo.

355ml bottle. Pours crystal clear amber with an off white head. Really malty on the nose with some lemon, touch of grapefruit and something floral. It’s got a really rich mouth feel to it. Very sweet caramel malts to begin with, leading into some lemon. Kind of like a strong lager, but then finally get some dry bitterness right at the end. Not my favourite IPA by any means, but it is fairly satisfying.

Zastanawiałem się (i nadal zastanawiam) skąd to piwo ma tak wysokie oceny. Wizualnie jest jeszcze nieźle, chociaż piwo jest klarowne. Zawsze preferuję mętne ipy, piana średnioziarnista, nie zostawia śladu na szkle i dość szybko opada. Aromat mocno przeciętny, gdzieś tam wyczuwalne jakieś owoce tropikalne, ledwo cytrusy, wszystko miesza się ze słodowością. W smaku słodowość i owoce w typie mango, cytrusów jak na lekarstwo. Goryczka z początku nieśmiała, mocniejsza jest na finiszu, ale nie narzucająca się. W skali od 10 do eurolagera umieściłbym je gdzieś pośrodku skali.
Can 473 ml - Copper color. Small head. Interesting aroma. Nice hop taste with amertume at the end. Good IPA that has a large distribution.

Bière blonde, avec un arôme fleuri, un peu métallique, une robe d’un doré très clair, sans mousse mais semble telle très pétillante. Un goût très prononcé de houblon, herbacée, fleural, le palais garde cette amertume de houblon, un IBU de 55, voilà une bière qui est intéressante pour ceux qui aime l’amertume, perso j’adore

On tap at Goose Island Vintage Ale House, Balham n 8th February 2017. Amber with almost white foam and full lacing. Richly hoppy with savoury nuttiness and tangy fruits, applying to aroma, liquid drain and finish. Medium bodied with a zingy mouthfeel.

Bottle from GI Japan web store, unfortunately sent 10 months old. Pours a lovely orange gold, great sticky lacing from a low white head. Fresh pine and biscuit aroma, sweet citrus, orange, bergamot. Piney taste with honey sweet malt, grass, citrus. Smooth and balanced taste and feel, lively carbonation, medium hop bitter finish, clean. Classic style IPA, really easy drinking, pretty bulletproof to taste this bright and fresh so long after bottling.

Pours golden with medium white head. Aroma is floral, tropical fruits, soap, some vanilla, toffee notes, citrus. Taste is tropical fruits, pine, citrus, some floral notes, pear, some bitterness, light toffee. Nice beer!

bottle, clear gold with white head. caramel aroma dominates, some citrus and resinous hops too. tastes of lemonpeel, orange, lotta pale malts. hops come through without any bitterness. its light & flavour wise its an ipa but its kinda soft and soapy

Maybe it’s because it was my first ipa or maybe it’s just really good ipa but I really like it. Nice white head maybe dissapering fast but it’s leaving nice lacing. Aromas of pine, mango and grapefruit connecting with really good bitterness and sweetness of grapfruit making this beer probably one of my best beers I ever tried.

(12oz bottle) AROMA: raw malt/grain, yeast, cheese, tiny bit floral/detergent. APPEARANCE: clear, medium orange-yellow, ok head, some creaminess. TASTE: solid ale, bitter hops, sweet roasted corn, toffee, black tea with milk. Solid malt for an IPA. Leans more on bittering hops than dry hopped floralness, dark toast finish. PALATE: not too heavy, refreshing, moderate bitterness. OVERALL: unique IPA in that it has more creamy/toasty malt that provide more warmth and not overly dry hopped. Could be a daily IPA.

Malt-heavy, full of caramel and biscuit with a semisweet middle, traces of orange-citric hops with a dry floral fade. Weird dirty metallic flavor works its way into the finish; not bad, just a strange addition. Expected more from Goose IPA, but I’m not sure why.

On tap.
Fruity hops aroma, grapefruit, citrus lime.
Clear gold blond with a fading head. Yet a small layer lasted.
Malts, grapefruit, ananas in the taste.
Dry long finish, not a lot of carbo.

Bottle. Pours pale amber with a medium white foam. Scent is medium musky IPA properties. Taste is consistent IPA with sort of dirty water and weird burned caramel flavors. Finish is consistent. Quite good.

Bottle. Pours a decent amber with a fluffy white head. Nose is incredibly hoppy, with grapefruit, lemon, and perhaps a little toffee. Taste is really nice, very hoppy as to be expected, but theres a definite toffee note in there tempering everything down. A good mix of sweet and bitter. A nice dryness cutting through everything. I like this one.

Acheter chez Vanuxeem à Ploegstreert .
Bouteille de 35,5cl.
couleur : Dorée , translucide ! belle couleur .
Mousse bien abondante mais qui redescend assez vite pour finir sur un petit col de mousse .
Au nez : c’est agrumés , le citron est bien présent , ainsi que le houblon !
En bouche : c’est intéressant. les notes d’agrumes tel que le citron ( citron vert et jaunes ) ainsi que le pamplemousse sont intensement presente .
l’amertume est toute en rondeur présente du début a la fin . 
une fin en bouche plutot sèche mais pas désagreable !
sensation désaltérante très bien!

Même si je ne suis pas un spécialiste, je trouve que cette bière IPA en bouteille 355ml est une très bonne IPA : bien équilibrée, bien houblonnée (--> fruits jaunes dont pamplemousse, épices, pin), bien longue. Very good, Mr Citra !

Pours golden clear. Low carbonation and minimal head retention. Slight fruit citrus smell. Grapefruit taste, dry malt taste. Medium bitterness. Overall: very average IPA. Needs more hop aroma, carbonation and complexity.

Pours clear deep golden, with a small white head, good lacing. Aroma is light lager malts, with floral and citrus notes. Taste is malty as aroma, with bitter hops, gummy candy, citrus. Taste closer to a lager than to an IPA. Disappointing.
On draught at the airport. Clear gold with a foam head. High bitterness, walnut, chestnut, earth, dry leaves. Dry earth in the finish. One dimensional
balanced malt and piney hop aromas. gold and clear in color with nice head. taste is hop forward but has nice light malt notes that shine through. finishes clean and smooth

Bottle from Co-op. Pours clear copper gold with a fluffy off-white head and lots of refreshing bubbles.  Whereas before I had struggled with the nose, this time I had lots of sweet barley sugar and sweet caramel malt. I had warm, spicy hops last time but didn't get it this time. A malty and caramel front flavour with plenty barley sugars and toffee.  It has a prominent but far from overpowering grass and pine bitter hop finish.  A soft medium body with a little oiliness and a light yet crisp carbonation.  Nicely balanced and very drinkable.  Nowhere near as hoppy as I was expecting.  Feels like an amped up yet traditional IPA.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Obtained from a tap at Bubba’s 33. New to try a Goose Island but it is a time to start. Pours a color of medium yellow along with a light foam that laces well nonetheless. I detect spruce, hay, sort of grassy. It has a slightly astringent finish with a decent little push of bitterness at the end.Decent but no great excitement.
On tap at The Bellagio. Great example of the style, plenty of citrus and pine with a touch of resin, very drinkable stuff.

CAN. (CannedNov12/16). Pours a light gold with thick fluffy head, laces well.. Herbal/Botanical hoppy nose.. Sweet malt body, easy hop middle goes to a sharp bitter bite.. sourced 247 Excalibur Las Vegas

Clear golden, medium white head. Average retention. Fruit nectar, melon on nose. Medium body. The flavour shows honey malts, melon and light to medium bitterness. Not impressive within the style.

Blonde; mousse moyenne; citron, fruits, légère amertume. Belle fraicheur avec un côté citronné qui perdure. Bien fait.

Aroma: citrus, tropical fruits, gentle caramel. 
Appearance: pale, clear, white head with good retention.
Taste: good hoppy citrusy and tropical tastes. low caramel level taste. lightly bitter, light sweetness.
light body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, bitter, not harsh. 
Overall nicely balanced and pleasant but not exceptional.
Flasa Saltney. Zlata farba, slaba biela pena. Vona sladova, citrusova, karamelova. Chut sladova, karamelova, jemne citrusova. Horka dochut. Celkom prijemne.
Good IPA taste on first sip without a strong hoppy bite to finish. Easy to drink.
Bottle. Notes of grapefruit, citrus, biscuit, floral, herby. Soft foamy to oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Transparent ruby yellow hue with a mid sized white head containing admirable retention. Robust, but stereotypical ipa aroma consisting of pine, grapefruit, lemon, caramel and orange. Mid bodied. More malt forward than expected. Although hops and citrus as well as mild tropical fruit are certainly present, the finish is actually rather sweet and malty. Pleasant, but typical traditional ipa.

From tap at Chicago airport. Pours golden with practically no foam. Aroma is floral, with some additional citrus. Herbs coming up too when warmer. Body is medium. Taste has strong bitterness which overpowers pretty much anything else, including probably a decent malt base.

Bottle 33 cl @ Steak & Grill Amsterdam. Giallo ambrato, limpido, schiuma bianca fine , persistente. Aroma intenso e fine sebbene non troppo complesso. Luppoli aromatici tendenti all’agrumato, arancia candita, resinoso (piney). Maltato tendente al grano, cereali. Gusto secco, luppolato, fresco erbaceo, poi maltato, lievemente più abboccato. Interessante finale fruttato che ricorda l’uva bianca, non troppo amaro per lo stile. Poco corposa, non molto carbonata, poco calda. Solo in parte spigolosa. Equilibrata ed armonica.
Can on a Flight with United Airlines - An okay IPA, rather on the herbal side. Some fruits as well. Rather sweet. Bitter finish. Okay.
Fruity berry aroma, somewhat dry texture, medium in body, massive hoppy taste that lasts forever

Bottle in hotel in Indy. Fresh citrus aroma. Rich colour. Traditional IPA, with a good spicy aftertaste. Good to back stateside with quality IPAs all over the place. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flasche gekauft in irgendeinem Kiosk im Village in New York.Gelbes Bernstein, wenig Schaum, klar. Intensives Aroma nach Zitrone, Grapefruit, Aprikose, Südfrüchte. Geschmack: Würig, bitter, Grapefruit (wird stärker), Birne. Fruchtig, sanft, etwas bitter im Gaumen. Komplex und vielschichtig.
Aroma of hops. Amber with medium white head. Medium bitterness, lightly sour. dry finish.

5.9%. IPA.

Poured out gold. 6°SRM.

Nose has pleasant beery aroma with fresh pine hints.

Mouthfeel is soapy. Sweet pale malt, graham cracker, pie crusts. Hops are pine, grass, light resin, bitter melon. Hops are aggressive in front but do not hang around long.

Finish is medium.

Goes on Favorites List!

Big aroma of sticky tropical fruit, like mango and maybe a hint of papaya, kind of falls flat in the mouth with lots of malty syrupy sweetness, tastes more like a standard pale ale. Somewhat unbalanced. Okay beer.

Draft at 13th Avenue Pub. Pours a cloudy medium amber with a loose and sudsy off-white head that sticks around for a while. Odd nose; mix of vegetal, bread dough, herbal hops, and some toasty bread crust. The hops seem a funny choice, and there’s promise enough in the malt notes, but then the off-notes throw everything away. Still, the flaws are not overwhelming. They’re just sloppy. Creamy medium body with moderate carb. Lightly toasted caramel, vegetal notes, herbal hop, and some bread dough on the mid palate. Muddy, indistinct finish. I paid for the whole pint, but I only needed the first 20% or so before we moved on to the next place.

From 330 ml bottle. Amber with a bit of a white head. Tastes very hoppy with bitterness. Feels like a stronger ABV than it actually is. One of the better IPAs that are common to but in the supermarket

Poured from a bottle into a wine glass, (pinkies up). The appearance holds a translucent golden-orange with a simple thin white head of light foam. The aroma opens up with a citrus and tropical fruti collsion carrying over into the tasting as I get notes of tangerine, grapefruit, papaya, mango and some grass and pine dank to follow. A pleasant lightweight IPA.

16 oz pour on draft at Camden Food Co in Orlando International Airport, Terminal B. Shaker pint. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, floral, light malt. Tastes of citrus, floral, subtle pine, light toasty notes, malt. Medium body with a dry finish.
NOrmal and quite bitter. Strong in hop aroma and quite thick NEcessary to pair it with some food to balance.
Bottle. Clear honey-color, tiny white head. Aroma is hoppy with some citrus friut. Taste is a bit spicy and hoppy with a long lasting and bitter finish. Very hoppy IPA.

Bouteille achetée Au Grain D’Orge - De couleur dorée avec une belle mousse blanche crémeuse qui colle au verre - Au nez un belle équilibre entre houblon et malt, les houblons agrumeux, pamplemousse, orange, kumkwat, pin et très resineux, malt légèrement caramel - En bouche tres résineuse, toujour beaucoup d’agrumes, plus sur l’orange, malt bien présent apporte un bon corp et légèrement caramel- Corp léger/moyen, amertume moyenne, carbonation parfaite, sèche, final sèche resineuse et agrumes longue - très bonne surprise, une superbe american IPA bien équilibrée avec un bon corp malté et un superbe choix de houblon

Bouteille de 355ml. Couleur dorée limpide, mousse moyenne d’ assez belle tenue. Une Ipa assez étonnante dans la mesure ou on y retrouve un côté fleuri, je la trouverais presque un brin fumée. Une belle carbonnation et une sacrée longueur. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.

After thousands of cans and bottles....(not all in one sitting); We are ready for an actual rating.

Pours clear light gold/honey with a tall off white sudsy head with a lot of lacing. Nose of pine, peach, faint black tea, and toasted crusty bread. Bittersweet. Good resiny hops with peach, bubble-gum, and mandarin orange. A ubiquitous beer nowadays, but really solid and tasty. Just about the only decent IPA that’s readily available at any beers store simply because of the AB-Inbev connection.
Copper clear. Usual flowery aroma. Straightforward, no bs. Generously hopped, but not too much. Leaves a bitter boogie that fades to watery tropical fruitiness.

Can bought at an LCBO in Toronto Canada. Pours a clear copper color. Thick soapy head. Aroma of caramel, malt, plum liquor, some pine. Taste mirrors the aroma plus bitter hops and some dark fruits. Refreshing. Strong alcohol in taste. Medium carbonation. Overall a good malty American IPA.

Tried on draft. Solid IPA with clean taste. Hoppy without citrus. Not a distinct taste of a particular hop.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wonderful IPA. Not super hoppy, but pretty tasty. One downside is that the bottle over fizzed after opening (after being stationary in my fridge for 3 days).
From 12oz bottle. Intense smell of hops as soon as bottle is opened. Pours golden-yellow to orange with thick white head. Good retention. Hoppy, citrus aroma with slightly bitter end. Very good IPA.

Can at work by MisoT, thanks. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, grapefruit, caramel, hops pellets. Taste is bitter, medium sweet, citrusy, nicely hoppy, caramel, malty backbone. Really nice IPA.

Pours clear golden with thin white head. Nose is fruity and citrusy. Aromas are caramel malts, pine, citrus. Average carbonation, medium body. Long bitter and resinous finish.

Draft. Hazy golden with a medium white head. Moderate hoppy aroma of grass, pine, floral and citrus, lightly malty with notes of caramel and resin. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body, with a slightly slick texture. Average carbonation. Medium bitterness.

Kind of a deep apple juice color with small head. Biscuity malts and floral hops on nose. Nice balance of citrus & pine hops providing bittering against bready malt sweetness. Shorter finish with pronounced bitterness.
Fresh citrus and piney aromas. Easy palate with loads of hops, citrus fruits and grass. Well made ipa in all aspects.

Robe dorée, fine mousse. Nez agréable sur des notes houblonnées, des fruits jaunes bien mûrs, une pointe d’agrumes et de farine. Bouche à l’attaque fruitée, raffraîchissante, équilibrée, une fine bulle et une finale agréable et sans défaut. Une bière bien faite, de soif.
12oz bottle. Dark gold light copper with white head. Malt and hop competing nose, some off fruit too. Taste is too sweet for style, a little off, maybe old. Not very good, and barely an ipa.

Cloudy light amber color with moderate activity. Faint creamy light brown 2 finger head, lasting around 5 to 10 minutes, with a very good amount of legs.

Aromas of faint pine, sweet hops, with faint flowers. Flavors of soft pine, a little hoppy and buttery, citrus lemon and orange, herbal and floral spices. Nice balance with sugary yet highly sharp feel.

Smooth slick full body with prickly carbonation. Medium strength finish, ending with a lingering citrus and piney coat, grassy and buttery.

Overall good quality craft. Pleasant hops and not excessive. Good intensity and accessible. The smell is a little like wet cardboard with a small lack of freshness, but still alright. Does the job.

12 oz bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a clear darker golden yellow with a thin white head that falls down to a bubbly ring with a couple spots of lace. The aroma is a little old. There is some light hops left and a decent malt backbone here. There is a light lemongrass thing happening and this isn’t awful in retrospect. It’s just interesting. The flavor is strange. There is an old hop and malt thing happening. It’s sweet and lightly syrupy with a hint of fruitiness. I’m just not enjoying this one at all. The mouth feel is thinner and light with a slit under carbonation and a lingeringly sweet malt and hint of bitter hop and lemongrass on the finish. Oh well.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is some citrus hops, tropical fruit, some bread, metallic, bitter. Appearance is golden amber, white head, clear. Taste is bitter, malty, citrus, bitter, lots of malt though. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, bitter citrus hops and malt aftertaste. Overall, this is decent but nothing special.

Bottle. Clear golden to light amber, smaller white head. Aroma malts, caramel, mandarins. Quite full body. Taste first sweet malty, turning bitter on the palate.

clear dark golden colour, moderate sized, slightly yellowish head; aroma of floral notes, resins, fruitiness and biscuits; taste is the same; surprisingly sweet IPA

Bu directement de la bouteille de 341ml. Odeur assez malté, floral, un peu fruité. Goût semblable, amertume qui se prolonge un peu en bouche. IPA respectable qui ne réussi pas à se démarquer dans le marché.
Para quem gosta de amargor, é boa. Pouco encorpada, macia........................

New york
Golden, clear small white head
aroma of citus and malt

Round bitter finish.

Servido en una pinta nonic Goose Island. APARIENCIA: de color ámbar/dorado, se observa cristalina y moderada actividad de carbonatación; de corona de espuma color blanco, de buena retención y burbujas compactas

AROMA: Lúpulo de carácter floral y cítrico es lo que predomina, pero más cargado hacia lo floral, además de ligero dulzor de las maltas, algunas notas caramelo.

SABOR: de entrada amargor moderado ligero, seguido de notas florales y cítricas de los lúpulos usados, seguido de notas dulces de las maltas, ligeras notas a caramelo; en el retrogusto queda ese amargor medio ligero, seco y no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: Cuerpo ligero, carbonatación media ya que se llega a sentir algo de crispar en la lengua.
RESUMEN: Una buena cerveza de acuerdo al estilo, bastante sesionable y refrescante.

355 ml bottle as “Goose Island IPA” bought at Q-Club in SoHo, Central.



Looks: Translucent orange honey colour; Less than one-quarter finger head and residual soapy white foam which fades in 10 seconds; Fair sticky lacing with notable slight carbonation.



Aroma: Quite fragrant Ale malt, with grapefruit, floral, light honey, lemon peel, orange, resin and light grass.



Taste: Mid to light sweet Ale malt, with light candied fruits, light grapefruit, floral, strong molasses, resins, biscuits, lemon, mid to high bitter hops and grass.



Body: Close to medium body. Dry, slick and oozy palate.



Mouth Feel: Very good Ale maltyness in a slick and smooth background. Simple but quite tasty juicy fruits and grapefruits dominate. Nice strong sweetness with floral match with strong resin ooze. Fair lemon to round. Pretty good!



Hoppiness: Grapefruit, floral, light honey, lemon peel, orange, resin in nose. Candied fruits, light grapefruit, floral, resins, lemon and grass in taste. Bitterness is moderately strong for a lasting, mid-to-high astringent bitter sweet finish.



After Taste: Quite dry. Oozy and fruity-bitter to mouth.



Comments: For typical craft IPA, this is pretty mild in aroma and taste, yet the candied fruit and strong ooze make this light one pretty enticing to drink. Some dry hopping and strong body will do this one more justice. Okay.

Piwo prosto ze Stanów ;) Dość jasny, złoty kolor i bardzo ładna, biała, puszysta piana. Koronka na szkle wręcz wzorowa. Piwo wygrywało kilka razy w amerykańskich konkursach w kategorii English IPA. Aromat świeży, słodowy, chmielowy. W smaku przyjemne cytrusy, specyficzna goryczka, trudna od opisania, bo z jednej strony intensywna, z drugiej pozostawia lekki, aksamitny posmak w ustach. Ogólnie wytrawne, z lekką słodyczą w tle. Średnie, w kierunku niskiego wysycenie sprawia, że Goose IPA jest ekstremalnie pijalne. Baaardzo fajne piwo!

Draught at Michael Jordan at Grand Central. 

Pours amber with a off white head. 
Malty with a taste of fudge, a little nutty and some oranges.

Amber goudgeel, helder, een behoorlijke schuimkraag. Schuim blijft lang en plakt keurig langs het glas. Hoppige geur, fruitig zoet, bloemen en citrus. Als het bier wat opwarmd dan ruik je ook wat moutigs. Smaak is fruitig en zoet en citrus/grapefruit. Lekker hopbitter die even na blijft werken. Redelijk subtiel dat wel. Lichte body, lekker fris. Prima subtiele IPA.

Golden, almost clear, disappearing head but lasting laces. Pineapple aroma. Fresh taste wirh tropical fruit. Well balanced and very drinkable.

330ml bottle served in a chalice. 
 
A: Pours a slightly cloudy orange color forming a medium and light creamy head with medium retention leaving lots of spotty and lingering lacings in the glass.

S: Sweet caramel and tropical fruits. Melon, grapefruits, pine, pineapple.

T: Slightly sweet upfront. Green mango, melon, pine, pineapple and grapefruit. Medium bitterness. In overall, taste is dry but very smooth.

M: Light body. Average carbonation. Pine and fruity aftertaste.

O: Good Drinkability. Great and very smooth IPA.

Have enjoyed this many times on tap and from the bottle. Good strong hoppy nose. Light amber color. Rich mouthfeel. Enough alcohol at 5.9 and sweetness to balance the strong hops IBU 55. But not too sweet. One of my go to standard IPA's.

Pours a very clear light amber. Great head and head retention. Mild floral hoppiness, pretty cleanly made beer.

Bottle to snifter. Lots of lemon like citrus with grassy times and a touch of buttered toast in the nose. Fairly clear. Minimal head. Taste is crisp with hop bitterness and follows with more lemon and a slight pepper. Nice.

Not a bad choice of you don't have much of one . It has a descent hops flavor but no real aftertaste which is good .

Hoppy aroma. Clear gold to amber color, short-lasting head. Tastes medium bitter. An average IPA.

Orange gold clear pour, moderate foamy head. Plenty of carbonation. Light malts quickly overtaken by citrus hops with a touch of peach. Lingers without being aggressive. Good.

Butelka 355 ml . Ciemnozlote o bialej sredniej pianie. Aromat cytrusow.trawy i chmielu. W smaku wytrawne o ciejawym chmielowym finiszu ktory miesza sie z delikatnym cytrusowym posmakiem i slodkimi nutami. Swietne ,wielokrotnie nagradzane IPA . 

 Marcin G

Bottle from Morrisons. Pours copper with good white head and good lacing. Nice and clear. Aromas of slightly dank hops with a touch of citrus. Taste is medium malt with a bitter dry finish. A solid drinkable ipa but lacks any punch.

Woody slight citrus aroma, initial bittersweet hoppy taste blankets the tongue, followed by an increasing sweetness, similar to Haribo sweets, rising briefly before returning to a long lasting medium bitter finish.

355ml. bottle from Sainsburys with b/b 18/11/16. Sampled at home. Pours almost crystal clear gold with medium cabonation and near white head which dissipates slowly. Initial aroma of peach/apricot with dark marmalde edge and light biscuity malt and light pine. Very nice. Light to medium mouth feel. Bitter-sweet orange flavour with lingering hop bitterness to finish. Biscuity malt more prominent on the nose as the beer warms up a bit. Bitter-sweet, refreshing IPA.

355ml bottle from Asda. Pours clear amber with a thick white head that dissipates quite quickly. Aroma is woody with citrus notes. Taste is mildly sweet and quite hoppy, with a long hop finish. Good IPA.
Bottle from Albert Heijn. Clear orange colour, beige foam. Sweet nose of lychee, pineapple and honey. Bitter hoppy finish. Some notes of caramel and harsh bitterness. Ok IPA.

2/10/16 Washington DC ($5 12 oz draft pour into beer mug at Harry’s Pub). Golden pour, mild carbonation, thin white head with medium lacing. Hops aroma the predominant smell. Dry bitter hoppy pleasant taste, texture firm, nice medium carbonation lingers, feels good going down. Overall good offering I finally got around to entering into RB,
Strong Fruity aroma, big foamy white head, Orange in colour, very hippy not bad worth a taste

Bottle at home. Deep golden with a white head. Nice lacing. Grass, grapefruit, citrus fruits and herbal notes in the aroma. Very low carbonation makes it extremely smooth, perhaps even too much. Grassy and grapefruity in flavour. Good balance between bitterness and sweetness.
Bottle from Waitrose. Pours with deep white head that dissipates slowly. Clear pale amber color. Aroma of apple and pine. Dry resiny taste.

Kolor: Pomarańczowy. Piwo jest w 100% klarowne. 


Piana: Drobno pęcherzykowa, ciemno biała. Warstewka długo się utrzymuje i bardzo ładnie zdobi ścianki szkla.
Bardzo fajnie zaznacza każdy łyk. 


Zapach: Niesamowity, głęboki i niezapomniany aromat igiełek sosnowych. Bardzo dominujący żywiczny zapach przykrywający nawet owocową woń.
Czuć też również herbatę i lekki karmel. 


Smak: W smaku nuty żywiczne połączone z grejpfrutową owocowością oraz skórką pomarańczy.
Piwo ma także herbaciano-ziołowy profil.
Prócz tego można w nim znaleźć trochę karmelu i trawiastych akcentów.
Goryczka jest solidna i dość długa.
Finisz wyrażnie ziołowy z delikatnym grejpfrutem.
Odczucie w ustach średniopełne.
Bardzo dobrze zbalansowane piwo.


Wysycenie: Niskie. 


Podsumowanie:  


Goose Island IPA to jedno z najbardziej rozpoznawalnych i znanych IPA na świecie.
Sam browar to potęga! 
Wystarczy spojrzeć na ich profil na FB - 538 tys. polubień na FB! 
Mało który browar w Europie może się poszczycić taką liczbą.
Browar ma siedzibę w Chicago.

Bardzo dobre piwo.
Tym różni się od innych IPA, że w aromacie można w nim wyczuć przede wszystkim nuty żywiczne, a dopiero w drugiej kolejności czuć owoce cytrusowe.
Profil piwa jest również dość oryginalny: są tutaj zioła, lekka trawiastość oraz herbaciane nuty (w klimacie Earl Grey).
"Gąska" jest idealnie zbalansowana i przede wszystkim smaczna.

Pours clear copper with a fine white head. Nose is tame and typical IPA. Flavor profile is also very standard for the style with a touch of earthy tones on the back. Finish is quick and clean. Drinkable but unremarkable.

An excellent example of a IPA.

Pours a light gold with a head with some staying power.
Smells of pine and grass, maybe a lemon. Straight up hop flower taste with a bitter finish.

Downer is that it’s hard to find here.

Just a solid IPA. Full mouth feel, piney aromas. Nice resin and citrus - maybe grapefruit on the palate. Crisp, hoppy finish. A very good single IPA. Goes splendidly with a grill and a hot day, and the one good thing about ABInbev is that I found this in Mexico on vacation.
Tap at Zio’s Pizza. Pours clear golden with white head that lasts. Aroma was pine, citrus and hops. Taste was bitter and pine.

Appearance- very light toffee gold in colour, with medium/thick white foam. Aroma- sweet grapefruit and honey, with citrus notes. Palate- medium body, smooth. Taste- bitter grapefruit, simple, fresh and hoppy. Overall: a good IPA for a chilled evening.

Clear pineapple gold color with thick white foam. Aromas are sweet and hoppy, reminds of new world hops that are fruity, nice for an IPA. Palate, medium body, with hoppy bite on the mouth, honey smooth finish of bitter hops. Taste is hoppy, bit bitter also reminds of grass bitterness has some hints of grapefruit at the back too. Nice beer! Especialy as a sesstion IPA (if that it is what I think it is) would be nice and easy to drink and not wastery. If you are in a bar and you do not want lager take this.

This was a very nice ipa it was hoppy and nice on the palate! I really enjoyed the floral notes and crispness of this beer

A fruity aroma of grapefruit, light bitter smell of hops. The head is small, white and milky with a normal duration. The body is dark orange. A light bitter taste, very dry in the mouth, the finish is long and bitter. The body is light to medium strong, very dry and light creamy with a lively carbonation.
Bottle at home. Clear golden colour. Moderate citrus, bitterness and hoppness. Dry clean finish. Drinkable.

Pours a pale golden with finger of white fluffy head that recedes slowly and clings/laces nicely. Aroma is very citrus. Flavor is not bad, but entirely underwhelming - a slight bitter from the hops, and a slight maltiness do balance to make for a very drinkable brew, but it’s so light in body as to be very boring. Finish is clean, not surprising given the general lack of flavor.

Astonished that this can claim to be an IPA. I think they’ve labelled the wrong bottle. It’s like all the happiness has dissolved. Little aroma, weird strongly toasted malts and strong bitterness. Even the colour for a "pale malt only" IPA is amber/red. Never had an English IPA taste this bad.

Bottle. Thanks to mikkvoika. Pours slightly hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is sweetish with some hopiness, tropical fruits, caramel, hay,pine, slight toffee, Taste is sweet and bitter, butterscotch, grass, fruits, caramel. Smooth bitter finish.
Hele mooie heldere kleur met minimale achuimkraag. Aroma is erg goed, de smaak is ook niet verkeerd.

473ml can. Slightly hazy copper body, medium white head, average retention, some lacing. Fruity aroma: peaches, mangoes, apricots, honey. Taste of grapefruit zest, caramel candies, a touch of herbs and peppercorn. Decent.
Good readily available IPA. Aromas metallic led, malty cracker in the middle with a floral finish. Palate is very malty with a very slight hoppy finish.

I have had it on draft and bottle. Pours nice rich Amber color. Not my favorite IPA. Good and full bodied, but a little bitter with not much on the aroma or citrus flavoring. This IPA is readily available so a good one I have bust not the best.
Nice dry hoppy taste. Hint of citrus, nuts, herbs. Long and bitter finish.Bottle 335ml.

It’s so tempting to give up on this beer now that it’s owned by InBev and available pretty much everywhere, but that’d be missing the point. This is a pretty solid, pretty good IPA that you can get pretty much everywhere. I even had it at a bowling alley last night. It is well-made and tasty, and while it lacks a ton of hop complexity and the intensely aromatic hop smells of the best IPAs, I’ll happily drink it anywhere I see it.
For an IPA this bear appeared pretty ’dull’ to me. Hoptones were tasteful, but disappeared quite quickly and the taste ’died out’.

HOME (2016.01.02): 35.5 cl bottle. A clear dark yellow beer with a good off-white head. Aroma is light malty. For the rest a nice hop smell with fruitiness (apple, pear, light citrus-like). Taste is light sweet whit somewhat malty, which give enough body for the dry hop-bitter character of this beer. Citrus-like fruity/marmalade. In the finish somewhat yeast and biscuit. Reasonable beer, but not a topper.
Bottle 33cl. Pours golden, clear, average head. Aroma of malts, hint of spices, hops, metal. Taste of sour malts, metal, hops, faint fruits.
Pours clear yellow. Aroma is lightly citrus. Taste is nice balance if bready may and citrusy hops. Not bad.

Simple IPA, decent beer but pretty mediocre when compared to other IPAs. The malt is a bit thin so it does not balance out the hops. I often like hoppy unbalanced IPAs but at the same time the malt needs to present the hop variety used in its best light and I don’t think this beer really does that. Still is an ok beer compared to beers overall but not very high on the IPA list.

Brilliant light amber color with strong, persistent pear head. Faint aroma balanced with grain malt and floral hops. Medium strength floral flavor. Overall bitter hop flavor. Weak carbonation with drying mouthfeel. fresh, medium and biter finish.

33cl bottle from the supermarket (InBev, eh?). Pours a clear amber, with a white head with decent retention, that gives way to a sticky lacing. Smells of barley malt, honey and citrus hops. The taste follows the same notes, with caramel, malted barley, mellow grapefruit. Smooth mouthfeel, a pleasure to drink, definitely a sessionable beer.
Amazing beer. Great hopy taste, exact bitterness with a fresh aftertaste. Good carbonation, all around great beer!
Aroma marcante, cor dourada e espuma densa. Sabor amargo, mas que deixa uma sensação muito boa em seu paladar.

Bottle@hotel, from Food Emporium, NYC, USA. Medium fresh bit sweet aroma of citrus and fruits. Golden color with medium white head and slightly hazy liquid. Medium/light taste with citrus, hops and some hoppy malts. Medium balanced with medium taste spectrum and medium hoppy aftertaste of malts. Light body with medium carbonation. Overall refreshing though very simple product. Citrus is implemented quite well.
Pours clear golden with thin white head. Light aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is malty and hoppy, light bitterness. Soft carbonation, light-medium body. A pleasant IPA.

Sampled on draught at The Tilted Kilt on S Wabash, Chicago. A clear amber colour with a white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of fruity hops. The taste has a mild, bready maltiness and hop flavours of marmalade, lemon, grapefruit and pine. A tasty but slightly bland IPA. I would like to have more malt in the balance, but this is still a tasty beer.

Bottle. Pours a clear, clear amber with good carbonation, lacing and head. Impressive to look at.

Aromas are sweet malt, apricot, raisin, tangerine, marmalade, spice, pine and touch of soap. Goldings and Cascade are the hops that come through the most. Medium bitter, fruity medium finish.

Almost, but not quite there.
Not much here. disappointed. but what should i expect from AB-InBev though.

341 ml bottle. Pours a slightly veiled orange tinted golden with a resilient white head. Aroma is grapefruit, orange, lime and lemon. Flavor is sweet, fruity, cereal. Fresh. Finish is grapefruit, lime, lemon, nice, lingering bitterness. Medium body, soft, velvety mouthfeel, average carbonation. A solid, simple, efficient IPA.
AH. Lekker hoor! Tot nu toe favoriet van de nieuwe supermarktbieren. Backlog from 2015/03/28.
Alone at home. Clear goldblond colored beer with medium white head and lots of carbonation. Hopped floral aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped sweet slightly bitter.
Pours a clear golden color with a full white head. Aroma is bread dough and hops. Taste is sweet pale malt, fresh bread, pine cones and moderate hop bitterness. Good one.
Bottle. Pours a hazy amber with a a big white head. Aroma is all hops and malts with the taste having some sweetness and fruit to it.
L’arôme faible des agrumes. En bouche il y a plein du corps, pamplemousse et une moyenne amertume pour le style.

Not much Pine Sol, pretty mild hop flavor, not in your face. Somewhat earthy hops. Not bad.

Pours ligbt amber nice aroma of citru and hops. Thin white head. Taste is similar to aroma nice full a little creamy with a slightly bitter finish.
Aroma of citrus, taste is citrusy, hoppy, decent alcohol presence, okay, but others are better.
Clear golden beer with a slight/medium off-white head. Medium aroma; taste starts medium sweet and ends slightly bitter and dry. Caramel, orange, pine, hops and citrus. 7/3/7/3
Ok not bad bit hyped up better than stella jumping on the bandwagon honesty best policy now fuck off

This one is a Great IPA. Pours amber with quickly deminishing head. Nose citric hops but a bit quickly vanishing. Taste is fruity with hints of resin. Pomelo, bitter lemon and somthing like campfire in the back... Dunno. Long not to dry finish... I damn like it...

Really enjoyed this beer. Nice appearance, nice aroma, nice taste. Specially enjoyed its bitterness.

clear orange-amber hue and thin head laces glass, strong grapefruit bouquet with malt undertone. Biting bitter flavor and finish, well rounded malts. somewhat soapy mouthfeel.

W aromacie żywice, średnia owocowość, głównie ananas, ice tea świadczące o utlenieniu. W smaku zbożowe ciało, żywiczne chmiele, tu też nuty utlnienia, lekki miód, ice tea, nieco kartonu. Goryczka spora, ale niezbyt szlachetna. Dominanta cascade’a. Tanie, niezbyt przekonujące. Thanks @vipinvelp

Pours amber with a finger head. Has some citrus bite. But Somewhat lacking. Very nice on the palate,a little creamy and finishes surprisingly soft. A very good beer for what I get them for. 2 16oz cans for $3. I’ll drink them all day. Top shelf.

Really nicely done. Attractive colour with long lasting head. Grapefruit aroma. Balanced bitterness on the tongue and a long pleasant finish.

Bottled. Clear golden, white head. Aroma is sweet malts, ripe sweet fruits, citrus. Taste is similar with sweet malts again, some honey, less fruity flavors and a very good dry bitter finish. Medium body, watery texture, medium carbonation. Very good.

D’un blond lumineux qui arbore une mousse mince. Un nez houblonné et savonneux. C’est faible comme arômes. Un goût amer et quelque chose qui rappelle l’assouplisseur à lessive. Poured into a special IPA glass, pours with a thick head of foam which lowers a little later on. Aromas of pine, and not much else. First taste is oily, resiny and bitter, but the bitterness gives way to a full hoppy taste. 
Tastes really good, easy to drink IPA, but having a hard time trying to discover more than what happened at first taste.
355ml bottle as Goose Island India Pale Ale. Clear and golden with a thin but lingering white head. Soft fruit aroma, taste is bitter grapefruit. Decent

Draft at CMH Chili's. Copper gold with plenty of white head and lacing and ample carbonation. Nose is mostly florals and orange zest. Flavor featured pine resin and a dry bitter finish...

Gold with slight amber color and a little white head. Aroma is lightly pine hops. Flavor is slightly pine hops, mildly resinous. Medium body and malt. Fairly standard IPA.

Hop hop hoppiness! Tons of hop bitterness with a very light sweetness to the body. It calms nicely on the palate. I dig it.

Deep yellow color with a decent head. Rich bready malt with plenty of pine and citrus to counter. Pretty good drinker, surprised I haven’t rated this before.
12 oz can poured on a flight to Dallas. Smells like hops and citrus. Tastes bitter with a nice hop finish. Drank it from a can so I can’t talk about appearance. Good beer. Very drinkable.

Bottle at home. Pours a polished amber colour with a white head that fades quickly. Rich aroma of resin pine and grapefruit. Sweet to start, then lots of balancing bitterness. Rich, sticky palate with rich, chewy grain and fruit. A powerful, bitter beer but not overpowering - a fine IPA.

Bouteille 341ml. Couleur orangé, mince mousse blanche. A: fruité, sucré, houblons frais. G: agrumes très mûr et sucré avec une fin de bouche finement houblonné. Bel équilibre. Palais faible texture juteuse, effervescence élevé.

473 ml can from The Beer Store. Pours a clearish golden orange colour with smallish off-white head. Aroma is earthy and citrusy with some biscuity graininess. Solid - a very nice option to have in the beer wasteland that is the SkyDome (Rogers Centre).

Another good IPA. I've had better, I've had much worse. Received more than most.

24.09.2015 Amsterdam, şişe.

Bierkoning ile beertemple arasındaki kafede böyle bir ipa'ya rastlamak hem şaşırtıcı hem de güzel.

Görüntü: bronz saydam renkli, bardakta gazsız ve ince kırık beyaz bir köpüğe sahip.

Koku: kokuda malt, mayşe (tatlı malt tınıları), aromatik şerbetçiotu, çam, reçine.

Tadım: malt, reçine, çam balı, tatlı malt ve şerbetçiotu acılığı. Öndeki acı-tatlı tınılarını Ardından şerbetçiotu acılığı damağı sarıyor, kalıcı ve keyifli bir inişi var. Tezat bir tat olarak yanında yediğim küçük waffle Tarzı atıştırma ile birbirini iyi dengeledi.. 

Çok iyi bir IPA.

12oz bottle in pint glass
A - golden yellow clear with fine bubbly white head
A - peach, papaya, sour hops
T - light sweet fruity hops, medium to heavy bitter, light sour, salty
P - light to medium body, watery creamy, moderate carbonation, smooth start late bitterness that lasts
O - easy to drink IPA, not my favorite but drinkable
Can. Red body, large beige head. The aroma is hoppy and flowery, very full. The taste is full as well, but crisp at the same time. Pretty nice!

Où, Quand, Comment :  Bouteille. Mondial de la bière 2007. 




Visuel :  
Couleur : dorée-ambrée. 
Apparence : claire. 




Arôme :  
Houblon floral et résineux, léger caramel sucré, léger de fruits (agrumes).




Goût :  
Entrée de bouche : moyennement amer de houblon floral et résineux avec des notes herbeuses.
Un support de caramel doux avec des notes poivrées et herbeuses.



En bouche :  

Corps : moyen.
Effervescence : moyenne.
Texture : légèrement résineuse.
Finale : longue, moyennement amère de houblon résineux, légèrement floral.

473ml can pours a golden amber color with a 2 finger off-white head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is earthy with some light citrus and cereal grains. Taste is a citrus and earthy hop bitterness with a caramel malty sweetness. Slight grainy mouth feel. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, this is a middle of the road IPA with a decent balance of flavors. A good entry level IPA for those new to the craft beer scene.

Piana dość bujna, gruboziarnista. Aromat przy otwarciu mocno chmielowy, owocowy, arbuzowo-cytrusowy. Co z tego, skoro rozwiewa się bardzo szybko, pozostawiając po sobie ino warzywka i karmel. W smaku idealnie zachowany balans karmelu i chmielowości. Brakuje nieco goryczki. Średnio na jeża.

Uma excelente ipa. Com ótimo amargor é muito saborosa. Vale tomar novamente. Custa em média 20 reais no pão de açúcar.

On tap at Rogers Centre: Golden yellow with decent white head. Moderate carbonation. Nose is heavily hopped with some pine resin and citrus. Taste is very hoppy with sourdough, biscuits, and citric acid. Beautifully long, bitter finish. Not sure what all the tremendous hype’s about, though.

16 oz. can at Sugarfire O’Fallon MO. I just picked this one up thinking "it’s an IPA, how bad could it be?" It greatly exceeded all expectations, changing my mind about macrobrew IPA’s. Good pine and slight citrus hop character, great finish, definitely worth trying. Easy to find and unpretentious, you could do much worse than this when you need an IPA and a premium bottle shop is not available.
On tap here n west coast, not too bad good hop nose taste is prickly pear and bitter, better stuff here in so cal but it was best on tap where I was. Fished with no off flavors.

33cl bottle at home. pours a clear orange/amber beer with a decent off-white head that stays. earthy aroma, citrus and pine. the taste has hints of grapefruit, caramel, pine and other fruit. nicely balanced though carbonation was average to below average.
Pours a clear bronze, with a white head. Aroma has notes of citrus, pine, and floral hops. Tasting notes include notes of grapefruit, pine, and bready malts. Thus is a very good IPA!!

Out of a bottle pours a golden orange color with a light tan head. The smell is citrus, grapefruit, toasted malt. The taste is toasted malt, caramel, grapefruit ending fruity and dry. The body is light+ with average carbonation. This appears to be a two month old bottle...

Bottle at Santini’s Bar - massive malty nose mirrored on the palate - very well balanced though - nice caramel malt - full bodied - lovely fruity herby spicy hops - very drinkable - could definitely go another and did so.... after that I found the malt too cloying and tongue coating (so opted for a hop dominant brew to cleanse my palate). A solid IPA although unmemorable.

- Light/lager colour.

- Quite a fruity nose. Mainly candied orange; some grapefruit. Pine. Hint of passionfruit/tropical?

- Body is medium and fairly clean (but still a little high-in the mouth, like the Honker’s - possibly due to wheat?); some grapefruit/orange but mostly toffee-ish malt.

- Medium-long ride. Bit more orange-y hops at end.

- Benchmark American-style IPA.
Amber color - clear. Pretty hoppy. Pretty good flavor, decent head. Flavor mostly hops.

Tap at Sally’s on campus in a pint glass. Golden with some hints of orange. Minimal white head. Aroma is bitter and floral keeping the hops at the forefront. Pine and resin produce an oily mouthfeel of a typical IPA. Taste has floral qualities and citrus rind bitterness of the hops. Feels like a standard out of the box IPA and makes me long for the days when Goose Island took more chances. You can find better.

Dourada,translúcida,límpida,espuma cremosa,volumosa e com boa duração;no aroma frutas cítricas,notas terrosas,grama molhada,pinho;sabor com bom amargor acompanha o aroma,refrescante,equilibrada,uma ¨ponte¨entre a escola inglesa e americana,alta drinkability,final seco,ótima cerveja.

Poured from a can. Almost a candied fruit aroma, different from most IPAs I’ve had. Pours a slightly cloudy amber with white head and quickly dissipates. Has a medium bitter taste. Full bodied with a sticky texture. A really nice IPA that is not too harsh.
Fairly "lager" colored beer. Tastes great for a daily beer. Leaves your mouth clean in short time. Not much to smell unless you shake it.

Hazy golden color and a fine white head. Grapefruit hoppy nose (not massive), pine and tropical. Well blended hoppy and malty flavour.Grapefruit, pine, some toffee and fruity. Nice tasty stuff.
[Bottle at Oslo Mekaniske Verksted in Oslo, Norway]
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Snifter. Supplier: Morrisons (Bristol). Floral nose. Pours deep orange with large head. Earthy and hoppy.

2015/09/08 - Pours a clear copper colour with frothy, off white head that quickly reduces. Aroma is rather malt forward; floral hops, bread, citrus, caramel, biscuit and mild pine. Taste is a little more balanced, but still slightly malt forward; cracker, caramel, citrus and light floral notes. Mouthfeel is medium and slightly sticky with slightly biting carbonation and a dry, crisp finish. A little bland, but still rather drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl can. Clear golden pour with thick white head, some lacing. Aromas of fresh forest pine, old bread and toast. Taste is balaced, lots of bitter but the malty body keeps it together. Almost dry. Low carbonation, fresh palate. Aftertaste is short-ish, but pleasurable ride with hops and malts bouncing around in the mouth. Cool general purpose IPA.

Big white head, maintains a blanket, slight lace. Copper/amber colour, brilliant clarity. Aroma of caramel malt and mildly fruity hops. Matching flavours, with biscuit and caramel. More malt forward and less bitter than typical American IPAs.

Cor de mel, límpida. Espuma média de média duração. Aroma de lúpulo, levemente cítrico, com notas de grama verde. Sabor amargo, mais forte no retrogosto que no primeiro contato com a língua, com notas de tangerina, grama verde e resina. Retrogosto amargo e final um pouco mentolado.

Tap at Eddie George at Columbus airport. Pour is light amber and gold. Hop nose and taste follows. Smooth and a bit sweet. Hop up front and mild smooth malt follows then is gone. Pretty good - would do again.

Pours a clean lighter amber colour with a frothy-foamy light-beige head that hangs on a little bit, leaving some full-foamy lace. The nose is nutty, with dark malts and some hops. The taste has more hops with the darker barley in the background. Not bad, but you can see that a macro has bought this and taken cheaper ingredients. Not as bad as the big guys, but not was I expected.

0.355 l can from local Albert Heijn, canned in May 2015. Clear, golden apricot with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Fruity-resiny aroma of mango, tangerine, pine needles and some honey. Sweetish, fruity-resiny taste of mango, tangerine, candied orange, honey and pine needles, followed by a medium long, medium bitter and gently dry finish. Thin to medium body, slightly oily and gently effervescent mouthfeel, soft to average cabonation. Pleasant and refreshing, slightly above-average IPA with emphasis on sweetish-piney rather than grassy-fruity notes. Nice!

Butelka. Barwa ciemno złota, klarowna. Piana biała, szybko opadająca. Intensywny aromat owoców ( mango, brzoskwinia). Smak podobnie, wysokie wysycenie ze średnią do wysokiej niezalegającą goryczką. Orzeźwiające.

Draft. Copper color with thick white head and substantial lacing. Citrus hop aroma. Hops upfront with malty biscuit in the middle. Subtle bitterness along with melt in the long finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Âmbar alaranjada, espuma de boa formação e persistência, com aspecto cremoso. Aroma cítrico, floral lupulado, leve resinal, bastante convidativo principalmente por não ser exagerado. Paladar trás amargor médio, baixo dulçor, corpo leve e média carbonatação. Aftertaste mantém o amargor por um breve período sem ser cansativo, levemente resinal. Achei que poderia ser um pouco mais potente no lúpulo, mas isso se traduz em maior drinkability.
Bottle: Clear golden color poured with a big frothy white head and nice lacing.  Very hoppy aroma and flavor. Bitter taste and finish.
not the best. hops were tired. old hops tasting. too much malt and sweetnes, need to try fresher.

Had on tap at Buffalo Wild Wings. A dirty gold color that’s pretty pale with a white sticky head. Not much nose. Some mild floral hops. Decent flavors and pretty drinkable. Better than I thought it would be. I guess I was expecting a Honkers.
Very floral hop aroma with some melon. Taste is rose water, cracker malts, and mild grapefruit.

Cor de ouro envelhecido, brilhante e cristalina; espuma bege de média/alta formação e alta persistência com muito bom lacing.
Aroma de caramelo, um toque de melão e muito abacaxi em calda, deixando o aroma um pouco enjoativo devido ao dulçor com o aumento da temperatura.
Sabor inicial de caramelo e cítrico de abacaxi, evoluindo para um meio mais doce (calda de abacaxi) que rapidamente finaliza para amargor intenso mas bem inserido com boa picancia, dando um toque de refrescância; ao final inicia-se um dulçor de abacaxi em calda que perdura no retrogosto junto uma adstringência de boa persistência.
Corpo médio e carbonatação média/alta.
Cerveja de boa drinkability de sabor muito equilibrado com uma ressalva para o aroma demasiadamente doce.

Draft. Honey-hued with perfect clarity and a small, soapy gray head. Smooth floral aroma: a little rose and lilac alongside pine, honey and lemon peel. The flavor follows this format, displaying well-integrated floral hop notes with moderate bitterness and a soft caramel malt character that carries into a very balanced finish. Carbonation is a little high, but other than that this is a solid English-style IPA geared toward drinkability rather than in-your-face hop character.

On tap at Spokane airport. Can’t believe the high ratings, kind of weak, even for an East Coast IPA. Looks like a lager, hops offer a bitterness reminiscent of a German pilsener, alright, but inappropriate for the style. Was expecting better.

Kolor herbaciany, klarowny.
Piana koloru ?o?tawego, bardzo kremowa, drobno p?cherzykowa, bardzo d?ugo pozostaje na powierzchni piwa.
W aromacie na pierwszy plan wysuwaj? si? nuty ?ywiczne, pó?niej mandarynki, troch? mango i cytrusów.
Smak wspania?y, pe?ny, ponownie ?ywica - kr?gos?up tego trunku, pó?niej podobnie jak w aromacie wyra?na mandarynka i inne cytrusy.
Goryczka nie przesadzona, sucha, grapefruitowa, zach?ca do kolejnych ?yków.
