Bardzo smaczna ta IPA, "g?sta" w konsysyncji, delikatnie kwaskowa i s?odka, bardzo orze?wiaj?ca.

Nice piney nose with a touch of citrus. Well-balanced hop flavor, bitterness is not overdone for the body and maltiness. Medium mouth feel, no harshness in the finish. At 5.9%, a great, drinkable, medium-alcohol bitter, with the flavor appropriate to the alcoholic strength.

Aroma característico de ipas, presença principal de lúpulo (cítrico/floral, mas não americano). No sabor também é muito mais evidente o lúpulo, dando até a sensação que falta alguma coisa de malte para dar uma equilibrada. Boa, mas não ótima.

(Tap) Es hat eine gelb-orangene Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist fruchtig, mit Mandarine und etwas Pflaume. Der Geschmack ist vorerst bitter, sehr schlank und retronasal leicht fruchtig. Im Ganzen ist es erfrischend bitter
Enjoyed right out of the can. Taste is bold flavors of citrus, hops, pine and dough, with a solid finish. Nice.

Slightly hazy peach color with a thick white foam. Aroma is malty and biscuity with citrusy and piny hops. Flavor is well balanced with a nice rich but not too sweet malty taste with a bitter finish with citrusy and piny hops. Body is wonderful. creamy, with perfect carbonation and refreshing mouthfeel.
07-20-2015 - I love IPA’s and I love this IPA in general. Bought on holiday in the USA!
Pine needle aroma. Big bitter grapefruit and hops taste. Really dry, almost tart, finish.

16 ounce can. Aroma is piney and a little bit citrus. Taste is the same with a fairly low amount of bitterness. I really enjoyed this beer and will buy again. A nice well balanced, not too bitter IPA.
Draft - Nice grapefruit notes and light caramel. Clearish gold with a white head. Nice grapefruit and bitter peel, nice.

De couleur orange avec reflet rouge rubis avec assez bonne carbonisation . On sens tout suite une bière fleural et qui est très persistant avec une légère yo s agrume . Me bouche c’est très bien réussit le houblon est très présent et type est respecter avec succès

Bottle from local iga grocery A: citrusy, light grapefruit, light piny app: hazy copper lasting white head with good. lacing. T/p: med body with medium long bitter finish. Creamy texture.Moderate carbonation. O: a pretty balanced IPA. Could feel sample in comparison to the other hop bomb on the market but it pleased my palate.
Uma IPA refrescante com excelente drinkability. Os lúpulos presentes deixam ela cítrica, floral e com amargor na medida.

Cor alaranjada com espuma de boa formação e persistência. Aroma herbal de lúpulo. No sabor, o amargor herbal do lúpulo é evidente. Médio amargor com final meio seco e média persistência do amargor. Boa IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle. Poured clear amber with a thick off white head. Strong floral hop aroma. Medium-full body,crisp carbonation leads to a dry tart mouthfeel. Big hoppy flavour, spicy and citrusy, some bready malt but it’s quickly subdued by the hop pressence.
Orange yellow with little head, draft in shaker. Balanced hops flavor not heavily bitter but pleasant. Mildly bitter finish. IPA is not my thing but this is a decent session beer.
Have had bottled and on tap. No detailed notes - just had a couple at dinner and realized I hadn’t entered it yet. Decent enough.

Really aromatic. Floral and citrusy hops. Gold with a nice white head from bottle into a tulip glass. Unfortunately the flavor is just bitter. Being a beer not terribly malty, it’s not a great balance and on the thinner side. Way too bitter to be sessionable for me.
Bottle - Lots of floral notes on the palate. Taste is not very hoppy but subtle. Not a very dry beer or bitter.

Boisson légèrement cuivrée, avec une mousse rare, et un nez de houblons fleuris et abondants. Texture mince. La bouche est dans les mêmes tons, le tapis de malt étant bien présent mais ne servant que de toile de fond pour les houblons, qui sont eux puissants mais relativement accessibles. Il en résulte une American IPA tout ce qu’il y a de plus classique, mais au-dessus de la moyenne de par son équilibre et le choix judicieux de ses houblons. Savoureuse.
Golden clear color, white head. Pine resin, light citrus. Bitter, biscuity malt back. Lighter body, fair bit of carbonation. Good.

Bottle from Albert Heijn. The beer is golden/yellow colored and has a stable white head, with average carbonation. The aroma is hoppy and fruity, with tones of tropical fruits, grapefruits and melon. 
The taste is medium sweet and medium bodied, and tones from the aroma are present. The finish goes from the sweetness into a pleasant hoppy bitterness which diminishes over time. Nice and solid IPA.

355ml bottle pours clear light amber with decent white head displaying good retention. A lot of treacley malt on the nose along with some pine and a bit of tropical fruit. Taste kind of follows but the hops overtake the malt. It’s a solid IPA with a nice balance, never too far away from the malt floor. Slightly thin but otherwise not much to fault. Good, not remarkable.
Ok ipa. Very accessible easy to drink. Flavor is nice floral citrussy hops and also a bit malty sweet. quite average.

Aroma: citrus and herbal notes.
Appearance: golden color with white head.
Taste: medium bitterness (heather and herbs), some citrus notes, thin malty backbone, rather dry and watery.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Quite average beer, nothing special.

Love the fact that the label is still fronting Chicago yet the box clearly shows that the was probably made right here in Edmonton on the freeway where my girls always comment on the awful smell. Good thing I bought it at Superstore for six unmatching buttons and a possum that was wedged into the grill of my ’84 Lada. I felt like I was in a back alley in that store - total shit hole in the beer aisle. Of course, like always, just as I’m about to do a serious take on a beer my cat saunters downstairs to spill his fluids. Maybe I should move the box from on top of the computer table. Initial cautious huffs put this brew up as standard fare but that first taste really crinkled my brow. After a while I came to understand this is not the American ipa i had hoped and instead settled into an English version with some extra sharp emptiness. Fairly plain aroma that tips a bit to the mucky side. What does that mean? I’m not telling you. Caramel, pine that meets acidic qwalitees, dryness, unsweetened grapefrootz and I’m out of beer. The only solution to a quandary such as this is to open another. I’m so stuck inbetween knowing this is a sessionable get fucked up on beer and hating it because it’s just boring and it’s not my style of IPA and tasting a shot of subpar piny caramel and smelling my fingers and discovering I’ve got onion bag from working in the yard. I really am not sure where I’m at - I think I am actually enjoying it cuz it’s drinkable but I’m just such a spoiled hop diva now from drinking challenging excellence yet there is no way this 12 pack will last beyond a handful of days. Is this what I accept now now that my fridge stalwart Tree Hophead has been reformulated and consistently disappoints? Maybe I am sad because this is cheaper and may actually be an upgrade? Maybe it’s because after the very first sip I went straight to the case and searched for a BB date after the former stated crinkling. I have a fridge full of decaying roma tomatoes.
On tap at The Old Pro in Palo Alto, CA. Taste is very light / session IPA. Not great but also not completely offensive either.
Goose IPA used to be a go to... But when the traitors sold out to in bev it was only a matter of time quality would go to crap. Hoppy water should be its new name.

Golden amber, foamy off white head. Aroma of resin, pine, hints of caramel. Taste is bitter, floral, and underlying notes of malt and molasses. Finishes bitter and astringent, lingering. Average body. Decent.

From a can it pours light golden orange. Not a particularly pleasant smell. Tastes a little watered down or just not enough of a malt base. Astringent bitterness with a flat hop character. Finish is absent. Not impressed and would not buy again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (341 ml) bought @ Épicerie Lauzière. 



Appearance: Slightly hazy orangey with a medium off-white head and some lacing. 



Aroma: A mix of caramel, floral hops and resin along light fruitiness. No hops explosion here, but nothing off-putting either. 



Taste: A bit sweet for the style but not cloying. Caramel, pine, floral hops, light spiciness and mild bitterness. 



Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Caramel and pine in the finish. Light fruitiness. 



Overall: A decent old-style caramel forward IPA with decent drinkability. Ok, but not worth buying when you can have DDC Moralité for the same price.
golden copper color,wood, oak, citrus. leaves, a delight of aromas, slight bitter after taste. a nice ipa to remember.

Initial rating: 35.5cl bottle at home. Strong citrus and hoppy flavoured aromas coming from an amber coloured, clear lively brew with white, yellow diminishing foam on top. The nose has some creamy, vanilla and pinewood hints too. Really lovely. The taste indeed is fruity, with citrus and oranges features, but it also is very dry and high in malts. The bitterness of course masters the palate. A modest - for its really light bodied and non-complex character -, good tasting IPA from the iconic Goose Island brewery.



25cl draft from tap at De Trollekelder, Ghent (22 VII 2016). A hazy amber ale with egg white foam on top. The nose is full of wheat, hops, green grass. The taste is very, very lovely with many malts and great hops - with a long lasting bitterness in the finish. Classic, perfect.

Can from Epsom Circle Market, Epsom NH. Aroma is resinous and citrusy hops, slight toast. Appearance is lightly hazy yellow with massive 4-finger frothy head with foamy lacing and decent sparkle. Taste is dominant light citrusy sweet with light bitterness. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with moderate texture, soft carbonation and mildly bitter finish. Overall, a highly sessionable IPA and decent all around.
Pours a clear copper color. Aroma and taste are citrus and pines. Medium bitterness.

341ml brown bottle. Hazy orange colour, big off white head. Aromas of grapefruit and a little caramel. Taste has caramel, grains, grapefruit. Medium bitter finish with lingering grapefruit and nice dryness. Fairly light bodied with good carbonation. Sessionable, enjoyable.

355 ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange with a medium, creamy, white head that laces. Sweet, hoppy aroma of grapefruit, pine and malt. Sweet fruity flavour of grapefruit, peach and pine with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body with an oily texture and average carbonation. Very tasty.
On tap. Hazy copper with a frothy white head. Flavors are toasted cereals, caramel, grapefruit and pine resin with earthy and herbal notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.

Belle couleur orange cuivré. Bon goût houblonné avec les agrumes qui apportent de la fraîcheur. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Nice hit of bitterness up front. Tart, citrus, clean finish. A good find at Tommys in Morton Grove, IL, on 7/1/15 (GD Fare Thee Well concert)12oz bottle rerated 10/26/15 Clear yellow, voluminous head with shoulders, excellent nose. 
Rerated yet again on 01/11/19: 
Some banana and blood,  yes,  blood... Has that irony blood taste... But not in a bad way.

Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head with good retention. Smells like some floral and citrus fruit. Taste is bitter and lite sweet malt with a medium to light body. this is just a regular IPA

Bottle bought at a convenience store near Euston Station, London. Pours a pale golden colour with a firm and lasting white head. Aroma of hops, sweetcorn, caramel, fruit with a hint of cabbage. Medium sweetness, starts with a good level of hoppy bitterness which diminishes over time. Body is medium, texture sticky, average carbonation. Finish is sweet, sticky, with decent level of bitterness remaining. Enjoyed his beer.
This is a re-rate.  It pours a copper color with a decent white head and lacing. The aroma is hops and some citrus. The taste is hops, grapefruit, and orange. It?s a solid IPA.

Crisp citrus hops smell but very light, taste is similar, starts crisp and citrusy then the hops kick in and then mellow away...medium hops strength, medium light malt gives it some sweetness... not bad, not too bitter but gets more bitter with time x3 7/2016 second rating 7/2021 third lol
Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy orange colored brew with an dry bitter taste, hints of orange, grapefruit and caramel.
Een helder, goudkleurig bier met witte kraag. Aroma hoppig en bittere smaak zoals je van een IPA verwacht. Verder weinig complex of bijzonder en een beetje waterig. Mwah.

Golden amber color with modest white head. A: nice IPA, with a perfect balance between lemon and exotic fruits. Faint apple juice note. No extreme highs, just a nice blend. T: as expected, relatively bitter with some very distinct wood and floral notes. Bitterness that hits the palate first is apple, and bitter from exotic fruits. Floral notes follow, mostly rose water. After yeast deposit, the beer gets a bit of a doughy character (as opposed to a very crisp beer before the yeast). Bitterness abates relatively quickly, a fruity aftertaste is left.
33 cl bottle @ home. Clear yellow orange beer, minimal white head. Hoppy aroma with citrus, orange, lemon. Bitter taste, mingled with some fruity sweetness, long and dry hoppy aftertaste.

Have had this on tap several times - usually pretty easy to find in MN.

Enjoyable crisp tasting IPA with a nice dry bitter finish.
Wow, what a nice IPA! Not lacking any bitterness, it also has a nice subtle aftertaste! Love it!

Petite nouveauté dans nos épiceries du Québec. Bière de couleur cuivrée, avec une belle mousse généreuse. Nez puissant et sucré d’agrumes et de houblons floraux. En bouche, c’est fruité, goûteux. Notes d’agrumes bien balancées. J’adore. Cheers!
Bottle bought at AH. Nose is citrus fruits, melon, spices, oranges. Taste is heavy bitter and very dry, with some melon fruitiness. Nice.

Bottled from UK Supermarket. Aroma is super interesting, smells like dried fruit but can’t quite nail what it is. Taste is almost perfectly bitter however it is r ather brief on the palate. Overall a damn tasty beer.

Pours an average frothy white head that slowly diminishes. Body is clear yellow orange, sparkles are visible.
Aroma contains light malts (cookie, dark bread, straw), fairly strong hops (flowers, resin, grapefruit, lemon, orange zest,), moderate yeasts (soap, earth) and apple, forest fruits, cherry, pineapple and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light sweet, followed by light bitter and light acidic and finishing in bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
A nice IPA loaded with hoppy fruits and backed up by enough malts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Serving: from tap at Shakey’s Pizza Parlor.

Aroma: light pine hop.

Appearance: small, creamy, off-white initial head with fair lacing and mostly-diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-yellow body.

Taste: lightly bitter and citrusy initial flavor and finish with short duration.

Palate: light-to-medium body, watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: refreshing.
Aroma is of nice hops and hints of detergent. Has good foam on top of a light copper body. Flavour is okay hops with some citrus. Weak on the mouth. It’s slightly below average for an IPA.

On tap at Pours out a light golden topped with a long lasting head. Nose is pretty much all malts with a touch of hops a little citrus and pine. Taste is dominated by the malty grain and the touch of hops. Forsure a very unhoppy ipa.

Bottle BBE: 21Oct15. Well-chilled. Clear amber body with a small number of floaters; medium-sized, creamy, patchy white head. Fresh aromas of cooking apple, lemon, lime and orange. High, but not over-powering bitterness to taste, with a little sweetness. Light-bodied, but not thin, the texture is quite slick. Fairly high carbonation and a bitter finish. Overall a solid American/English IPA crossover.

Aroma - Toasted cereal and banana with a smoky backdrop. 
Appearance - Pours a clear pale gold with a light white foam. 
Taste - Hoppy bitterness. 
Palate - light and thin yet creamy with a bitter finish.
Overall - Nice. A little thin.

Leuchtend orange zeigt sich das IPA im Glas und verströmt typisch fruchtige Aromen. Etwas Malz und eine schöne fruchtige Bitternote bilden ein rundes Geschmackserlebnis. 
Gut!

Bottle, 355ml. Pours clear golden. Hopnose, not overwhelming but certainly inviting. Slight chaff aroma, not very citrussy, more earthy and herbal green hop aroma. Very crisp, very clean, mellow palate, bitter finish. Nice

330 mL bottle. Clear gold-amber pour with a great sticky off-white head, lots of lace. Nose is a bit weak but what is there is mostly grainy malt with lighter hops. Taste is nice and fresh, hops, citrus and pine. Overall a good IPA.
Not a whole lot on the nose, this Canadian made Goose has equal parts pine and citrus on the tongue. Very smooth but no pizzazz. Very drinkable.

Pours a mostly clear gold with a two finger larger bubbled cream colored head that leaves some spots of lace. Nose involves sweet fruit, damp pine, herbs, and honey. Fairly sweet, decently bitter. Medium bodied, fairly active, somewhat oily, some brightness, with a long resinous drying bitter finish. Decent, old school IPA. On the tame side, and the sweet side, but has some redeeming characteristics despite being owned by SATAN!

0,33l fles thuis van jerommeke. Goudgeel met een witte kraag. Geur Citrus, smaak heerlijk fruitig met een bitter dat in afdronk mooi opbouwd en blijft staan, doet denken aan grapefruit en het bittere deel van ananas.
Well balanced IPA let down slightly on aroma spruce taste with medium finish OK but very had a lot nicer Ipas.
Tried at Edmonton Craft Beerfest 2015. Excellent IPA. Very crisp and light level of carbonation. Bright and refreshing citrus hop notes are balanced with a mild grassy bitterness.
Una ipa di buon livello, colore dorato, aroma di erbe leggero, media amarezza, carbonazione giusta.
Fairly typical, but also solid IPA. Tasty, good for summertime drinking, and pretty available these days. Rock on goose!

Nice light Golden beer with a white head, which fall a bit to quickly. Nice bitter aroma of citrus and fruit. The beer have a note of dried fruit and a medium body. I would have liked a bit more character on the hops. But overall a good beer.

The aroma is citrus with hints of spruce.The color is pale golden and clear with a light head. The taste is medium bitter. This beer is medium bodied with a slick texture. The carbonation is average. The finish is somewhat long. Overall this is a very tame yet uniquely balanced ipa. Good Job goose Island!
Thin fizzy piss with zero flavor. Score 94 overall? What a fucking joke. I mixed my cup up with wife’s blue moon. Couldn’t figure out which was which. Enough said. Pathetic.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 12/23/2014. Pours slightly hazy deep golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, pear, apple, pine, biscuit, light honey, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of citrus/earthy hops, bready malt, and fruity yeast notes; with solid strength. Taste of grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, pear, apple, pine, biscuit, light honey, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of earthy herbal/pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, lemon/orange zest, pear, apple, pine, biscuit, light honey, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Very nice robustness and complexity of big citrus/earthy hops, with moderate bready malt and fruity yeast flavors; with a nice crisp malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, sticky, and slightly creamy mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a very nice English IPA. All around nice robustness, complexity, and balance of big citrus/earthy hops, with moderate bready malt and fruity yeast flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

35,5cl bottle. Clear orangish golden colour with a thin white head. Tropical fruit, citrus and pine on the aroma. Average carbonation and medium to light body. Taste is light bitter with some sweet fruity notes and a dry finish. Overall, pretty ok IPA.

341 ml bottle. Unclear orange copper, thinner off-white foam mostly lasts. Citrus forest fruity aroma and taste, lean c-malt, harmonius and clean. Average carbonation, light-medium bodied, well hopped. Classic lighter NAIPA. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)

Bière orangée tirant un peu vers le jaune, moyennement voilée, effervescence très faible, et surmontée d’un bon col beige bien dense et mousseux, et qui se réduit tranquillement en laissant une riche dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes plutôt maltés de pain légèrement grillé, grain un peu rôti, sucres (mélange de miel et caramel…), subtil pâtisserie et/ou levure à pain, houblon restant subtilement en arrière-plan et semblant plutôt floral, peut-être légèrement herbacé voire résineux. Rien de bien intéressant dans ce nez à la complexité et à l’intensité plutôt faibles. En bouche, pétillement à peu près inexistant sur la langue, onctuosité moyenne au palais. Au goût, pain plus ou moins frais, pâtisserie, levure à pain, sucres (contrairement au nez, ça fait plus sucre d’orge, avec touche de caramel…), houblon très peu goûteux qui semble principalement floral, finale à l’amertume de faible à modérée. Goût ordinaire, intensité moyenne en bouche, complexité médiocre. L’étiquette mentionne : «Arôme frais d’agrumes – Goût très houblonné». C’est clairement n’importe quoi!! Je remarque à l’instant un code imprimé très bas sur la bouteille qui est difficile à voir et qui semble indiquer que la bière a été embouteillée en août 2014, ça aurait donc pris presque 10 mois à cette IPA pour se rendre sur une tablette d’un dépanneur québécois… Dégustation décevante…

Mis à part la belle robe ambrée bien claire aux reflets dorés, rien de trop intéressant dans cette bière. Les arômes caramélisés et terreux me font penser à du matl pré-fait pour un mix de bière maison. Des houblons aux effluves d’orange tentent de faire leur place mais je les sens pris dans quelque chose qui me fait penser à des oignons confits. Au goût, un peu mieux mais encore là, ce côté malté et terreux prend beaucoup de place. Les houblons sauvent la mise. La finale est amère, caramélisée et un petit goût d’orange se démarque. J’ai sérieusement l’impression de boire une ipa oubliée trop longtemps sur des tablettes. Le problème est que ce produit est nouveau au Québec et j’espère que GI n’est pas en train de nous refiler du vieux stock. À réessayer.

Dark amber verging on copper. One finger of bright white head. Minimal lacing. Fairly filtered. On the nose it is a blending of citrus and pine. More of that on the palate, with some light malt in the mix. All fairly bitter. A little bit of grassiness in there too. I’d buy and drink this again.
Clear golden with a good amount of foam. Tropical fruit, citrus, and piney aroma. Body was pretty light for the bitterness but enjoyable.
Une bonne IPA bien amère. Pas grand chose de plus à dire. C’est sympathique.

35.5 cL bottle at home. Pours clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma is pretty nice with hops, fruitiness, tropical fruits, some citrus. Taste is slightly sweet and fruity with a decent malt body and a medium bitter finish. Pretty crisp. Medium body and carbo. Nice IPA and available in my local supermarket.
Lekkere hoppige IPA met een fruitige twist. Smaakt goed maar valt meer in categorie standaard IPA, niets speciaals.

Tasted from draft. Pours a clear gold with fluffy white head. Aroma is citrus fruit with some pine and a little bready malt sweet smell. Taste is very well balanced. Moderate clean bitterness throughout with a nice mild sweet malt backbone. Citrus, caramel, pine, biscuits, grass flavors. Very solid IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pint. Muted aroma. Sort of funky hops. Medium body sort of hoppy but has a fast flavour profile and is rather forgetful as an IPA.

dense light beige head leaves structured lacing. light amber colour. aroma is bit grainy, passion fruit, mango, caramel. taste like aroma with a bitter sligh resinous finish. medium body and cabonation. much better than expected. bottle 33cl / bbf jan-2016

Golden with a generous head. Smells very wheaty and sour with gooseberry. Taste is acrid pine and earwax bitter. It’s all wheat and little else. I love bitter bitter beers but for some reason I find this really challenging (read as unpleasant) and have had before so not a dud. For me the bottle should say wheat beer, nothing like the English IPA promised.

Pours a clear light orange with a nice white head. Head retention is ok. Aroma: Not much on the aroma but some slight citrus, light hop bitterness, faint peppercorns and light malt. Taste: Very light on taste as well. Hop bitterness is more pronounced, citrus is mellow, very light peppercorns, faint tropical fruit and malt. Finishing with a crisp, slightly dry, feel in the mouth. Overall I was somewhat disappointed. I was expecting a very aromatic, fruity, bitter and spice filled beer. However, I am comparing this to the West Coast IPA?s and I think that is a bit unfair. Reading the label I see that the alcohol and IBU?s are not as high as the West Coast style. I believe they only used one style of hops and that is what might causes the lack of aroma and flavor. Considering all this, I do believe this is a good IPA. Sure it won?t destroy your palate but it is a great everyday go-to brew. Cheers! Kanpai! Salud! Prost!

Ce n’est pas un produit très palpitant à déguster mais somme toute respectable. Au nez, je sens plus les céréales que les houblons, ce qui n’est pas typique pour le style. Ce qui lui nuit le plus est son apparence...

6er from the lcbo. Clear copper pour, with a small white head. Very bready aroma, light toasted nuts with alot of pine resins. Full mouthfeel, subtle carb. The finish is fruity, and slightly citrusy, wirh some more beady malts. Not bad, not great.

Aroma is a little mild fruity and citrus, taste is similar, nice and drinkable ipa

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yellow pour with white head. Grassy hop aroma, pine bitter up front, pleasant malt palate with grassy finish. This beer does not taste offensive but I still feel offended by it.

Clear golden pour with a frothy white head. Aroma was mild citrus fruits, bready malt, grass, touch of pine. Flavors were sharp with good citrus and grassy hops, biting bitter finish. Tingly carbonation. Overall a pleasure to drink. Well executed, balanced, classic.

Uitgeschonken in Sint Crispijn bierglas, helder goudblond oranjeachtig bier met mooie witte schuimkraag die aan het glas blijft kleven. Typische fruitige aangename aroma's van een IPA bier, grapefruit, groene kruiden en pijnboom, deze Goose Island IPA heeft wat meer mout aroma dan gemiddeld. De smaak is fruitig, kruidig, licht zoete karamel, volmondig en zacht hopbitter. Tonen van grapefruit, ananas, graanmout, dennenhout en zacht bittere hop. De afdronk is medium droog en bitter in het mondgevoel. Lekkere en mooi gebalanceerde IPA.
Toevallig in de supermarkt tegengekomen en meegenomen naar huis. Een heerlijk rijk bier.

Bright orange colored beer with a white head, high carbonation.
Tastes bitter (hop), sweet fruity, citrus flavors, herbs and grapefruit.
Nice bitter aftertaste

Flesje gekocht in een Supermarkt. Gouden kleur, mooie plakkraag. Ruikt citrushoppig, grapefruit en moutig. Smaak is een mooie balans tussen bitter en zoet met het accent op bitter. De mout komt ook goed eruit. Flink wat body. Lekker bier.
Bottle. Nice, classic American IPA, not too hoppy and bitter. Good session beer, fairly refreshing.
Classic IPA. Nice bitterness and citrus flavours. Some herbal notes. A good beer, but nothing extraordinary.

I wanna hate this stuff, but it’s a godsend at the ballpark, compared to Keith’s and Bud Light and Stella. Piney citrusy hops and a solid caramel malt. Nothing to write home about but this is a solid, simple, classic IPA. Damn you AB InBev.
Copper pour with a nice frothy white head and clinging lace. Malty IPA. Classic brew. Fruit hop with a malt backbone. Bitter finish.
A dry fruity and malty India Pale Ale. Good hops but nothing out of the ordinary.

There are times when a fella wants nothing but an easy drinking IPA. Now is one of those times and this is one of those IPAs. A very lightly hazy copper and gold body, some decent lacing and snappy, enticing toots of pink grapefruit, clementine, mango, pineapple and lemon draw in the eye and the mouth for a carefully calculated inspection. Sweet honey and light cereal hints play a background balancing act to the hoppin’ good time going on up front. A nice medium lively carbonation and some malt chew round out this enjoyable beer. I’d goose-neck a few a of these into me anytime my slurp-service is required.

Tap - good size foamy head, light gold/copper color, moderate citrus/grapefruit hop aroma and flavor, fair malt backbone, pretty well balanced overall, nice mildly dry hoppy finish, very good overall

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Earlier Rating: 4/11/2012 Total Score: 3.9
Tap - small foamy head, dark orange/amber color, nice big citrus hop aroma and flavor, good IPA

From bottle at Duke’s 92 in Manchester 05.05.15. Clear golden. Foamy and dense off-white head. Balanced aroma of.marmelade, citrus and tropical fruits. Fine and balanced taste, with grapefruit bitterness. Very quaffable.

0,33 cl bottle. Pours an apple juice coloured beer. Taste is ipa bitter, with a sour taste. Since I don’t really like ipa’s ( but I’ll will die trying ) this isn’t my cup of tea. Not the worst one I have tasted.

Bottled 03/26/15.
Bright orange, light amber hue. Brightly clear. 
Enough pale malt for character, but lets the hops do all the work. Orange citrusy, bit of pear (white fruit) lean more on the English side compared to a big dank, grapefruit type American IPA. Noble hop character lingers with a woodsy taste compared to medicinal or leafy. Standard EIPA, not over the top, easy drinking, enough character to not be taken lightly.

Bottle. Pours a clear orange beer with a big white, lacy head on top. Aroma is grassy, citrussy, grapefruit and a touch of malts in there. Flavor is mildly bitter, a big sweet malted base and a bit dusty. Checked the bottle and it’s over 4 months old, so I’d reckon it must the age on this bottle that makes it a shadow of it’s former self. Need to revisit sometimes.

The beer has a beautiful amber color and a head as white as snow. It has the typical IPA features. The beer has a nice clarity. The foam is soft and has good retention. Not bad.
The beer has a delicious citrusy hop smell. The fresh lemon zest is accompanied by a herbal hint and some piney touches. There is also some nice sweet malt in there, pairing well with the hops. 
The taste is just as refreshing as the smell. It also has the distinct IPA taste, those citrusy hop flavors in combination with a tingling bitterness. Here is also the same nice malty touch. Not bad.
The fizzly beer tingles the tongue nicely. With the medium body and nice soft texture this makes a good palate. The finish is delicious. It contains the IPA bitterness and at the beginning of the finish there are some sour citric hops. Nice.
Twisted up and amazing. This IPA has all you want. Light color, great IPA aroma and the hoppy taste you want.

Bottled :R8 ; A pretty solid mid-card IPA , very easy to swill 4 bottles without blinking /. Nose has resemblance with a classy air-freshener . Pine ,wood, aromatics, grass. Some rich caramel. A firm malty palate is married well with notes of orange , grapefruit , spice, caramel. Pretty dry and raspy finish . Gud stiff !

Clear Amber pour, thin white head that fades to a lace. Aroma is light citrus, grain, slight earthiness. Taste is light citrus, caramel, toast. Mild bitterness. Light body, medium carbonation. Doesn’t really stand out.
Earlier Rating: 2/10/2014 Total Score: 3
On tap at Buffalo Wild Wings, Terminal D, Atlanylta Airport. Pours darker amber with good sized off white head. Aroma is citrusy with solid malt presence. Taste is hoppy with citrus fruit and grass. Spicy malts present as well. Little bitterness. Palate is softly carbonated. Not bad, but I think the tap system here is contaminated. Some slinky notes in the after taste.

Belle amertume herbacée avec des notes florales persistance et un arrière-goût durable. Quelques moments d’absence la rende un peu mince, mais elle demeure fière, du fond de sa pinte qui se laisse descendre d’un trait.
Keg at the cameo. Pours clear amber, nose is floral, toffee, taste is dry, floral, quite harsh and fizzy.

This beer is totally crushable, which is exactly what a session IPA should be. Nice inviting nose of grapefruit rind and light pine. Not overly bitter, does have some hop spice bite to it. Well done. Golden pour with lasting head and lacing.
Earlier Rating: 8/16/2012 Total Score: 3.2
Is it just me or is Goose Island all hype and small delivery.  This is an okay IPA, but nothing special.  Ok hops in the aroma and taste, but I want more, especially with the high rating here.

Thanks to Alexanderdahl for this! Pours dark golden with a medium light offwhite head. Aromas of citrus, orange peel, some tropical fruits, grain, grassy and piney notes, light malt, good amount of hops. Taste is citrussy, grainy, hops, orange peel, light ripe orange, some tropical notes, heavy malty.
Thank you local supermarket for this, beats the standard lagers you find here. English, almost a tea flavor. Sticky sweet
Lemon/grapefruit, citrus peel hop aroma. Similar citrus hop flavor, with subtle floral finish. Light grainy, sweet malt flavor. A little thin, but nice aroma and flavor.

Bottle 35.5cl. Clear medium amber, large frothy off-white head, recedes after a while, good lacing; strong citrus aroma, grapefruit, orange peel, peach, pine floral; taste medium bitter, citrusy, some malty sweetness; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste dry hoppy bitter, herbal notes; overall a good and well-balanced IPA.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle, bottled on February 25, 2015, says 5.9% abv, but bottle shown in picture, poured into a shaker. Clear deep golden with small white head. Aroma is dank, medium body, low/medium carbonation, and some small-bubble lacing. Taste is grapefruit, some dank hops, some pine hops, and bitter finish.

En fût au Bier Markt Montréal. Couleur orange très pâle translucide, mousse blanc cassé onctueuse laissant une dentelle éparse. Arôme de houblon résineux, malt, végétal. Goût de houblon résineux, agrumes, malt, amertume moyenne, sucré, un peu de verdure en fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps moyen-faible.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with big white head. Aroma has some grainy dough notes, earthy hops and subtle fruitiness. Some peach. Taste is sweet malts, slight caramel, subtle bread and nice fruitiness. Light elderflower. Medium oily body, Medium bitter finish with some earthy spicy hops.
Aroma suggests a stronger IPA - marmalade in there with citrus and pine. Good malt presence and bitter finish. Medium body.

Pours a hazy orange with a large frothy off-white head. Aroma of citrus and pine hops along with some malt. Tastes hoppy along with some sweetness to balance it out. Nice bitter finish. Medium bodied.

Tall boy poured into the ipa glass. Clear burnt golden color with a white head for days. Aromas of mild pine, sweet citrus, toast and caramel. Taste is easy going with a bready sweetness, fruits and slight resin that is well balanced. Can’t really go wrong for the price either. Cheers!

On tap at Royal Oak Pub. Pours a good size frothy head that goes away not long after. Has a pale golden appearance. Thick patchy lacing. Aromas of citrus and floral hops. Flavours are mostly citrus hops and bready and caramel malts. Average carbonation. Light bodied mouthfeel. Pretty good, just missing a bit of punch for an IPA.
Aroma: Grapefruit, orange, grass Appearance: Clear, yellow, quite fizzy, orange glow, fine foam, disappearing white head Taste: Grapefruit, orange, grass, easy drinkable...

12oz bottle from Crossroads. Pours a nice crystal clear golden color with a finger of foamy off white head. Aroma of grapefruit, honey, caramel malt, and old tangerines. Taste of citrus zest, mild piney bitterness, grass, and some biscuit and caramel malts. 
Earlier Rating: 8/12/2013 Total Score: 3.4
12oz bottle. Pours a golden light amber color with a finger of foamy off white head. Aroma of grapefruit, caramel, and floral hops. Taste of tangy citrus, grapefruit, lemon zest, caramel, and pine.

on tap. unclear very pale golden with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. doughy maltiness, honeyed malts, salted and chalky caramel, fruitiness - white grapes, faint citrus and pine, candies. average to light carbonation, light body - oily and feels darn heavy for stated abv; semi-sweet spicy-citrusy finish. muted and not very sessionnable. an average ipa it is.
Earlier Rating: 4/28/2014 Total Score: 3.4
pours clear bright and light golden with a nice white cap, some retention and lacing. spicy toasted maltiness - quite doughy for stated abv, good dose of caramel, faint citrus and pine, white grape juice and other fruity esters. moderate carbonation, light body - relatively dry and balanced grassy-citrusy-piney-piney finish. tad muted but then again maybe a bit oldish. spicy. citrusy. straightforward. effective. example of the style for sure.

A regular ol' IPA. Nothing special but decent and reliable. Nice golden color. One gave me a good buzz.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromat super owoce, słodki. Klarowne, dobra piana, złote. Dość słodkie. Brak goryczy. Słodycz owocowa. Bardziej pale ale niż IPA. Mocno wysycone.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear amber with a white head. Aroma of fruity citrus hops, floral, hints of pine, resin. Taste is hoppy bitter, citrus, peachy, malts, bitter ending with more piney, resiny,hops in the aftertaste. Not bad.

Purchased at local grocery store for $.75 each. (Same as unpackaged Buds, Bud Lights and Coors Light.) Not much to look at, not much aroma, not much flavor. Other than that, this is a perfectly forgettable beer.

Tout d’abord, des houblons terreux et feuillus se présentent au nez, malgré la présence de cultivars américains notés par la légère sensation de résine. Feuilles mortes et branches avec un soupçon de pin. Légère présence de viande également. 
Le visuel est doré tirant sur le ambré et très clair (filtré). Une bonne mousse blanche qui tient longtemps.
Au gustatif, les houblons Anglais sont pleinement en action. Une sensation de terre, de gazon frais coupé, de branches et de feuilles d’automne. Un puissant houblonnage, mais tout à fait Anglais. On a pas souvent l’occasion de déguster une vrai IPA Anglaise avec toute cette invasion West Coast Américaine. Et ça prends bien une brasserie Américaine pour le faire.
Sweet piney grass aroma. Nice clear dark yellow with a small white head. Soft but round flavour. Light hints of citrus and fresh grass. Bitter dry aftertaste.
Pours a straw yellow with s thick white head. Aroma is of grapefruit and pine. Taste is nice, clean, and full of grspefruit. This a fine IPA.
It’s fine, perfectly drinkable but nothing special. An acceptable, inoffensive IPA, but not particularly interesting.

16oz can shared. Aroma is mild malts and hops. Light bodied in all respects major confusion though on finding the name on here versus untappd which calls it a English ups which this is not.
Earlier Rating: 2/15/2013 Total Score: 3.7
12oz bottle pours yellowish color a bit cloudy with white head...plenty of lacing on the glass. nice aroma of mild citrus and some piney grassiness. the flavor is very good and smooth. just your normal bitterness for an ipa but delicate in its own right. very drinkable. it has a medium body thos this. rather like this one alot.

Tap at Les Maltcommodes. Pours a clear golden with a small white head that leaves superior lacing. Nose is of caramel, light bubblegum, resin and fruts. Taste is moderately bitter, not too sweet. Flavors of pine and fruits. Bitterness lingers a little. Med body and high carb, impressive for such a light brew. Overall a good session IPA, glad to see it around the neighborhood!
This is a very nice English IPA. A well balanced and well crafted beer. There are plenty of hops, but it’s not an "in your face" bomb. A very drinkable beer.
Amber color with foamy white head. Smell of citrus/grapefruit and mango.very Bitter taste, as a IPA aught to be. Not my style.
Exactly what am ipa should be. Can’t go wrong here. Tap and bottle. Citrus, hops, amber, nice.
2015 - 04 - 07 355ml bottle. yellow golden colour. medium white head. citrus in aorma bitter tatse
12oz bottle pours a clear orange with a white head. wish I couldve had this fresher. citrus malt taste for the most part
Bottle. Golden color, white head. Fruity aroma of pine and peach. Tastes is quite subtle, with some pine, peach and citrus. Bitter finish, very english indeed. Not bad, just very average.

Bottle.

Pours clear, light amber with a fingers head of light foam.

Nose is orange and sweet. Piney and grassy freshness.

Really nice medium bodied, lots of Weight on the malt, giving the hops a nice balance. Dry on the ending... Really nice, earthy english ipa!

Pours clear golden with a thick and finite-bubbled eggshell head. Aroma is hoppy, not much else but still says "IPA" loud and clear. Flavor is definitely hoppy, a little bitter, a little sweet, a little fruity - mainly citrus - and a little malty.mouthfeel has average fizz and body. Typical, but worthy.
Earlier Rating: 1/28/2013 Total Score: 3.2
Comes out of the growler a nice clear amber with a very thick and somewhat persistent pale amber-wheat head. Strongly hoppy aroma has an undertone of fresh hay. Flavor has a malty core and hoppy and hay components, just a hint of citrus. Smooth texture has average body and lacks fizz. OK, not the best IPA I have ever had, but give it a try.

A very pleasant ipa! Pours a pretty orange w/ a white head that leaves good lacing. The aroma has a good hop kick. The taste is smooth in body w/ a nice hop presence in the finish. Drinkable & tasty. A quite nice ipa!

Very resinous ipa strong on the piny hops fatty. It’s very American creamy like. Not bad bit not good either

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Draught at Ethereal. Ordered this....ok. For the rating. I suck. But whatever. Carmel malt. Some citrus. Low hop build. Drinkable.

So this isn’t Goose Island IPA? Huh. Anyway - 12oz bottle from Kroger in Grandview. Clear gold pour. Aroma of sweet malt and pine. Tastes are floral, grassy, soapy, citrus.
Earlier Rating: 3/23/2013 Total Score: 3.3
Hmm, can’t believe I hadn’t rated this.  I’m sure I must have tried it a few times.  Gold pour with a big fluffy off-white head and lots of retention.  Aroma is soft caramel malt and tropical fruit.  Tastes are lemon, pine, caramel, floral, yeast, grapefuit, soapy.
Old rating. Pretty average ipa. Full bodied, crisp citrus hops, drinkable. Yup.
On tap at the King’s Head Pub, Winnipeg. Nice balance of sweet tropical fruit and crisp citrus zest. Fairly full bodied, and nicely balanced. A very solid IPA.

355 ml. bottle @ home. Bottled on 03/01/2015 – BBF 03/01/2016. I still cannot believe that I actually bought this in a supermarket (albeit an NL owned one) in Belgium. Hopefully this is one step closer to my dream of buying BCBS in the supermarket. Clear sparkling amber, creamy white head. Nose is oily USA style pine resin hops with a thicker than usual caramel malts, malts overpower the hops a bit. Taste is oily bitter pine resin hops, plenty of caramel malts, oily mixed with still with very American pine resin hops, light floral, flowers, oily tea, lots of oily tea pine resin tea & chamomile grapefruit peel, bitter very oily bark finish,… Oily med. carbonation body. Overall -> I have heard a lot of people say bad things about this beer & I have really no idea as to why? This beer is exactly what it promises on the label and English-Style IPA with USA hops. Nothing spectacular but as an everyday easy drinking beer this is really nice stuff. I really enjoyed, I really do not understand the people hating on this.
Enige nieuwe bier bij de ah dat echt de moeite waard is. Ziet er prachtig uit. Vooral de kraag blijft erg lang op zijn plek. Heerlijk hoparoma en -smaak. Goede bitterheid, body en carbo. Erg lekker!
don’t know why i never got around to rating this..anyway..golden pour with a fluffy white head..aroma of citrus,pine,resin..not overly hoppy..just an easy drinking IPA.
Medium white head, chestnut to golden colour, hoppy honey sweet herbs smell, medoum to high carbonation medium bitter cara sweet taste some hops herbs fruits strawbery like taste
Bottle from Sainsbury’s . Really enjoyable IPA, gave a decent hoppy hit. Not a lot of carbonation which seems to contradict some other reviews, will definitely need to investigate this one further. .
on tap at King Street Grille in Myrtle Beach SC - Very good IPA. Nice balance of malt and hops. Nice hoppy aroma.

Copper colour, crystal clear with some bubbles now and then, and a nice foamy white head.
Smell is cereals, peaches and cheese. Figs. Caramel. Subtle touch of orange. Maybe honey.
Taste is bitter sour with a hint of sweetness. Full but passes away relatively fast. Metallic. Apples. Watery. Finish is astringent with hints of grapefruit peels.
at my home gold blond colored body with a white head and a fruity hops aroma a fruity hops dry bitter taste with a bitter finish

bottle, golden clear color, with white foam, dry metallic british pine flavors, plain papery finish

bottle, good amber pour , nose is grapefruit and malt, flavor of citrus fruit and slight malt , a little too bitter on the finish

Quite a pleasant moderately hopped IPA, though nothing special. Light bodied, slightly citrus palate.

Heldere gouden kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, orange. Smaakt bitter, orange, bitter.
Not too keen on the gassyness of this beer. After taste is dry and the flavour quickly disapates...not too impressed

Drank at home with Kaspar 25-3-2015. For 5,9% the beer has a fine taste. Not very special. A bit too bitter. Not as rich as some other IPAs (for example Mkkeller I Beat U or Brew Dog Hardocore IPA): slightly boring bitterness.

Clear golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, grapes, apricot, light citrus. Quite bitter flavour, hops, malts. Finish grapes, apricot, mild bitter hops.
(from 355mL bottle @ home)
Orange coloured brew with a good sized head. Decent fruity and grassy. Just misses a small boost.

Aroma is pine, maybe some resin, also some citrus....Appearance, it pours with a slow forming head that hangs around for a bit. It has a nice copper color to it...Taste is quite nice. It’s sweet and somewhat hoppy bitterness but it’s well balanced between the two....Mouthfeel, well, it’s dry. It finishes off bitter that goes away after a few seconds.....Overall, this is a really good IPA. Absolutely sesssionable, I could totally drink several of these at one sitting. Good choice!!

Helder oranje-geel bier. Geuren van hop, mout, bloemen. Smaken van hop, licht bitter, grassige nasmaak. Lekkere frisse IPA, niet heel uitgesproken van smaak, goede introductie hoe een IPA smaakt als je dit soort bier niet kent.

Aroma of malt, some caramel, tropical fruits, pine, mild hops. Flavour is light to moderate sweet with a moderate to medium bitter finish. A nice mild IPA. --- Rerate. I don't know if this beer has detriorated over the years, but my taste has probably evolved and I've become more critical. This IPA doesn't satisfy me like it used to, it seems pretty unfresh with mostly floral hops and lacking fresh fruity hops.

355ml bottle@home.
Appearance: clear, yellow orange with nice off-white head.
Aroma: flowery hops, vague malt.
Taste: starting sweet to medium bitter at the end.
Palate: smooth, medium bitter body, medium carbonation.
Overall: nice.

355ml bottle at home from local Albert Heijn supermarket. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Quite bitter with some sweet tones. Citrus, grapefruit, pine, malts, caramel and biscuit. A tasty IPA.
Very well made IPA with a good resinous aroma, nice bitterness, yet still some malts in there. Not the best ever, but for a beer this easy to find, a great beer.
Bottle @home. Clear orange color with a white head. Smells and tastes hoppy, grapefruit, orange, iron, caramel, malty.

bottle 355 ml- Hallo Jumbo
Appearance: A clear deep orage golden colour on the body, quite some activity in the glass. Head is white and thick for and IPA. It has a good retention and it leaves a bit of lacing. 
Aroma:caramel malts, biscut, cookie dough and some orange.
Taste: Very English, Some caramel and toffee giving it a moderate sweetness, Some moderate orange bitterness. Moderate bitter finish with ok duration.
Medium body with good carbonation, dry texture.

(Goose Island India Pale Ale) Bottle 355 ml from the local Jumbo. Your move Albert Heijn. Served into a tulip, ABV 5.9%
Deep orage golden colour on the body, crystal clear, with lots of activity in the glass. Good sizzed white and thick head, very good retention, it leaves medium lacing on the glass.
Aroma of caramel mats, biscut, cookie dough, some orange.
Nice taste, not extremely hoppy but the hops are there, english ones. Some caramel and light toffee but also cookie dough and biscuit, the orange notes again, light citrus. Moderate bitterness with decent duration.
Medium body with good carbonation, nice dryness on the palate.
Very good, english style IPA, tastes quite fresh too.

Bottle @ home bought @ Jumbo, Oirschot. Progress. Clear gold colour with a medium sized white head. Smells hops, fresh, fruity, sweetish, nice. Tastes fresh, fruity, hops, quite bitter, crisp, slightly dry. Medium body, nice crisp carbo.

Bottle at home. Golden, transparent ale with an slightly off-white creamy head. Citrus and light resinous hop profile, quite crisp on top of a light malty but sweet base. Rounded but plane imo. Medium carbonation, medium body.

355ml. Bottle. 

Pours clear yellow with white head. 

Aroma citrus, fruity, tropical, caramel, grapefruit. 

Taste caramel fruity sweets, dry citrus bitters. 

Mouthfeel oily. 

Great IPA.
Donker geel bier met schuim. Smaak is licht bitter, fruitig, abrikoos, thee, en denneachtig. Smaak blijft lang hangen, goede IPA maar er zijn betere. Fles eveneens gekocht bij Jumbo, Etten-Leur.

Bottle pour into Goblet. Half-inch head doesn’t hang around long. Leaves a little lacing behind. Aroma is hops, some resin and citrus to it. Taste is pleasant, sweet and light. Not much bitterness according to my palate, YMMV. I’m getting more and more into ridiculous hoppyness since I have actually started rating and paying close attention to these characteristics. Anyway, back to the beer -- it’s a nice IPA that rolls smooth across the tongue, kind of on the thin side. Carbonation is slight, soft but not flat. Finish leaves a bit wanting. I think I actually prefer this one straight from the bottle.

Ook maar even de supermarkthype volgen en wat leeg flesgoed ingeruild voor wat vol spul. Schenkt donker gouden met beperkt witte kraag. Aroma van den, citrus, zoet, stro, grapefruit en wat vol/stevig. Smaken zijn redelijk zoet stevig bitter, ijzer, den, redelijk moutig maar aan de andere kant vind ik het wat vlak en eentonig. Medium body, glad van textuur, lage co2, afdronk bitter en droog. Niet de beste ipa.

Ruikt lekker, sinaasappel. Mooie kleur, iets donkerder dan pils. Lekker fris bier.

Klopt nog altijd! 28-4-2015, van AH. Lekker, licht bitter
Think this is the right product for what I had. Pint can. Lightly colored pour, is this a session?

Old rating. Bottle from old town. Pours a clear Amber with a modest off-white head. Pine, resin, slight citrus and malt on the nose. Lively carbonation. Very well-balanced. Slightly sweet with a nice bitter and dry finish.
Bottle at home, amber beer with a medium head, aroma is hops, fruit, some malts, Taste is quite bitter and ’’dry’’, citrus and malty taste, long dry after taste. quite nice.

33,5 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Jumbo Tiel.
Celar amber with an off-white head. Fruity hoppy aroma. Taste is more on the malty side. Finish is slightly hoppy. Indeed more an English IPA than an US one but tasty nonetheless.
Tap at some ransoms spot on Fremont. Pours Amber lots head and lacing. Nose is sweet and fruity. Taste med bitter light med sweet. Full sticky body lively carb.

Bottle from Tesco. Clear golden. Aroma of fruits, pine, sweetness. Taste has fruits and peach, pine, pineapple, toffee, honey. Finish has pine, grass and pineapple. Nice fruity IPA with slight sweetness.

Bottle at home. Hazy amber coloer with a med head. Hoppy Ipa, with notes of fruit, nice malty taste. Very drinkable IPA

Brick Lane Tasting Set. The Goose Island IPA first time I’ve seen it on tap in Japan. It pours a deep gold with a light hop nose. It is soft and soapy this beer lost out to Ise kadoya’s Pale Ale which blew it out of the water.

On tap at The Grove in Winnipeg. Piney aroma. This was delicious and very quaffable considering the IBUs. Lively palate. One of my favourite IPAs. Glad to see this in Winnipeg.
pours golden with nice lacing...not a hop bomb but tastey....good hop malt blend...it is nice once in awhile to have a less hoppy ipa...(#409)

Bottle at Hertog Jan brewery. Pours an orange unclear beer with a good white head. Smells fruity, sweet fruits, tropical. Tastes bitter, bit flat and muf. Average carbo, thin body and a dry texture.

On tap at Solas, NYC. Pours golden pale typical IPA color. Aroma is hops, and citrus, well balanced by malt backbone. Fairly typical IPA aroma. Flavor is similar. Good balance of hops and malt. How: Bottle Appearance: Golden, medium head. Aroma: citrus,floral, tropical fruits Palate: Medium body, average carbonation.

Poured from 12 oz bottle (bottled on Jan 8, 2015) into schooner glass.

Appearance: pours a 1" pillowy head that falls slowly with some mild lacing. Color is mostly clear deep gold. Abundant streaming carbonation.

Aroma: fairly for the style, pleasant citrus and pine, nice biscuit malt.

Mouthfeel: fairly light, very carbonated and frothy with a quite dry finish.

Flavor: citrus elements are stronger than in the aroma. The biscuit is in the background. Also pick up some earthy bitter hops and hop oil in the finish.

Overall: very good, but a bit too aggressive and lacking the subtle and balanced flavors of the milder English IPA style.
La belle et bonne oie... Très bonne IPA. Notes d’agrumes et d’épices, houblon. Légére amertume. Très agrèable.

* Old rating, best before 15/12/2010.  Sehr hopfenaromatisches Bier. Malzig-süßlicher Körper, frisch, aber dennoch recht süßlich-würzig, was die florale Hopfennote etwas in den Hintergrund drängt. Süßlich-hopfenaromatischer und nicht zu bitterer Nachgeschmack.
Part of my 2013 backlog. Colour is amber with white head. Aroma has citrus hops, malt and fruit. The flavour has hops, sweet fruit and caramel. Bitter aftertaste.
Very nice ipa, a little honey and sweet little bitterness. Easily and well is drunk. Not strong.
Pours hazy copper body with average foamy head and lacing. Strong woody pine and resinous aromas. Maltiness flavor subdued by crisp citrus, pine, and floral notes. Dry, but smooth finish.
16oz draft pour. Light amber colour, slight haziness. On the nose faint notes of fruity hops. Taste is well balance bubblegum hops with a hint of biscuit.

Bottle. Pours nearly clear amber with stable off-white head. Clear aroma of hops, malt and fruit, with some citric notes. Intense, bitter flavour of hops, complemented by sweet notes of fruit and caramel malt and touches of citrus. Bitter aftertaste with citric hints and estery touches. Well-balanced and decent, indeed.
On tap at fireside Grill. Very easy drinking English style IPA. Nice change up from all the west coast IPA’s.

Talk about a nice sweet hoppy smell on this one. Dense white head that sits thin on top. Clear golden/copper. Well balanced beer with lots of hops and a medium body. Long aftertaste is mostly hops but in the end is a bit bready really nice.
Bottle 35,5 cl. Copper with nice white head. Notes of caramel, grapefruit, citrus, pines, malts. Very smooth well balanced and not too bitter IPA. Good beer which shall be tasted again.
Pours copper with a thick white head. Quite a malty aroma. Very malty taste with a creamy consistency.

Bottle as a gift from Espoo, Finland. BB Jun 2015. Translucent orange with a beautiful fluffy white top. Great retention and thick lacing. Sweet aroma of malts and tropical fruits, biscuity, caramelly, slightly spicy. Taste is more sweet than bitter, nice and refreshing, the resinous-grapefruity bitterness appearing somewhere in the finish but I wouldn’t say it lasts long. Body light to medium, carbonation quite soft, palate smooth. It’s a pretty good easy-drinking (maybe even sessionable) beer but I’d more happily support small breweries rather than Anheuser-Busch - can’t see myself ever buying a bottle/can/pint of this. Glad to have tried it though.

355ml bottle (5.9%) at home on 18 Dec 2014, from Tesco, Silverburn, Glasgow: clear pale golden amber, very thin off-white head, sweet malty, citrus aroma, good lacing, sweet, high carbonation, citrus, oily, bitter finish.
Poured a pretty light Amber color with a healthy head. Well balanced in the mouth with a bit of hops upfront.

Une ipa de Chicago, plus précisément de l’île aux oies, sortie des eaux en 1988 (la brasserie …).
Ale de 5,9 % abv, ce qui suffit tout juste à faire voler l’oie, mais elle n’a pas l’air de s’en 
plaindre… Elle est même plutôt en forme.
Couleur abricoté/pêche avec un léger voile très joli.
Bulles fines par vagues régulières.
Mousse beige bien crémeuse, avec par la suite une texture très grasse.
Arômes d’agrumes, lichee, mangue, pointe de calvados jeune.
1ère bouche douce sur les agrumes, du blé d’été, pointe de piment.
Arrière-bouche sur une amertume nette.
2ème sur du houblon, des épices, pointe de poivre.
Arrière-bouche sur des fleurs de houblon, superbe.
3ème à l’équilibre, avec une texture plus pleine.
Arrière-bouche sur du malt clair et houblon.
La longueur donne une grande amertume, des fruits, du bois blanc, croûte de pain.
Les jambes sont unies, mais très collantes.
L’alcool est bien adapté au genre, il laisse s’exprimer l’amertume (et s’envoler l’oie…).
La finale apporte quelques pointes de girofle et câpres.
CONCLUSION : une belle ipa qui, excepté sa texture très grasse et sa finale un peu timide, mérite d’être goûtée.

Bitter orange, grass, layers of manly florals and perfect for winter. Its a bitter chocolate orange beer and it is insanely luscious and delightful. I get em in for Christmas to keep it special. Its a quality IPA, typically American, typically bitter, sweetness. Could be the king of IPAs. Seasons greetings hop nerds!
Had this right after a jai alai and two hearted so want to try again aroma is sweet malts and citrus... taste is well balanced, a tad thin... not bad
Une étiquette sympa ^^ et un contenu de très bonne facture ! Une belle amertume florale et peu sèche, très à mon goût. Bouteille achetée chez Intercaves, Noisy-le-Grand, France, bue le 07/05/2014.

I normally prefer dark beer and was never much of a fan of IPA’s.
Had this by chance. Very surprised and pleased.
This will definitely be part of my Xmas cheer.

A pale golden yellow coloured beer with a thick white head. A heady hop aroma, loads of citrus fruit and grassy elements. Dry mouthfeel. A bitter, zesty citrus fruit hop taste, grapefruit, lime and possibly even orange flavours along side a grassy taste. The finish is lingering and citrusy.
Bottle, 355 ml at the Beehive, Gatwick. Pours hazy orange with small white head. Hoppy fruity aroma and flavor. Piney. Nice hoppy bitterness characteristic for american IPA.

English IPA. I prefer the really hoppy beers and this is not one of them.

This IPA poured a medium amber colour with a minimal, creamy, white head. Scents include grass, citrus hops and cider. First swig was very hoppy with orange citrus and grass. Finish was quite bitter with citrus/grass lingering.

Solid American IPA. Pine and citrus hops. Sturdy malt backbone. Assertive bitterness. Smooth and clean finish.

Really fruity aroma, realized afterwards that was exactly what was advertised on their label. Fruity with maybe a hint of raspberry but still unsure. A down to earth bitterness.

Une pinte en fût à Manhattan, dans un pub irlandais. Une belle dorée avec une mousse blanche. Le liquide est translucide. Un nez de houblon frais avec un malt blond. Une bouche avec une belle amertume, facile avec des notes d’herbes et de malt blond. À boire à grosses lampées.

Can’t believe I’m rating something from AMBEV so highly. Dependable beer, very distinctive resiny aroma. Of course, the hops totally overpower everything else - its just a showcase for the (admittedly lovely) New World hops. Unusual for a US craft style IPA, its very moreish. One of the best bottled IPAs, certainly in the UK - beats the living heck out of Punk IPA for example.
Nice discovery on a US trip. I had it in Boston and NYC, mostly accompagned with pizza or nothing.
Delicious brew. Pour is a nice light amber with a thin white head. Hoppy flavor and a nice Aroma.

Draft at California Pizza Kitchen Las Vegas airport. Pours a glear golden yellow with a nice, white head that sticks. Aroma has nice notes of citrus, pine, resin, and a hint of bread. Nice. Taste is balanced. Mild pine and resin and a slight caramel and a short, refreshing finish. Medium body and carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a bubbly carbonation. Ok

@Stoutandlager. Bière avec un col persistant et une belle robe cuivrée. Le nez est assez citronné avec des effluves de caramel suret fruité (agrumes). En bouche, le maltage caramélisé fruité aux agrumes est assez lourd. Ce corp rond, biscuité, rend le palais sec mais la langue pateuse, voire crémeuse, avec un goût de mandarine ou de mangue. L’amérisation est moyennement longue sur la fin et se termine avec une petite pointe d’acreté. Bière avec un profil plus "Pale Ale", que "Extra Hoppy". Classique.

Világos réz színe telt, gazdag illatokat rejt, természetesen az aromakomlók alkotta gyantás, cukrozott, aszalt trópusi gyümölcsös koordináta-rendszer mentén, belekóstolva pedig önkéntelenül is elmormol egy imát az ember: "bárcsak nálunk is efféle lenne az alapsör". Mély, komplex ízek, melyek ugyan távoli rokonságot mutatnak egy bizonyos világos duplabakoknál megfigyelt ízvilággal, amiben a malátás édesség vastag kontúrvonalai képviselik a fő irányvonalat, egy efféle IPA esetében azonban azok mintegy kedves bevezetésként szolgálnak a grapefruitos, szegfűs kesernye helyreigazító jellegéhez.

The flavor is a bit dull and earthy, although there is some bright pine character and a light bready sweetness at its base. The light, fine carbonation is nice, but there isn’t as much lingering bitterness as I expected. Overall, this is a solid but unremarkable IPA that I will gladly drink up but won’t seek out.

nose: earth, forest, apple trees.

palate: light, sweet, fresh. lots of tree fruit, white currant and peach acidity. woody bitterness on the back end. finish is very floral and drying, with a waxiness on the tongue. nice everyday drinker if you want an ipa that doesnt slay your tastebuds

Draft Brewery Clybourn (Old Notes)-Pours amber with a decent sized head. Aroma of hops and malt. Taste of the same. This medium bodied brew is well balanced.

Appearance: light golden with two inch head. Moderate lacing

Aroma: grassy, some citrus grapefruit with a little herb. Overall moderate nose but not over powering

Taste: a little malt right after the initial bitterness. Not crazy bitter. A slight chalky aftertaste that lingers
