Pours a cloudy light amber with two inches of off white head. Head dissipates within minutes, but there is a good deal of clinging lacing that is quite beautiful, one of the beauties of nature. A good deal of carbonation is visible; an unfamiliar sight for an IPA.
Aroma is bitter citrus notes, mainly grapefruit and tangerine, with a hint of pine.
Taste is bitter citrusy hops on the front of the palate paired with some sweetness. The hops are fruity, with strong notes of grapefruit, tangerine and pineapple.
The sweetness is nonetheless hoppy with a spicy floral note, perhaps a hint of cinnamon or cardamon. 
 A dry alcohol flavor is on the back of the palate. There is also a creamy butter and caramel flavor at the end of the palate that is subtle but delectable.
Aftertaste is subtle, but definitely notes of caramel that dulls the bitterness. 
Try this IPA if you’re looking for an IPA that is not too bitter and sweetness that is not overbearing. Its the sweetest IPA you will find that is not too sweet (I’m looking at you, dogfish head 90 minute IPA).
I imagine that this IPA would be perfect for Indian cuisine, more well suited than your average IPA at that. I say this because of the bitter hops that can cut through the spices of Indian cuisine while at the same time being complimented by the spices of this IPA. Moreover, the creamy sweet aftertaste of this beer will be perfect for soothing a palate ravaged by curry.

Overall this IPA is excellent. There is bitter grapefruit on the front of the palate followed by the emergence of notes of caramel.
Draft at lucky lab. Pours clear copper work a small white head. Aroma is a pine bomb. This is a nice, light ipa with a light bitterness and some sweetness on the finish.

The aroma is quite hoppy and malty being quite balanced with pine citrus hops and caramel malt. The appearance is golden with a medium head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is smooth. Overall a great IPA.

Aroma of peach, citrus, mango floral and grass. Taste is very fruity, with the citrus, peach and some pineapple. Is it amarillo-hops in this one maybe? Medium body wich fits the beer very good. Soft carbonation. The aftertaste is very hoppy, american style. Really refreshing, but also with a lot of flavour. Fantastic good IPA, maybe my favorite accually. Recommended!

Aroma: Nice and fresh. Fruit like mango, strawberries and of course orange and grapefruit. Also, some resinous elements.

Mouthfeel: Medium oily body.

Taste: Mmmm. Bitter and crisp. Hoppy, but on a good, balanced malt background. A lot of citrus goodness. Not as agressive as brewdogs and flying dogs:)

Finish: Bitterness that lasts and lasts. Citrus notes carry on to a tannic feel.

Overall: Definitely a winner. Delicious and round. Very very enjoyable indeed.
Draft sample at the Clybourn location. Another, straight from the script brew from Goose Island; true to form IPA. It seemed to focus on floral notes more so than fruity notes. Nice.
On tap at Citi Field. Clear reddish brown pour. Simple white head. Light hop taste, citrus, good carbonation and a lower alcohol content make for an enjoyable IPA.
From the bottle. Amber and orange colour, nice aroma, delicious floral and fruity notes. Hoppy pine and citrus after taste. An understated classic IPA.

On tap in a shaker. Pours an amber-orange color with thin head; some lacing but not a lot. The nose is rather subtle, unexpected with an ipa. It has soft fruit smell like a fresh cut orange, floral and citrus hops as well. The taste is rather sweet malt with solid pine and grapefruit hop bitterness. Ten mouthfeel is a little thin with a crisp, bitter finish. Overall a very well-balanced ipa, but nothing overly extraordinary.

Put in fridge by a friend. Pours a medium golden color with bright aromas of slight tropical fruit with hints of pine and citrus.  On the palate its pretty well balanced with a touch of that fruitiness, hints of bitterness and some earthy spice in the finish. Not bad... brewed in NH... contract.

As I pour, the beer looks thin and practically green.  Once in the glass, it has a pale, dark orange color with an off-white head.  It has a really interesting bready sweet and fruity hop aroma.  Neat!  It’s very smooth in the mouth, almost creamy, with a smooth but very herbal treatment of hops.  Smooth and well-crafted.  An easy, herbal, and classic brew that delivers 55 IBUs of bitterness nice and easy.
Aroma of nice floral, pine and slight citrus.  Pours amber with a good clean film.  Taste is nice and bitter with sweet floral, grass and citrus.  Very clean and tasty.
Bottle from Alko. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel and pine.  Earthy, bitter finish. Very good IPA.

Bottled. Quite a nice beer here... medium-strong aroma, quite fruity. Tastes fruity with a liquorish hint. leading into a soft bitter aftertaste. Holds a lovely body with a thin head... My first time drinking Goose Island... I have seen it around as wasn’t sure whether I should risk it or not... quite nice, worth buying!

(bottle) pours a slightly hazy deep golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of red grapes and kiwi fruit, heavily resinous, with notes of green leaves, raisins and toffee. flavour is mostly the same, resin is dominant, with a light tropical fruitiness, some caramel and even a trace of cardboard in the medium-bitter finish. light to medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Pours a clear golden orange colour with minimal head. Nose is fruity with mandarin and peach with some soft spiciness. Taste is like buttered digestive biscuits with some fruit and the expected hop bitterness. It’s a very enjoyable IPA that’s a little more subtle than others out there.
Bottle from Capone’s. Pours a light yellow with nice head that lingers. aroma is sweet notes of cotton candy and pine. VFirst sip is similar as the nose with a little citrus flavor. nice.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Shows a deep golden color, pretty much like a typical pale/blonde ale. Clear. Fruity, apricots on the nose. Soft, lovely spicy hop aroma. Taking a decent sip, it tastes biscuity at first. Lovely hops shows up, but not much citrus, more spicy/earty/grassy-like. Soft and a moderately sweet malts settles together with peaches in the middle. Not the most bitter, neither the driest IPA I’ve had, but the beer is still fully giving and balanced for the style. The biscuit-malty - spice-hoppy marriage works very well and the fruitiness is not appearing entirely within the typical american IPA hop fruitiness-frame. I guess it has something to do with the use of mostly english-origin hops, and that a certain amout of the fruitiness in this beer may be yeast-derived (though I don’t know which yeast they use). Not typically IPA-bitter in the finish either, actually a bit sweet. Still, more than a pale ale. 
Good.

12oz bottle in a tulip.  Pours amber with a lacy, cream-colored head.  Aroma of citrusy hops and some caramel malts.  Flavor pretty standard for a IPA, more citrusy than a lot of them.  Average texture.  Not a bad IPA.
Bottle. Fruit and floral aroma, gold color. Medium sweet fruit up front followed by a dry mild bitter finish. Refreshing and enjoyable.

Light glowing orange body.  Massive off-white head, solid lacing.  Fruity hops , orange, a bit of cotton candy and bubble gum, lightly floral toward the back end.  Similar flavor with a nice light refreshing fruity hop bitterness.  Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, pleasant and refreshing.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a dark gold with about a finger of white head. Aroma of some citrus hops and caramel malt. Taste is light bitter. Medium bodied with a somewhat slick texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, not bad. There are better IPAs out there but there are also a lot worse.

A decent IPA from Chicago’s only macrobrewery (despite their advertising)  12 oz bottle pours a clear amber color with a small white head. Smells mostly of piney hops.  Aroma also has floral hops and caramel.  Tastest Sweet at first with a clean, bitter finish.  Medium body and carbonation. Definitely better than Budweiser, but nowhere near the greats in the crowded IPA field.

Bottle. Golden. Slightly hazy with a decent white head. Light but enticing aroma of grassy, citrus hops. Flavour is restrained but totally pleasant. Nice and hoppy with some caramel and a bitter end. A very nice entry-level American IPA.

This was purchased at The Caboose in Ashland.  Honkers is the signature beer for Goose Island.  This IPA is a nice addition to their mix of beers. The color is a golden ale with a smallish head and lacing down the glass. It is not overly bitter to taste and really a mild IPA.  The IPA has a  medium body and is pleasant to drink with a smooth finish.  The ale has average carbonation. Nice bitterness in the back of the mouth. The finish is clean with lingering bitterness.

I was so surprised when I had this beer. It has little to no head, looks very cloudy. But wow is it smooth! Not super bitter or super hoppy. Would definitely buy again! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Probably the best beer at Yankee Stadium. Eclectic mix of bittering UK hops which stand out in the palatte and flavorful American hops. My wife disagree that this is a English style IPA as she is English. But the yeast character gives it this rather dry finish among the bitterness and I wish the citrus component was more prevalent. More of a hybrid to me and a nice IPA.

YET ANOTHER IPA IN A SEA OF IPA’S AND THIS ONE JUST DOESN’T CUT IT VASTLY OVERRATED. SLIGHTLY BITTER HOPS ARE PRESENT YET THE FLAVORS ARE SLIGHTLY OFF NOT DONE WELL ENOUGH FOR MY PREFERENCE, IF YOU HAVE A CHOICE OF THIS OR ANOTHER IPA GO THE OTHER, YET IF YOU HAVE A CHOICE OF THIS AND A LIGHT PILSNER THIS WILL DO. VERY SLIGHTLY ABOVE AVERAGE BEER FOR A MACRO BREW YET VERY BELOW AVERAGE IPA.
Orange gold pour. Fresh citrusy hop aroma with  light caramel notes. Flavor is fresh spruce hops, quite bitter. Prickly dry.
Malty with orange citrus. Light sweet with mid, sharp bitter. Mid soft body, with a light Orange colour...good.

Bottle. Pours hazy, bright gold with average, frothy white head; short retention and spare lacing. Aroma is oranges, citrus fruit, grassy hops, caramel and cereal malt, and light yeast. Flavor is hops forward (medium bitterness) with good supporting malt and some light fruit esters on the back of the palate; dry finish. Medium body, low/medium carbonation, and low warmth.

Pours a hazy orange..nice, tight, white head.
Nose is faint....citrus, hops.
Taste is a fresh,crisp, bitter fruitness....very soft and light...
A nice, pleasant IPA... very good.

on bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika
Golden color, ok foam
Medium body & high complexity
Piney/hoppy taste
High viscosity
More like a double IPA
Enjoyable
Hoppy citrus aroma; tastes of tart orange peel; a big piney hop attack balanced by a sweet malty mouthfeel; a long dry hoppy finish, excellent stuff.

Poured into a Duvel tulip from a 12 ounce bottle bottled on 2-28-2012.



A: Hazy amber body with a thin but dense white head.



S: Lots of citrus slightly resinous hop aroma, lots of earthy grass like aromas. This smells good, but I remember it being more pungent on tap, I blame the 2 months past bottling on this.



T: Slight tea-like, earthy grassy flavor with a grapefruit citrus bite. Decent hop bitterness from start to finish, but this is definitely lacking compared to the tap when it was fresh. 



M: Light to medium bodied with mild carbonation.



O: I’m really disappointed with this in the bottle, I guess hops do fall off that fast. I had this on tap last week and was blown away with this and now it’s boring. I’m going to consider this a pre-rate and will re-rate when I get a fresher bottle.

very good.
big cirtrus and floral hop aroma. flavours of orange, lemon pith, caramel and sweet malt.
tangy bitter finish.
330ml bottle. Pale orange with small head. Malty aroma, with less hops than expected. First taste is horlicks, with fruity hop bitterness following.
330ml bottle. Hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma has peach and sitrus is sweet with peachy and grapefruit notes. Extremely bitter hops.
Clear golden brown with decent head. Piney & citrus aroma, light malts. Finish is moderate bitter.

Pours a slightly hazy light amber with a decent sized head consisting of fine bubbles.  Aroma of floral hops, perfume.  Bitter taste, light on the malt.  Thin mouthfeel.  I feel the hops are wasted on this beer. Maybe the beer is depressed.  A decent offering, but far short of impressive.

Aroma:hay, citrus
Taste: very bitter, light sweetness
colour:golden, 
Palate:full body, creamy, lively Carbonation; bitter, long finish, 
Nice !
strait hoppy from the smell up to the long lasting aftermatch !

Originally reviewed: 12/3/08. Pours a murky gold (chill haze?), but is much lighter than I expected. Small head, but great lacing. Smells of strong pineapple citrus, some clove, and slight pine notes. 

Wow. This is a great tasting IPA! The pineapple taste mirrors the scent. Great hop bitterness at the onset, during the drink, and at the finish, but without the bitter aftertaste. This IPA will not burn the mouth out, but man is it satisfying! Very smooth and crisp. I really like this beer...

Not a super assertive IPA but very complex is the nose and palate.  It has some hop bittnerness to it, but it’s also very citrusy and more floral than most IPAs.  Summery and very bright.  Very complex for an IPA.  Moderate body, crisp finish.
Clear golden colour with small head. Aroma is grape, pine. Flavour is citrus, hoppy.
12 oz bottle.  Golden copper, slightly cloudy pour with a medium fizzy white head.  Aromas of vanilla, faint yeast with orange and grapefruit hops.  Creamy mouthfeel with a smooth finish.
Bottle. Color orange with small white head. Aroma fruity, citrus, hop, fresh. Taste fruity, citrus, hop.

33cl bottle. Light orange/green. Small white head. Nose : citrus cake, vanilla, orange zest. The smell is really delicious. Nose : Creamy body with low to medium carbonation. Sweet citrus cake start, fruity tart that develops a nice pine and grapefruit bitterness that lasts long. Nice ! I really enjoy those cascade IPA from States, nice job !

Bottle.  Pours lightly hazy orange with a medium, creamy off-white head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is citrus and pine hops, fruity esters and biscuit malt.  Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness, fruity esters and light malt with a dry finish.  Medium body and carbonation with low warmth.
12oz bottle poured into a Tripel Karmaleit glass. One finger head that dissapeared after a minute. Nice sessionable IPA.

Good looking light orange, close to amber body body with a large, off-white, long-lived head that turns into patches of foam floating on a film of tiny bubbles. Very good lacing. The aroma is quite unusual for an IPA: there are some hoppy citric notes of over-ripe grapefruit, but the malty elements are almost as evident. I get caramel and some almost lightly toasted notes. The malts provides a moderate to light sweet taste, while the finish is moderate plus bitter. The malty parts almost drown the grapefruit and floral notes with lots of caramel, bread and toasted notes. Good mouthfeel. A quite nice IPA, but the malty elements are a bit in the way of the fruity notes, which I think is what should rule a good IPA.


[35.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 6 months before BB date, from Vinomonopolet Storo, Oslo]

13/IV/2012 - 355ml bottle from Waitrose (Canterbury) @ home - BB: 8/IX/12 (2012-351) 


Clear golden beer, big creamy head, pretty adhesive and stable. Aroma: very fruity, sweet exotic fruits, passion fruit, pineapple, lychee, bit piny. MF: little carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty fruity, little sweet, piny hops, bit cheesy, very hoppy, honey, sweet malts. Aftertaste: little sweet, resin, piny hops, honey, exotic fruits, lychee, dry bitter ending. Nicely balanced ipa. Better than Stone stuff.

Haven't had this in forever, assumed I wouldnt like it.  So wrong. Very good IPA!  Pours golden/orange.   Fruity and hoppy aroma. Perfect hops and citrus pine favor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours to a golden color and decent head/lacing.  Smells piney but tastes much more smooth than that - good hops kick, yet balanced, with a lemony after-flavor I haven’t noticed much in other IPAs.  Malts figure in the finish as well.  Quite refreshing.

Pours a clear orange color with a medium off-white head. Aroma is citrusy along with some sweet malt. Taste is piney hop mixed with sweet malt and a citrusy hop finish. Palate is medium. Moderate carbonation.
Perfect balance of bittering and late boil aromatic hops. Fruity taste and modestly carbonation. A great pale ale.

12oz bottle, clean golden color, with a frothy white head, soft hops bouquet nose, with some light spicy, piney, leafy, grassy, lemon peel accents, with a floral pineapple, mango, peach fruity hoppy note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate, with a nice flowery fruity peachy, mango, lychee, pineapple, lemon peel, cedary, piney, leafy hop character, with some light honeyed pale, munich, toasted malt, faint lemongrass spicy flavours, and with a light lemon pie, lemon marmalade undertone, leading towards a fruity pineapple, citrusy, lingering leafy, cedary, sappy hop bitterness finish.

Pours a light golden with plenty of carbonation and a large white foamy head. Brew smell reminds me of incense sticks, hops and some lighter fruits or flowers. Medium body the hops and carbonation bounce around on the palate. Floural hops and the taste of orange balance pretty well with a bread like malt and a dry finish. Neither malt or hops are too strong, not a weak beer but too expensive.
Gooseberry and fruity flavours combined with wine like qualities, lovely on the palate

(draft) Clear, pale golden body with a medium white head. Nice citrus hop aroma, some sweetness; grapefruit, peach. Light to medium body, a bit oily texture. Bright, refreshing citrus and pine hips. Only a hint of sweetness underneath.
Bottle. Amber. Citrus (grapefruit), hops, malts, caramel, spices. Doesn’t finish very dry, nor bitter.

Poured into a tulip glass. Nice but short lived foam, appearance slightly cloudy. Not as hoppy and more malty as I seem to remember. Slightly disappointing but still a pleasant beer with a spicy touch that makes for a nice aperitif.  Too pricey, and my wife’s favourite is still Lucky Jack from Lervig.

Opaque medium gold with a soapy lacy white head. Fruity citrus greapfruit hops. Grainy medium thin body. The carbonation is prickly. Super strong citrus greapefruit, orange peel. A true ipa. So strong to drink. A little overwhelming but is very delicious.

Poured from bottle - aroma of fruity hops; taste is very light caramel malt followed by a piney hoppiness; fairly bitter and finishes dry.  Not a bad IPA by any means, but I like the maltier IPAs (and DIPAs) so this was not my cup of tea, especially having this without food.

A very good IPA with a cloudy amber pour and a small rocky head. The aroma has the sweetness of the malt and a big citrus and pine back ground. The flavor follows suit with a nice malt sweetness followed by the hops. Nice lingering dry finish.
Bottle pours a clear sdark golden with a thin white top. Scent is grass and caramel. Taste is grass, caramel and pine. Good

Pours golden color. One inch head of a white color. Great retention and great lacing. Smells of hop oils, floral hops, slight sweet malt, and slight citrus. Moderately sweet maltiness, and moves into some clean hops that take over to finish it off. Smooth, and well balanced.

From notes. Pours a nice slightly burnt amber color with an inch of off-white head.
Nice big citrus aroma, with some floral notes as well. There is a fairly sweet malty aroma that blends nicely with the hops.
The flavor is pretty well balanced, nice citrusy bitter hop backed with some sweet malt, defiantly not a dry IPA.
This one is on the lighter side of a medium body, the carbonation is also on the lower side of medium. The bitterness of the finish doesn’t linger for very long making it pretty refreshing.

Bottle courtesy of Ciarin at the Brewer’s House, Donaghmore. Thanks!
Medium amber with soft malt and satsuma on the nose. Zesty hops with biscuit malt a great balanced beer.

Clear golden pour thin off white head lots of sticky lacing .... aroma is of spicy floral and citrusy hops with a caramel and biscuity malt .....taste is of citrusy and bitter floral hops with a biscuity and caramel malt  .... bitterness is just right and the balance is pretty close with a slight edge to the hops of course ... the spicy hop bite lingers into a dry hoppy finish ... solid and tasty sessionable more or a traditional british ipa with a nice touch of cali

Had this on tap at NYC Sports Bar, Terminal 8, Concourse B at JFK Airport. Paid $7.50 which isn’t too bad for Airport beer. Poured into a Sam Adams Perfect Pint



A - Poured a light brown color that’s medium brown in the glass. 1 Finger of creamy head was formed. Not the normal shimmer you get in an IPA but still very good looking.



S - Great piney scent, lots of tangerine and ruby red grapefruit with a hint of some floral notes like honeysuckle.



T - I’m getting mild burnt taste and lots of acidity right up front. The pine and citrus taste is very muted almost fading as soon as I drink it. There’s a solid smoke aftertaste and some of the hop resins stick around after swallowing. Not a lot in this beer honestly.



M - Nice and solid mouth-feel. 80% carbonation on a mouth swish but this only helps to bring out more of the burnt pine taste. Not sure why this is so burnt.



O - I’ve only ever had release beers from Goose Island via trades. So, this is my first shelf Goose Island beer and it’s pretty disappointing.

In bottle. Pours a golden colour with a decent white head. Lovely fruity hop aroma of tropical fruits, pine and mango especially. A resinous mouth-feel with pine and pineapple flavours upfront. Just a little sweet with a chewy malt backbone. Moderate carbonation and a little CO2 prickle. Very tasty.
Bottle 33 cl. Golden, hazy with a nice white head. Aroma, lots of fruits, some sweet malt and hay. Fresh bitter taste with a hoppy ending, like...

Pours a clear pale yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma has some mild citrus and stonefruit...spicy grapefruit and apricot...some light biscuity maltiness.  Flavor is crisp and bitter...more earthy/spicy than fruity...well balaced.  Mouthfeel is light/medium and lively with a slightly dry bitter finish that is spicy/fruity.

Bottle at home, almost 6 mths old. Unfortionently I suspect it lost its edge a bit. Still above average and very drinkable with fairly good fruitiness and not too high bitterness. Refreshing and tasty!
Clear yellow body with a white creamy head. Floral aroma of american hops. Heavily bitter, lightly sweet. Very well balanced.
Perfectly pleasant IPA, but nothing exceptional. I think that I prefer Sierra Nevada’s offering. Still perfectly enjoyable though.
Bottle. Orange color with medium white head. Aroma of honey, oranges, grapefruit, floral hops. Taste, honey, pine, sweet orange, tangerine, floral hops. Light bitter finish. Decent IPA.
This one seems to be sour on the backend. And it is a consistent sour that sticks with you. Plus, it has a dirty taste, like something was spilled in it. Not one of the better IPAs I’ve had.

I’ve just started getting into IPA’s and Goose Island has been one of the most pleasant of the batch.

It was hoppy but not overly so and had a great aroma of citrus, honey and floral notes.  Even a little bit of buttery smell.  

It’s a pretty goldenish color and looks good in the glass.  A nice white head formed and took a while to disappear.  

The flavor matched the aroma and appearance perfectly with lost of floral and citrus notes.  Maybe even a bit of kiwi and lemongrass.  It wasn’t overpowering in the bitterness and hops department which can be a turnoff for me.  It seemed just right to me. 

Another winner from Goose Island - my hometown brewery.  I really like this for a spring to summer warm up beer and will be high on my list of beer to enjoy this summer along with Honker’s Ale.

Honey color with a 1/2" head that quickly disappeared. Mild lacing that clung for a few minutes after each sip. Smells of citrus and a little grassy 
Mouthfeel is very nice, very mild with just the right amount of carbonation.

a: hazy nut brown color that lightens towards the bottom of the glass. 1/4" head that has slight retention. Reduces into very light lacing. Good amount of carbonation.

s: nice blend of earthy hop and malt

t: A nice sweet malt backbone that is peirced slightly by the hops. Very well balanced taste for an IPA.
i have to write something in order for ratebeer to let me add it to my list of beers.

From notes.  First reviewed 5/2/2009.  Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip.

This pours a surprisingly transparent golden color, with barely a hint of copper. An aggressive pour leaves a 5 cm head that recedes quickly. It does leave some light lacing clinging to the glass.

Mostly nice citrusy hops in the aroma, with some grassy notes as well; a toasted malt sneaks its way in.

A slightly sweet taste at first gives way to a dry, toasted malt. This flavor does not last long, however, as the grapefruit inspired hops clearly dominate the taste. Grapefruit, with some light earthy notes carry the taste most of the way.

Perpetual carbonation gives it a light feel, and although it covers my tongue with a grassy resin, the overall sensation is quite pleasant on my tongue.

While hop-dominated, the taste is still quite controlled, so drinking more than a few of these would be no challenge. 

This IPA has a nice flavor, but it just does not seem that inspired to get a better review. To me, it seems a little light on the flavor side, maybe to make it more marketable. I wish it would kick me in the mouth a little bit more.

My wife brought this one back from a trip to Rochester. +++ Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a bright orange color with a medium sized yellow-white head that left decent lacing. The aroma was sweet pine, grapefruit, caramel and butterscotch. The flavor was sweet and tangy grapefruit followed by a spicy note and then moderate piney hops with undertones of orange, bread and biscuit. The finish was long, tangy pine, orange and biscuit. Fairly full bodied. Solid.

12oz bottle. Pours gold/straw, medium carbonation, small white head - doesnâ€™t last too long. Pine on the nose, grassy notes, malt sweetness & a bit of citrus there too. Caramel sweet malt taste at work with a nice pine resin & citrus flavour - satisfying bitterness in the aftertaste. A good easy-drinking IPA, but certainly not one for the days when you want a big hop hit.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it’s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!


Das Bier im Glas ist für ein IPA recht hell geraten. Könnte ebenso ein naturtrübes Pils sein. Der Geruch offenbart sich zitrus-hopfig und leicht ölig. Das IPA startet recht mild, angenehme Hopfenaromen machen sich breit, zudem wirkt das ganze leicht fruchtig. Der Abgang zeigt sich vergoren fruchtig, dezent bitter zitrusartig. Auch die Mitte bleibt für ein IPA sehr mild und süffig, was aber nicht bedeutet, dass das Bier lasch schmeckt.

Pours a cloudy orange with less than a finger of stark white head.  Fairly strong odor of floral hops in the nose.  Starts fairly light and watery, leading to a basic bitterness.  It’s good, but a little watery.

Bottle. Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is sweet caramel and hay/herbal-hoppy. Tastes sweet malty, corn, hay. Hops are not really that apparent exept for the dry mouthfeel. Ends with a lasting sweet caramel taste and  some bitterness with a hint of pine. Low/medium carbonation.

HEAD - White foamy head.
AROMA - Spicy malt, reminds me of a tin of home brew syrup.
COLOUR - Golden brown.
BODY - Medium.
ATTACK - Malty, spicy with fruit flavours  mainly pear.
MID PALATE - Spicy malt with a touch of yeastiness.
FINISH - Pine nut and bitter lemon peel.
CARBONATION - Quite high for an IPA. 
OVERALL - A unique and tasty beer, not too complex and very much in line with the craft American beer scene.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from tesco. Pours cloudy orange, very fruity but a lingering bread taste. Ok but had much better IPAs

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hardly any head, and what is there dissipates almost immediately. Very fragrant, with notes of citrus, fresh cut grass, orange. Palate is very thin. Tastes not overly hoppy or complex, and finishes sweet.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and some tropical fruitiness with light grapefruit and citrus hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor,  caramel and light tropical fruitiness, some citrus hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, light fruitiness with some caramel, some citrus - light piney hoppyness. OK IPA - bit too sweet/too much caramel.
Bottle from Alko. Clear golden beer with white head. Strong citric hoppy aroma.  Fruity hoppyness goes for the taste as well. Quite crisp stuff.

Bottle. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of grapefruit, biscuits, malt, grains and citrus. Flavor is sweet and bitter with some malt, fruitiness, floral hops and  honey.Medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle, Pale gold with a very white one inch head. Hoppy, soapy and medium body, medium bitterness on the finish. Tasty and drinkable.

35,5cl bottle - pours hazy orange with rich off-white head and decent lacing.  Nose is citrus hops and caramel.  Taste is sweet and ends bitter.  very dry finish along with thin texture and medium body.  an IPA I can enjoy!
It tastes like any other IPA, just dump this shit into your fat face and everything will be fine

A - pours very clear light cider pour with 1 finger high tight bubbles, quickly dissipates. 

S - aromas of pine and bitter citrus hops. Grapefruit and lemon zest. Hints of biscuity malts as well. 

M - light creamy body. Lingering malty ending.  Syrupy up front, dry ending. 

T - hops up front. Citrus, grapefruit and zest. Caramel malts and bready yeasts on the palate. Dry ending. 

O - quite good, well balanced standard ipa. 

6-

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Really well balanced and drinkable IPA. One of the first American craft brews I had so a firm favourite.
Sweet, floral aroma.  Sweet base beer with a nice hop bite.  Not the most aggressive IPA out there, but a solid effort.
the aroma is very gentle floral notes. good amber haze. a nice balanced of caramel malt and pale malt .the hop profile is fruity and tangy . overall very well design ipa .
Big, hoppy and flavoursome. A bit too tart and ’sticky’ perhaps but very pleasant, especially for such a widely available IPA.
On tap at Flyers - Devils Game at the Prudential Center.  Appearance is golden amber.  Very hoppy with citrus flavor.  An enjoyable beer and a solid IPA.
355 ml bottle. Golden colour nice head. Tropical fruits nose, refreshing taste beginning bitter and ending dry. Great balance, elegant IPA.
Bottle. Hazy light copper colour with a foamy head. Strong hoppy aroma of flovers and lemon. Flavour is citrus & hops. Light to medium body. Medium to high bitter. Very good.
Orange colour. Kind of sweet aroma for an IPA. Bitter hoppy taste. Quite a nice IPA.

Served on-tap at the Brewhouse Grill.

A - Pours slightly hazy orange with a small half finger tall white head leaving streaky lace down the entire glass.

S - Smells of lightly toasted sweet caramel malt, pungent citric hops, ripe grapefruit, orange zest, and a faint biscuit quality. Nothing spectacular but still very solid.

T - Starts off with a big dose of citric hops slowly giving way to a mix of sweet caramel malt, grapefruit, orange, and some light chewiness. Finish is a mix of light sweetness and lots of hop bitterness, lingering on the pallet for some time.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Smooth, bitter feel that lingers on the pallet for some time after consumption.

O - I was shocked to see this on the tap list; since they hadn’t yet announced that they were coming to PA; I had to get one and boy was I happy I did. Awesome flavors and very drinkable, good stuff for sure.

On tap. Pours with a lightly hazy golden hue with a large and lasting white head. Aromas are malt forward, bready, light caramel. Clean yeast wise. Hops seem a touch faded, citrusy, grapefruit, lightly herbal. Flavors are fruity with a medium bitterness. Citrusy, malt forward, bready, caramel. Medium bubbles, somewhat dry finish. Good standard IPA.

New York City At TÃ¯r na NÃ³g - On draught poured into a shaker, a clear amber color. When the glass arrived to my table most of the head and lacing had disappeared. Aroma was of fruity hops but not too overwhelming unfortunately it was also mixed in with perfume, I believe from the waitresses hand. Initial taste was mellow but then the flavors began to develop. As the flavors opened up you got the hint of fruitiness, maybe a raspberry or peach undertones and then the hoppiness came in. It was not overly bitter but just right. Went well with my Irish meal!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Rich, citrus aroma, pours orange-amber with medium carbonation and a medium head. Great balanced taste of hops and citrus with a medium bitter finish; very drinkable, a very good beer.

Beautiful pale orange and clear with pure white head. Citrus and slight malt dominate the palate. Great citrus aroma. Taste is crisp with floral dominating taste. The bitterness is very well balanced. An excellent IPA.

Hazy orange pour with moderate off-white head with decent lacing. Aroma of mostly citrus with some floral and light caramel notes. Citrus heavy taste of grapefruit and lemon, yet still slightly sweet with hints of malt present. Somewhat bitter and dry finish. Pretty good IPA.

Hazy light amber, with good head and lace.  Presents itself very nicely.  Taste is the way I think beers should be - a great balance between caramel honey malt and pine hops.  The hops are very visible through the finish, yet they allow the malt to continue to the finish as well.  I am not a piney hop fan....this beer is an exception.

(35 cl bottle from the secret beer outlet) Pours a slightly hazy amber with medium, off-white head, good retention and lace. Aroma is of American hops: grass, citrus and a bit of grapefruits and perhaps even passion fruit. Oily texture, medium to full body, medium carbonation and a bitter finish. Taste is moderately, freshly bitter with a good, well-balanced malty sweetness almost remniscient of a hoppy amber ale. Quite enjoyable and sessionable. Girlfriend says: "There’s some almond taste toward the end."

Pours a dark gold/amber with a puffy white head.  Aroma is pine, grass and citrus.  Taste is pine, lemon, oranges, grass,   A nice malt backbone - maybe some very light caramel there.  Finishes with a lingering bitterness, with a slight sweet end.  Thick mouthfeel, almost oily to me.  Average carbonation.  Leaves white lacings on the glass as it goes down.  Very, very good.

My first Goose Island experience, poured into a goblet like oversized wine glass, this 355ml bottle comfortably fit in. Very little head, perhaps my method of pouring was awful, I suppose it was. Anyway, this is a good quality India Pale Ale. Lemon & Grapefruit on the nose, its golden in colour, perhaps a little amber. A medium bitterness, quite hoppy. The alcohol is well hidden and its fairly smooth, silky even on the palate making it quite a pleasureable drinking experience. Overall, 15 because I didn’t quite know what to expect.

Tasted from bottle into a nucleated pint glass. Poured a light amber color with fluffy white foam, fairly long-lasting with lots of lace. Aromas and flavors are purely true-to-style. A classic English-style India Pale Ale, which means hoppy and delicious. But nothing more, nothing less. Awfully good for an AB-InBev product, I’d say.
floral, golden, pale, medium bitterness .average carbonation.  Strong white lacing. Pretty standard IPA.

Bottle. Average head that was off white and fizzy. Light citrus aroma on the nose, with a medium hop taste. Overall, a well balanced beer that would serve as a good introductory ipa beer to those who are afraid of hops.

Had this at a Goose Island restaurant at O’Hare airport that was out of every Goose Island except this one, but that will end the rant. Pour was Cooper with a medium head. Nice citrus and floral notes in taste, and aroma. Good beer.

Date: December 9, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Heritage Description: Orangish yellow pour with nice head and some lacing, aroma of hops, citrus and spice, taste is sweet start with slight bitter finish.  Had this previously, but first time since I have started rating.  Very well balanced and nicely done.
Very tasty IPA. Full hop flavour without being over powering and plenty malty goodness to balance the bitterness.

on tap at a Scottish bar close to Times sq, New York.
Thin white head.  Hazy golden pour.  Nice grapefruit bitterness
We have a very hoppy and citrus aroma in taste and aroma. Good carbonation, sweet and strong notes of lemon.  Smooth, felt silky in the mouth.  Very  nice.
Bottle. Hazy golden with a small white head. Fruity IPA with a fair amount of bitterness. Aromas of citrus (grapefruit), pine and sweet fruits. Nice dry and quite bitter finish.

Kullan vrärinen ja hieman valkoista vaahtoa omaava Goose Island Indioa Pale Ale näyttää lasissa. kirkkaalta. Sen tuoksussa on puista humalointia ja sitrusta. Maultaan olut on hedelmäinen ja humaloiti puraisee mukavasti katkeruutena. Tähän on saatu kohtalaisen paljon hiilihappoja. Tuoreena tämä on hyvää, mutta ajan myötä muuttunee hieman metalliseksi.

Pours amber with low head. Quite foggy
Aromas of apricots and hints of citrus
Taste is sweet with low bitterness. Low carbonation.
Overall an ok IPA.

Bottle. Orange colour with a medium-sized off-white head. Hoppy aroma with orange, grapefruit and malt. Sweetish malt, bitterness, citrusy hops with orange and grapefruit in the flavour. Medium-bodied, dry and bitter finish.

CLear amber pour with 2 fingers of eggshell lacing.  Aroma of Caramel, pine, grapefruit, a bit of breadiness.  Some grapefruit hopping but it gives way to the calt - caramel, a bit of dark bread.  Easy drinking, medium carbonation, dry aftertaste.  I suspect this bottle had been siting a bit as it was nowhere near as hoppy as I remember this beer being the first time I tried it.

Bottle from Gassboro’s in Seekonk, MA. Pours out a well carbonated clear orange/amber color with a foamy white head. Aroma is of some light pine and citrus hops, and a touch of some sweet lightly fruity malts. Taste is much the same with a decent bitterness in the finish. Solid, drinkable IPA.

Nice floral aroma with a bit of citrus. Pours cloudy with a nice white head. Slight sweetness and then a very pleasant medium to heavy bitterness. Light body, average carbonation for an IPA, nice finish that lingers and begs for another sip.
Appetizing golden hue. Taste is moderate hops and light fruit. A decent standard IPA.
From bottle.  Pours hazy light orange colour with oily white head.  Strong fruity hop aroma.  Tastes hoppy as well with a bit of soapiness.

The pour is a darker orange color with slightly off white head.  Not much carbonation on this one, with fast dissipation.  Smell is wonderful of biscuty cookies, bready yeast, which play very well together.  Hardly no hops on the nose.  Malt backbone is incredible.  Nice mouthfeel for an IPA, a good amount of malt oomph.  As for the hops, I felt they were somewhat lacking, one dimensional... some fresh cut grass and pine notes in there, but not much going on.  For an IPA you would think the opposite.  Overall a very good beer, but just needs some more robust hop flavor.  Drinkability 4/5

1. Look – A pale amber color IPA with a big frothy white head.
2. Sniff – It has malty nose with a hoppy citrus aroma.
3. Sip – This medium bodied IPA is somewhat sweet with a mildly bitter taste.  It is a very easy drinking IPA.
4. Another Look – This is a good looking ale that has great color and lacing.
5. Evaluate – Overall, this is a representative example of the IPA style.  It is tasty ale that has a big malt body and soft bitter finish.  I would recommend to my family and friends and those who are starting to try IPA’s.
(Bottle 06/11-2011) Low white head, slightly unclear yellow color, hoppy aroma, bitter dry hoppy taste. BB date 06/07/2012.
Bottle. Pours nice clear golden with a frothy head that stays in a minimal way. Aroma high in citrus, herbs. IPA style bitter taste. Not Bad.

Can. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Low carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of peach, lemon cake and Lockets. Flavour of orange, lemon, honey and flower petals. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Sweet and tangy.

355ml bottle from Alko



Pours light orange with a small foamy head. Aroma has notes of fruity hops and malts. Taste is quite malty with notes of fruity and bitter hops. Hints of berries and orange. Finish is slightly bitter and sticky. Okay, quite well balanced IPA.

Bottle @ The White Horse, Parsons Green, London. Slightly hazy light orange color, small creamy white to off-white head. Smell lightly fruity, lightly hoppy and bitter. Taste malts, moderately fruity, moderately hoppy and a lot ot bitterness. Medium carbo, medium body.

Bottle. Pours a golden with a medium, white head. Aroma is passion fruit and pine. Flavor is dry and hoppy, passion fruit, pine, nettles. A very dry finish. Surprisingly little maltiness. Palate is refreshing, medium light, somewhat carbonated.

355ml bottle: Hazy amber to orange with a small, bubbly white head & good retention. The nose is pine hops & citrus working well together then some faint tropical notes to finish. The taste is similar with the citrus a little stronger this time with a few tropical flavours to finish. The body is medium, fresh & smooth but it goes down well with a fruity, bitter finish that was easy to drink too.

Pours pale golden with a clear head. plenty of bubbles with a lovely sweet aroma of exotic fruits. Taste is pure hops, plenty of dry bitterness, and not at all sweet. long bitter finish tops things off. not massive depth of flavour, just loads of mad hoppyness! quite liked this one..

35,5 cl bottle @ home, BBE 09.08.2012

Aroma is surprisingly light with fresh american hops, exotic fruits. It is a bit sweet too. Flavour is typical to an American IPA: sweetish with hops and exotic fruits. Also some hints of spices (or then it was just my hamburger that matched with this beer very well.) Palate is slightly thin. Rather typical but good American IPA! Try to catch this as fresh – the older bottle I had wasn’t this good.

355 ml bottle. BBE 08/09/2012.

Originally rated on 20100425. (8+3+8+4+15)

Pours clear copper colour with large foamy head. Aroma of hoppy fruits, orange peel, light caramel malts, grass, some toffee and light floral notes. Flavour of sweetish caramel, malts, fruits, dry hay, light citrus and notes of syrup. Bitter and dry palate with a sweetish finish. Very crisp hoppyness, medium-bodied.

4515

Pours a golden color with decent head and a little lacing. Aroma reminds me of being lost in a sea of spruce trees. One of the better tasting IPA’s I have ever had but it has a bitter aftertaste and it leaves a thick residue in the mouth.

What a wonderful beer. Evocative for me...of what I won’t say.  A great, truly American IPA. Rather different from an English IPA, and it shows in both the aroma (how can that be bettered?) and the flavour. Balanced and very hoppy, and what hops: Styrian, Fuggle, Cascade and Centennial. A great combination, and with an exquisite maltiness. Oh Cascade!

bottle from Bury St. Edmunds Tesco, UK, awesome light hoppy aroma, pale, hazy, white foam, rocky head, very bitter, medium sweetness, full body, thick feel, slick feel, long finish, bitter, soft carbonation, very nice IPA i like that ...mighty bitterness with velvet sweetness coool
Hazy golden with a medium white head. Fruity and malty. Malt, fruit, hops and caramel. Medium body with a long, balanced finish.

Goose Island IPA.
Good head stays, well carbonated.
Hoppy, lemony grassy aroma.
Same flavour, light, consistent to the aftertaste.
Easy drinking with a slight bite.

reasonably priced, easy to find. Nothing real special here, but this is a fine brew that can be enjoyed straight from the bottle if conditions require. Not a beer that a glass is going to make a real difference with.
Citrus, floral, grapefruit, and mild grass aroma and flavour.    Dark golden-amber, off-white head with mild lacing.  Mild sweet malt, bitter hops, balanced and refreshing.  Medium bitterness.

Little head cloudy yellow. Fine hoppy nose with some fresh hay, lemon, grapefruit. Medium body and some length. Taste is more light than the nose. Again lemon and a little grapefruit.  Well ballanced and very drinkable.

Pours rich, clear, gold with a medium white head.  Heavy on the hops with a floral, citrus, and grass aroma.  A light sweet taste which is nice from an IPA and it still has the nice bitter bite to give it a nice robustness.  A somewhat light body with a medium bitter finish.  One of the better IPAs I’ve had.  One I’ll get on a regular basis.
Very enjoyable IPA on draft.  Very fruity - citrus/tropical fruits, enough sweetness and light caramel malt (if there is such a thing) to balance it out.
Quite good IPA. Maybe a bit too thin body, maybe because of quite low alcohol percentage.
Bottle from Tesco - Very pleasantly surprised, not dis similar to Punk IPA, not as hoppy on the nose, but a nice rounded taste.  I would buy this again

Bottle. Aroma is Piney hops, grapefruit and orange sherbet. Appearance is golden amber with little carbonation.  The Taste is doing the same as the aroma but more of that orange sherbet followed by a soft bitterness. Light body and feels quite slick. Really good.

Bottle. Big grapefruit nose, honey. Rich. Deep gold color with lace. Rather sweet flavor, honey malt, huge citrus and grass, good bitterness. A bit too sweet overall, but delicious and pretty well balanced.

pour light-cobber-yellow, whit a small white head.
aroma is mostly hops, citrus.
the taste is light bitter, usual for an ipa.
I guess i wanted more out of this, but it is still rather okay..
Pours a nice copper color with small head.  Aroma is hops and sweet malt.  Flavor is spicy hops with medium bitterness and some residual sweetness.  As far as IPA’s go, it’s just ok.

This beer did not at all impress me or my friend. We are tasting a few beers, and this is so far the least good one. This was recommended at the liquor store. Obviously not a hit.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a light copper color.  Dissipating head. Aroma of sweet fruitful hops.  Med bitter.  Lite sweetness.  Med light body. Slight earthy hay flavors but mostly fresh malt and hops taste.  Nice mouthfeel.  Pretty good.

Glass, 5-ounce, on the premise, savoured on July 5 2011; eye: copper, clear, no effervescence, off-white head that turns into a tiny ring, lots of lacing; nose: resinous hops, grapefruit, pine, slight orange; mouth: resinous hops, pine, grapefruit, slight malt, slight caramel, long finale in pine with presence of hops, medium body, good carbonation, rather bitter, slightly sweet, lightly harsh texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS 

Verre, 5 onces, à la brasserie, savourée le 5 juillet 2011 
œil : cuivrée, limpide, pas d’effervescence, mousse blanc cassé qui se transforme en un petit anneau, beaucoup de dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, pamplemousse, pin, très léger orange; bouche : houblon résineux, pin, pamplemousse, très léger malt, très léger caramel, longue finale en pin avec présence de houblon, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, plutôt amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement rugueuse; en résumé : bien bon

Pours a clear golden copper, with little head and an equally small amount of lace.  Nice aroma of grass and citrus.  Flavor is citrus and citrus fruit rind with a finish that is slightly bitter, but clean.

Bottle from Tesco.....Golden amber, hazy, frothy average white head......Fairly strong aroma of grassy, resin and spicy hop with hay .....Taste  - mixture of grassy, ctirus, resin and spicy hops but only lightly astringent...sweet fruity malt background...finish of grass hop, some citric acidity leading to a bitter lingering hop finish.....Overall....Good tasting IPA, well-balanced and rounded, but some may want more of a hop-kick.

335ml bottle from Tescos, Hastings. Straw with a thin, loose, cream head; pungent, piney, resinous, aroma that really clears the sinuses with a touch of grapefruit thrown in for good measure; the taste is quite refined in comparison, not the slap in the face with a birch twig I was expecting - medium bodied with some fruity malts, slightly oily; then the hops start to build towards the finish, spicy and dry, leaving a long warming floral finish. Excellent.
One of my favorite IPAs. Extremely hoppy (resin) and very complex (perhaps some caramel) with a dry and bitter finish.
355ml bottle, Tesco. Pours almost golden, nice ’typical’ IPA aroma. Totally refreshing, Left me with a good feeling this one.

Very solidly good ipa.Bear county is somewhat similar to this.Nice creamy head with good lacing,gold color which happen to be most of my favorite ipa color.Good spice herbal resiny roast malt aroma floral/candylike.with some fruit and sweetness.Flavor mirrors aroma ,very good hop flavor with some light toast dry malt tbalanced with a light sweetness both from hops and malt,short lived bitter that lingers shortly and softly with a clean sweet finish.Leaving you with a good taste in your mouth
Pub. 355 ml, bottled. Cloudy amber, ringed head. Aroma: Hops, sour milk, caramel, mint. Taste: Pleasant bitterness, malty flavours. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation. Nice malty finish. Dry.

Pale amber, clear beer. Minimal white head. Somewhat hoppy nose, resiny pint forest, tight citrus, some cantaloupe and green tea. Grainy, slightly worty maltines. Some medium dark caramel and biscuit. Bittrish aftrrtaste has good duration. Surprisingly rich maltiness for such a light beer. Medium bodied, smooth and rich texture. Very good for the strength.

pours a golden to slight copper color with a fluffy head and good lacing.  the aroma is critrus, piney, some malt.  the flavor is nice and citrus up front followed by a nice malt body and finished with almost a pineapple taste.  the palate is a medium to heavier body.  overall its is a nice crisp beer with a dry finish, this isnt the best i have ever had but its pretty good for being part of AB.
Very nice. A dry finish to this citrusy, piney beer. Smooth, almost sweet flavor. Pours a nice golden yellow with mid-sized head. Not bad for such a mass-produced beer.

355 ml bottle. Finland.

Cloudy pale golden colour with tiny white head.
Very fruity sweetness, sweet caramel malt, peach, pineapple and mild alcohol in aroma. Bitter sweet hops, mild alcohol and grainy floury malt in flavour. Very easy IPA but still not tasteless.

On tap at GI Wrigley pub. Aroma: Floral hops and light pepper, very fresh. Appearance: Gold pour with meidum white foam. Taste: Quite bitter, floral hoppiness and nice refreshing finale. Palate: Full bodied and meidum carbonation. Overall: Good well-made IPA.

Had this on draft at GI-Clybourn in a pint glass.  Slightly hazy amber pour.  Clean grapefruit finish.  Slightly floral on the nose.  Nice bitterness but balanced, not overdone.  The malt really creates a dry IPA.
On draft for Goose Island night at Rattle & Hum, NYC.   Not a standout within the IPA style.  Fruit notes in aroma and flavor along with hops.
Gold-amber in color.  Nice citrusy hops in the aroma - lemon, orange, lime.  Solid citrus bitterness held up by a decent malt background.  Nothing outlandish, just a very good IPA.

Sehr hopfiger Geruch, dazu etwas süßlich. Stark hopfiger Antrunk, unterstützt durch eine würzig-süße Note. Im Mittelteil lässt das Aroma keinesfalls nach, die Hopfigkeit ist auf konstant hohem Level, auch der süße Ton bleibt bestehen. Die ausgeprägte Hopfigkeit zieht deutlich zu erkennen eine bittere Spur hinter sich her, die im Nachgeschmack, nach abklingen der Hopfigkeit, deutlich stärker wird. Auch die Würzigkeit wird kurzzeitig stärker. Solch ein aromenstarkes Bier bei 5% - hat schon was! 	 
Test vom 11.6.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,12,11,11,8,12 - 11,50

Dark colour of urine after much fasting and dehydration for spl celebration during ramadan period. Tasting of tropical citrus fruits and then becomes musty like old cloth or even damp basement area. Not very simpal supar and what I would expect from indian region of  strong ales with much hop and vigor.
It poured a clear golden color with a white head. The aroma was caramel, hops, pine needles and malts. The flavor was sweet malts. A very well balanced beer, but quite light in every aspect.

355 ml. bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Cloudy golden-orange with a medium white head, and some nice laceing. Wonderful hop aroma, citrusy and spicy with a hint of pine. Flavor starts with malt then leads to strong hop flavor, fruity and citrusy, medium to heavy bitterness in the finish, lively carbonation. A nice crisp IPA

Bottle (35 cl) from Ölbutikken, Copenhagen, Denmark. Clear deep golden, medium white head. Piney, resiny, and slightly perfumy hop aroma. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium earthy bitterness.

Pours cloudy yellow colour with an average white head that tries to disappear. Strong and nice spiced aroma, grass and fermented fruit hints. Refreshing taste, light sweetness, lightly bitter (to light in my opinion to be IPA). Medium body, oily feel, average to soft carbonation, and a short light bitter and dry after taste. Ok.

Golden colour body with white foam. The head quickly decreases but ramain as a thin white lid on top. Sweet and fruty aroma with hops, escpecially of pine. First sip is bitter and quite hoppy and has a clear pine taste. I also detect some roastyness in the mouthfeel. Dry finish. Very drinkable!

Nice but simple. The head doesn’t stick around for too long. Relatively light carbonation; a great, hoppy aroma with hints of pineapple; and a reasonably bitter taste that is very accessible for an IPA. Overall, very nice and drinkable. Points off because I was expecting a bit more body.
Pours slightly hazy yellow with a low head. Aroma is fruits, flowers and hops. Flavor is very well balanced, mostly malts and hops. Refreshing but full.

16 May 2011, bottle. yellow, some sediment in the bottle, no bubbles. great citrus, grapefruit nose. not much else. med/thin and slightly fizzy. bitter lemon rind. nice. not too bitter but certainly an american ipa.

355ml bottle. Pours golden orange with steady bubbles and a good head. The nose has generous grapefruit, grapefruit pith and pine. The taste has more grapefruit and pine. The palate is medium bodied, creamy in texture and with a long zingy bitter finish. Overall, this is a great beer which could lead to several more.

On draft at Clybourn goose island brewpub. This was a very good IPA. I’m not a fan of IPAs usually. Little head, thin ring, light/amber color. Medium body. Semi sweet from caramel. Aroma is citrus hops and distinguished grapefruit aroma and taste. I am going to guess they used cascade and amarillo hops in this one. High citrus aroma and crips, clean, and non lingering finish. B
Keg at Bacchus, Newcastle. Slightly hazy pale amber. Nose is thick, fruity hops. Just as it should be. Juicy and bitter with a strong caramel malt backbone. Snappy and sweet.

Bottle - 12oz. Golden/light amber body with average carbonation and a decent white foamy head. Fresh hoppy aroma with citrusy hints. Its well balanced hoppy taste carries fruity and some bready notes. Ends with a good bitter finish. Enjoyable IPA.
Bottle from Appellation Wines, Edinburgh. Hoppy pine aroma. Pale golden yellow colour, not much head. Mild sweet hoppy pine flavour, quite smooth. Comes in nice bottle. My kind of beer.
Bottle at JohnMurdoch. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma is pine hops, citrus, bit of herbs. Flavour is light malted, citrus, fairly hopped. Slight bitter finish.

Bottle 12 oz. Slightly hazy yellow pour with a big creamy white head, long shelf life. The aroma is very malty, but notes of citrus maybe pineapple, grapefruit and weak. The taste fills the malty taste again, giving no sweetness. Good creamy mouthfeel, but a little flat litter acid. Overall, an IPA in the light end without much bitterness in taste and aftertaste.

Draft @ Yankees Stadium. Poured into a plastic 20oz cup, this brew has a nice golden amber color with a smooth white head. This beer has a grassy and pine-like hop flavor with a decently bodied finish.
Light golden, clear. Big white head. Sweet and not much hoppy for an IPA. Broad palate. Not my favourite IPA.
Amber pour, sweet and malty for an ipa, hop flavor with good embracing bitterness
Refreshing and easy. Pretty much your typical IPA without standing out but not bad at all. Just a solid well balanced IPA. Decent enough

Bottle. Poured into a tulip glass a clear orange straw color with a i finger off white head. Pretty nice citrus aroma both with bitter and sweet notes. Medium mouthfeel. Sweet orange, grapefruit, and slight mango flavors with a drawn out bitterness that lingers on. Not overly bitter by any means but a it has a nice bite. Head has fairly good retention and leaves some lace on the glass. Overall, this is a pretty nice IPA that I would have no problem ordering or buying again.

Bought in Kansas City. I didn’t see the bottled on date until I got home and realized that it is 4 months old. Hazy gold pour, thick white head. Aroma is lemony, bitter grain husk, apple, fairly oxidized. Taste is herbal with some resinous bitterness on the finish, not much sweet citrus flavor. Seems more English than American but that could just be because of the age. I need to buy this again and look at the date next time.

355 ml bottle at Oluthuone Kaisla, Helsinki, 18/03/2011. Hazy amber colour, creamy head. Aroma of grapefruit, peach and piney hops. The flavour is caramel-malty, fruty, with an aromatic hoppy finish. Medium-bodied, moderately carbonated. Tasty and enjoyable.
Stand up IPA.  Pours amber with citrus notes right up front.  Bitter notes come through the palate and the finish which taper off into some light spice as well.

Bottle from Wholefoods Market, London. Pours darker shade of golden amber. Thin head and nice lacing in the glass. Nose is citrous and floral hop character. Taste is very high quality American version of IPA. All about the grapefruit kick baby, but some nice pineapple and pine notes in there too and caramel coming through really nicely on the finish. Really nicely balanced malt with the grapefruit kick.

Reviewed from notes.

Poured into a tulip glass. Color is a moderately-dark copper color with a white head and some pretty decent lacing. The nose strikes a really nice balance for an English IPA, with a good amount of floral and lightly earthy hops along with a bot of caramel malt in the background.

The nose flows straight into the taste which is just a bit hoppy and bitter over a fairly complex malt base. As much as I love my C-hops, occasionally somethig like this just really hits the spot. Great feel and drinkability; this is a real winner.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-12-2010
Fairly average.  Not much going on for me aroma-wise.  Very little maltiness, but the piney hops taste is quite strong.  Kind of one dimensional and average.  Lighter than most IPAs.
Solid IPA, easy drinking, nothing outstanding, but light and hoppy, slightly fruity, very smooth, good session ipa, not too strong either which is great for session.

12 oz. bottle, pours hazy golden with a small white head. Great aroma of grapefruit, citrus and piney hops, and caramel malt. The flavour reveals an intense fruitiness, of mango, peach, grapefruit and orange, with pungent citrusy hops and just enough malt backing. Very well made.

I had this on tap at Bad Apple into a tulip...The beer pours a dark gold with hints of orange, pretty clear. The head is white and fluffy with good retention and lacing...The aroma is really nice, its mostly just smooth hops, not overpowering a little yeast on the finish...The taste is super nice. Its an easy to drink ipa that delivers very smooth hops. Easy to drink, could crush this all night long.
Earlier Rating: 3/23/2011 Total Score: 3.4
It pours a medium cloudy gold with a big head, nice retention, ok lacing.

The aroma is light hops buts that pretty much all you get. 

The taste is rather boring, with hints of lemon and hops. Mouthfeel is pretty good, can’t crush this.
Bottle at Brewwharf. Pours a deep amber, with a medium off white head. Aromas of citrus, toffee, caramel, passionfruit, mandarin, light floral, and a slight biscuitiness. Bitter finish.

Hazy, orange color with quickly disappearing white head. Hoppy aroma of pine and grapefruit. Taste is quite similar, with some grassy notes and a maltbase, that is just a touch too sweet for my palate. And much too smooth. Not the best american IPA, I’ve had.

Pours a lovely bight lemon rind yellow with a visible viscosity and almost no head. Nose is kind of grassy and sweet with some hay. Some straw in the flavor and mild grassy notes. Bitterness sticks around.

12 oz Bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy orange color with light, quickly dissipating head.  Nose is citrus including orange and a little lemon plus sweet malts and nice dose of grass and floral hops.  Taste is similar to the nose with the orange and sweetness being balanced by grassy and floral hops.  Nice strong hop flavor but not overly bitter.  Great mouthfeel with light crispness, lively carbonation, and smooth aftertaste.  Good IPA.

Bottle. Dark orange color with thin white head. Hoppy aroma with pine and grapefruit. Taste of more hops, some grassy dryhopping, and a kind of thick feeling sweet maltiness. A great beer this one actually

Delicious easily drinkable India pale ale, with the odd goose on the label. Really good flavor from the American hops. Despite the
good hoppy flavor its almost a cross between a pale ale and an IPA.

fruity aroma is strong, malt undertones.  orange, hazy, with minimal head.  good bitterness, lingering aftertaste.  I think this might not be the best bottle.  I’ve enjoyed this beer more than this before.

A: The beer pours a surprisingly hazy orange color with a finger of white head that has pretty poor retention.

S: Smells fairly sweet, but mostly of sweet citrus fruit such as orange and perhaps kumquat. Toasted grain and malt with a bit of bread and toffee to go along with it. Some mild grassy and floral hop notes, too.

T: Sweet just like the nose. Bread and caramel with some sweet orange and orange peel. Slightly bitter with maybe just a hint of pine. Some more of those floral and slightly earthy hop notes to it.

M: The body is medium with a moderate carbonation.

D: Not what I’m really accustomed to with the American IPA being my weapon of choice for the broader style. Not awful, though.

12 oz bottled on 09/21/10...poured golden yellow with a slight orange hue, nice head retention, white and fluffy...aroma of citrus, pine, caramel...medium bodied beer (light for an IPA), average carbonation, with a slight bitter finish. Overall, just a straight forward well balanced IPA that I enjoyed quite a bit.
A generic IPA. This one has mild hops, and is fairly malty. It is a bit watered down imo.

Bottle. Pours golden orange with an average head. Aroma was hoppy with piney and citrus hops, grapefruit and a touch of caramel. Flavor was sweet and bitter with caramel, citrus, grapefruit, pine and had a bitter and dry finish

Tasted on 2/16/11 on draft at the Clybourn Brewpub.  Pours clear golden orange with an average white head that leaves spotty lace.  The nose is pine resin and orange hops with light earth and some bread malt.  The flavor is light bread malt up front, but hops are the focus with resin, citrus peel, and a good amount of dust and earth.  The body is light with a ton of carbonation and a long bitter and earthy finish.

12 oz bottle courtesy dchmela. Bottled on 12/28/10. This pours a clear, bright golden orange color and topped by a smooth head of off white foam that slowly settles to a thin film. The foam leaving scattered spots of lacing around the glass. The aroma shows notes of orange citrus and grapefruit hops over a malt base of buttery toffee. The flavor follows suit with the orange and grapefruit hops up front followed by the toasted toffee malt to balance things out. The hops add an ample amount of bitterness on the back end. Medium bodied with lively carbonation that leads to a citrus hop bitter finish. Pretty nice ipa, but nothing that really wows you.
draft at a dive hotel in dayton, ohio.  a solid IPA...slight citrusy grapefruit flavor, nice hoppy finish.  a pleasant find at such a dump hotel.
Hazy amber with a white head. Aroma is caramel and hoppy - grapefruit and peach. Flavor is rather sweet and rather bitter. Finish is nicely, lasting bitter and dry. Very good IPA. 181010

Thanks to my buddy Justin for hauling this back in a snowstorm. Dark gold pour with a thick white head. Floral, resiny citrus hop aroma. Light yet complex. Taste is crisp clean malt, touch of caramel and a nice clean hop bitterness. Good stuff.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a thin white head. Smells of citrus and grass, maybe some herbs. Good taste with much grass and some citrus. The finish is with good hops that stays on for 20 seconds. A good ipa.
As close to a blue collar IPA as there ever will be.  Rather easy to drink, not too dry, but still has a big hop bite to it, a classic.
Poured deep yellow with a small head. Good balance with a nice bitter finish. Liked this one.

Pours a light golden cor with a full white fluffy head.  Rich resiney pine and sweet caramel malts fill the nose.  Prickly bitter hops are felt initially on the tongue followed by sweet malts and q nice cereal grain finish.  Real nice IPA.
Bottle. Poured orange copper in colour with white head. Aroma is citrus, pine and grapefruit. Flavour similar. Very good beer. Refreshing and crisp
A very nice IPA here.  Good hop aroma, great bitterness and balance w/malts--rounds out with pineapple hop flavor yummy
pretty standard tasting for an ipa. i wasnt expecting much but this beer turned out to be quite good.
I liked this one, it had a golden colour  pours light head, good taste, well balanced hoppiness and overall good beer
Bottle. Pours light brown with head that retains. Overall not bad. I thought it would have been better. Good offering.
35,5cl bottle @Kaisla, Helsinki. Poured copper color with a white head. Aroma is fresh and hoppy, citrus and grapfruit. Flavor similar, very hoppy, finish is quite bitter. Very drinkable, nice IPA.

Bottle 355ml @ home

Pours cloudy orange with a off-white head, Aroma has notes of caramel, pine and fruity hops. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

0.355l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a nice slightly hazy golden/light orange body with a solid creamy head. Aromas strong on the sweet fruity hops, some citrus and pine.   Mild and inviting aroma. Mouth feel; Roasted malts, a hint watery, but not to much, medium carbonated, medium to thin bodied. Decent fruity and bitter ending.
On tap. Good IPA. Aromas of grass and caramel. Taste is bitter, with a long finish. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Orange, with a frothy head.

Aroma is hints of floral, and citrus, especially grapefruit.  Pours a hazy dark golden or light amber. Light, white, foamy head which dissipates rather quickly.  Taste is of medium hops build, less than your typical IPA, but delicious nonetheless.  Runs smooth through the palate with a dry finish.  Overall, I would recommend this to those who aren’t quite ready for a full bodied IPA.  Not a knock on goose, as this is a great drinking IPA.
Golden in color... Aroma is faint, citrusy hops... Flavor is fairly light, piney and citrus hop bitterness... Tastes more like a pale.. Okay at best
Hoppy aroma.  Clearish gold in color.  Sweet with a light hop balance.  A nice "gateway" IPA.
Poured from 12oz bottle, pours a hazy light orange with a frothy white head, aroma is of piney hops and the flavor is pretty balanced between the malt and hops, decent.

Bottled at Monk’s Sveavägen
Hazy golden with a small, white head.
Pretty sweet and creamy aroma.
Sweet and malty flavour with a medium bitterness. Some tropical fruits.
Aroma is good, full of hops.. abrasively in fact.   Tastes more citrusy and less hoppy than I imagined.  A little thin.  Very good IPA.

Rich amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of floral hops, & citrus; Flavor of pine hops, malt, citrus (notably grapefruit), and some caramel; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, good brew.

12 ounce bottle courtesy of thetomG (Secret Santa Winter 10). Pours a clear pale amber color with a medium sized frothy head. Good head retention and lacing. The aroma is loaded with floral hop notes and also has notes of citrus hops, caramel and nutty notes. The taste is bitter leafy and earthy hops, some nutty notes, and a faint citrus hop and caramel finish. Medium bodied. Quite nice.

Bottle pours orange-amber with white head. Aroma shows notes of peach, grapefruit, and pine. Flavor shows the same with additional caramel/biscuit malt backbone. Overall body is moderate, sticky and dry with a moderately bitter finish.

12oz twist-off bottle.  Bottled on 05/26/09.  golden amber color, thin white head.  Aroma of honey and citrus hops.  Flavor has a touch of honey, caramel malt, pale malt, and heavy bitter hops.  Finishes with an Alpha bite and some wood.  Not a bad American IPA, I really enjoyed this.

Bottle @ Home. Pours light golden with nice white head. Aroma of sweet malts, light caremel, grassy and citrusslike hops. Taste is balanced malty, caremel, fruity bitternes, citruss, light grapefruit. Medium body, easy drinking.

On tap at the brewpub in Chicago. Clear brassy gold. Intense, huge aroma of blood oranges, mango, light pine. Equally intense bitter citrus fruit hoppiness, tropical fruits, sweet caramel malts. In an evening filled with great brews, this was a standout. So delicious!
Floral and sweet malt aroma with a slightly tart citrus scent and a slight tinge of alcohol. Great taste of floral Cascade hops and sweet malt flavor with hints of citrus and alcohol. Very good!

[11/10] Bottle. Cloudy amber with an off-white head. Nose has grapefruit, caramel, pine, passionfruit. Taste is sweet then bitter, with light caramel and some tropical fruits followed by citrus and pine bitterness. The sweetness is moderate and not cloying but rather insubstantial; the hop flavours good if straightforward. Nice creamy mouthfeel. [3.6] 

 [10/17] An Australian-brewed ( by CUB) version under Goose's supervision. Clear amber with a modest white head. Much the same otherwise with a noticeably fresher peppery bite at the end. Not exactly cutting edge but a good beer.

aroma: sharp grapefruit aroma
appearance: golden amber with a nice head with some decent lacing
taste: crisp bitterness
palate: somewhat creamy mouthfeel but has a nice bitter aftertaste
overall:  decent IPA.  I was happy to see it out East after enjoying it in Wrigleyville a few years ago.

My tasting bottle was old - over a year old. Not good for an IPA’s bitterness.

Pours a nice orange haze.  Aroma is somewhat sweet. Taste is still somewhat hoppy, with light dry malt. Medium thickness.

I should try it fresh - or should have gotten it while at the Goose Island Pub in Clybourne last week - whoops.

On tap at Blind Tiger.  Pours a pale orange color with a thite foam head.  Has an aroma of citrus and heavy pine.  Has a creamy bitter taste.  Grapefruit notes on the finish.  Some caramel throughout.  Nice dry clean finish.  Good hop hit.

Notes from Friday, June 25, 2010
12 oz. bottle from Hyvee Marion

Ar: Nice grapefruit nose with a good deal of piney hop.
Ap: Pours a pale copper/light amber with a pillowy 1" head of tightly knit white bubbles.  The head leaves a good deal of lace as it dissipates.
T: Classic citrus/light piny hops on the nose.  Good piney hop bitterness on the finish.
P: Medium body with a nice creaminess from the head.

O: Great sessionable IPA.

Bottle. Hazy golden orange pour with a lasting, fluffy beige head. Aroma is quite hoppy with notes of grapefruit, lemon, passionfruit and melon. There is also, along with some malty caramel, an underlying sweetness in both aroma and flavour that is kind of unusual, suggesting hints of butterscotch and bubblegum. Smooth, slightly creamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation and a lingering bittersweet finish. Nice and sessionable IPA although the sweetness might get to be a bit much after a couple.
From bottle. A clear light brown golden color. Light fruity aroma but not as prominent as I expected considering its strong hoppy character. Potent ipa flavor with a lingering bitter palate. Tasty!

My favorite keg at the stube so far. A delightful little ipa. Glowing gold color, nice pale ale malt body and a very fresh and pungent hop aroma that mixes two C’s quite well with goldings and styrians. The fruitiness and spiciness that results works quite well.

The aroma is intense but well-balanced with prominent notes of grapefruit, honey, and orange. Flavor is hoppy with some lemon, orange, and BIG TIME grapefruit.. Very well-balanced. Soft mouthfeel with a low-moderate level of lingering hoppiness. I expected this to be more in-your-face, but it’s surprisingly delicate. I’m not a fan of hoppy beers, that being said, I found myself liking this one.  It could be a nice starter to introduce someone to this style.  Not a SUPER bitter finish, well put together IPA!

Bottle at Monks, Svevägen, Stockholm. Hazy orange color, small head. Fruity aroma, citrus, grassy notes, some cream and some apples. Fruity hoppy flavor, citrus, grass and some milky notes. Fruity finish.
Bottle. Hazy amber coloru wtih a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, floral, hops, malt and caramel.

Tap, bottle, this is common in central Iowa. A velvety, medium full body, just the right touch on the palate.  Hops are smooth, with an even balance between bitterness, flavor, and aroma. A fine IPA, and one I like to enjoy regularly.

On tap at Birdsall House during their Goose Island event.  Pours a hazy orange brown with a thin white head.  Light caramel, faint hops, a touch of sweet fruit.  I’m wondering if this is 3 months old at this point or if they did a second batch, but I’m guessing the former.  Medium bodied, a touch sweet.  Creamy, long sweet  finish with a touch of grapefruit.  Tasted a bit like old IPA.  
Earlier Rating: 11/20/2008 Total Score: 3.3
Bottle. Pours a clear golden honey color with a thick white head.  Aromas of citrus and hops, with a light hint of pine.  Smooth and clean mouthfeel leading into a slowly developing and lingering finish with layers of hops and bitterness.   The beer itself is almost watery, but as it is not tainted with any off flavors, it simply makes this a very easy drinking IPA.

bottle at the Chicago airport Goose Island restaurant on 9/19/10.  deep orange pour with a slim white head.  solid citrus hop nose.  medium body with an aggressive bitterness along with a sweet caramel malt back.  smooth sides, spice tip with nice carbonation.  balanced bitter / malt finish.  nice IPA.

On tap @ Specific Gravity, Salisbury Md-Off orange pour w/a moderate head. Pitchy hop aroma. Flavors of pine, hops, some grapefruit, kind of a standard IPA, but a pretty good one. Not to much of a hop bomb, pretty drinkable

a really nice IPA that is somewhere in between an east coast west coast version, not too hoppy that it becomes a meal, and not too malty that it stops being an eglish pale ale. Absolutely delicious and ranks up there with the best of them.

On tap at  the power plant. Nose is bright, with grapefruit, orange, and floral notes. Taste is big cascade, and just some light malt character. good lace and head retention. slick mouthfeel. nice balanced bitterness. a nice beer.
Thanks Barban for sharing. What a way to start of a rainy weekend. Classic, fuity ipa with notes of grape and peach. The taste is fresh but needs a little more body. But still a lovely ipa.
Thanks Høkeren, Copenhagen, for sharing this wonderfull IPA. A classic IPA with a nice fruity flavour.

355 ml bottle @ Tuomari. Rated @ 11.8.2009.

Clear  golden colour with a white head. The aroma is caramel sweet, hops, pine needles and malts. Hoppy flavour with sweet malts on the side. Light/medium bodied, oily/watery texture and soft carbonation. Well balanced but quite light in every aspect. (8+3+7+3+15, 3.6)



355 ml bottle. BBE 08.09.2012.

Pours a yellow colour with a white, thick, frothy and lacy head. Aroma of exotic fruits, floral hops and some pine needles. Flavour of floral hops, exotic fruits, pale malts, citrus, caramel and pine needles. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a bitter, floral and sweet finish. Slightly better than last I time had this.
I really liked this beer. Strong hop level but balanced nicely. Almost creamy textures at times. Serving: Bottle

On tap at Elephant & Castle in Chicago.  Pours a clear orange straw color. Big white head with very good retention. Wonderful aroma of piney hops. Flavor is grass and earthy hops, but with a hint of toffee sweetness and roasted grains.  Medium mouthfeel and lingering floral hop finish.  Nice.

Hazy warm golden. A really nice white/beige head that says "come drink me now!!" Aroma is butterscotch, peanuts and freshly baked bread. Some floral notes aswell. Taste is sweet, juicy and hoppy.  Also a lot of floral flavours, bergamot and orange peel. Sustaining bitter finish. Very drinkable. A bit too sweet for my liking but still a very solid IPA.

Rating #406, bottle from Fish N’ Beer, brought by Amer 
 


A bit unclear, dark golden beer with a little head. Aroma is strawberries, blackberries, elderflower, redcurrant, malts and cascade hops. 
Flavor is berries, especiall redcurrant and blackberries, but also a lot of bitterness starting already before the finish. Seems more bitter than a lot of other IPA’s, mainly because the bitterness isn’t isolated in the finish.
Medium body and carbonation. Quite nice.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a clear golden color with a medium off-white head that lasts throughout and leaves decent lacing. The aroma has quite a bit of malt with really nice citrus and floral notes. Excellent forward flavor of the pale ale malt with a finish that is spicy and floral. Extremely well balanced. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Really nice IPA

Goose Island really came through to create an "everyday" IPA that is perfect for a nice session.  Spicy hops and clean finish with no fuss.  No odd aftertaste or overly bitter hops that seem to appear in many other IPAs.  This might be favorite non-DIPA.
